loans.name: Yusif

texts.en: O. Yusif is 43 years old,  married and has 4 children. He is a successful animal breeder and businessman. He opened his small farm in 1999 from money  lent by his friends and used the money to buy his first cow. In 2006, with a loan from Aqroinvest CU, he purchased his second cow. Now, his aim is to purchase calves for meat purposes.

loans.use: Purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en: Q. Rahim lives in Varkhandi village in Saatli. He is 41 years old,  married and has four children. He runs a small farm and breeds animals for meat purposes. His large family needs more funds for their needs. He decided to enlarge his business and apply for a 1200 USD loan. With this loan he is going to purchase one cow and one calf.

loans.use: Purchase of one cow and one calf

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en: Q. Tofiq is 21 years old. He is a young businessman and owner of a small farm. Aqroinevst CU has approved his application this year for a 1200 USD loan to purchase 1 cow and 1 calf.

loans.use: Purchase of one cow and one calf

loans.name: Bahadur

texts.en: R. Bahadur is is 45 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He became Chief of his own farm in 1996 when he purchased one milk cow. To cover his family expenses, Bahadur wants to purchase one more milk cow and sell milk to local people and buy one more calf. For this purpose his application has been approved by Aqroinvest for a loan of 1200 USD.

loans.use: Purchase of one milk cow and one calf

loans.name: Khurshud

texts.en: S. Khurshud lives in Fatalikend village in Saatli. He is 44, married and has 5 children. He is the owner of a small farm where he is breeding calves for meat purposes. He is a very successful businessman and to broaden his farming he needs a loan of 900 USD to purchase more calves.

loans.use: Purchase of two calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a welding machine for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his stock of bricks.

loans.name: Santos Veronica

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Santos Verónica and my main activity is sales. I have a traveling makeup business in which I sell by taking orders. I have dedicated many years to this type of activity. I am a single mother and with the income I earn, I am able to cover our family’s expenses. I need to increase the variety of my products, because of the increase of my products’ demand. I need to make a larger investment, but I don’t have enough funds.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Santos Veronica, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de cosmeticos de manera ambulante y por encargo, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, soy madre soltera y con los ingresos que persibo de este negocio, cubro los gastos de mi familia, actualmente necesito surtir mas ya que el volumen de venta cada día es mayor, por lo que necesito mayor inversión y no cuento con el capital suficiente.

loans.use: Purchase of body lotions, shampoo, lip gloss, and lipstick.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Reina Isabel and I am dedicated to sales. I sell shoes to men and women and own a store called “EXCLUSIVO KEISA". It is located in the downtown area of my city. I have dedicated 3 years to this type of activity. I have 3 children in school. With the income I earn, I am able to help my husband with our family’s expenses. My biggest need at this time is to refurbish the store in order to better serve my clients.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Reina Isabel, mi actividad es el comerico, cuento con un negocio de venta de calazado para ambos sexos, llamado EXCLUSIVO "KEISA", ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, tengo 3 hijos en la escuela y con los ingresos que persivo de este negocio puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente mi mayor necesidad es acondicionar mejor el local para atender mejor a los cliente.

loans.use: Purchase of women's shoes, sandals, and purses; purchase of men's shoe, sneakers

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu K. is 26 years old and married with three children.  She runs her small market stall business in Magburaka town in Sierra Leone.  Assisted by her husband, she sells essential commodities such as sugar, peanut butter, salt, etc.  The young couple plans to expand their business by renting another stall in the market where her husband could participate in the selling of other items.  She is requesting the loan to diversify and expand their business.

loans.use: To diversify her business by expanding to a second market stall

loans.name: Reina Marina

texts.es:
Mi nombre es Laura Isabel, mi actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de Rosquillas, producto que distribuiyo de manera ambulante en mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tip de actividad, negocio que inicie con esfuerzo propio, debido a la necesidad sentida, ya que mi esposo se dedica a la agricultura y estoy ingresos se ven una vez al año, por lo que habia que bucar forma de tener ingreso diarios para los gastos familiares. gracias a este negocio mis hijos tienen la opurtunidad de estudiar.

My name is Laura Isabel, I make donuts and sell them in the streets of my community. I have dedicated many years to this type of activity, a business I started with personal effort driven by need. My husband is in agriculture and his income is seen only once a year, in turn we needed a daily income to meet the family expenses. Thanks to this business my children have the opportunity to study.

loans.use: Compra de queso, leche, maiz y leña//  Purchase of cheese, milk , and firewood

loans.name: Namusu

texts.en: Mamusu K. is forty-five years old with four children. Her husband’s income alone is insufficient to meet all the family’s expenses.  Mamusu runs a small business of selling chilli peppers wholesale and retail.  She purchases the peppers in bags from the villages and sells them to retailers in Magburaka town (Sierra Leone).  In order for Mamusu to continue to make a good profit, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to increase her inventory.

loans.use: Increase inventory of chilli peppers sold wholesale and retail

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan R. has a stall selling household objects. He would like to be able to widen the variety of products and wooden objects that he sells so that he could sell them house to house. He has some employees so that he can sell more too. He needs a loan of $1,200 to buy wooden furniture and to give other people work. However, more than anything he wants to give his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Juan R. tiene su negocio de venta de productos para el hogar ambulantemente desea contar con mas variedad de productos y artículos de madera para vender casa por casa .Contar con empleados para ofrecer mejor sus productos. El necesita un préstamo de $ 1,200.00dlls. Con esto compraría muebles de madera y daría trabajo a otras personas. Pero sobre todo una mejor vida a su familia.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, household goods/ Comprar mercancía para artículos el hogar

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther B. lives in Magburaka town (Sierra Leone).  She is married, forty-four years old and the mother of three children.  Esther contributes substantially towards the family’s monthly income with the profits from her small business.  Her previous loan from SMT enabled her to purchase the fish wholesale and she was able to increase her income.  With this second loan she will increase her stock even more. Esther is determined to have enough income to properly educate her daughters.

loans.use: Increase stocks of fish

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu Kororma is married and mother of three children.  Her husband is an employee of the Ministry of Agriculture.  As a government employee, his income is inadequate to cater for all the family's needs.  To supplement her husband’s income, Kadiatu manages a fish selling business in Magburuka town (Sierra Leone). She also sells fish in weekly markets in various near-by villages.  She said she has many customers in the villages but can not always meet their demands.  She is therefore requesting a loan to increase her stock and better meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: Increase her stock of fish to meet increased demand

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Hola Mi nombre es Adelina, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia (venta de productos para sonsumo Humano), tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, mi negocio esta ubicado en la terminal de transporte de mi ciudad. Gracias a este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente la demanda a crecido por lo que necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer variedad de producto a mis clientes.

Hi, my name is Adelina, I have a small shop selling groceries. I have many years dedicating myself to this type of business. My business is located in the transportation terminal of my city. Thanks to this business I can contribute income to meet my family’s expenses. Currently, the demand has increased and I need to stock my business to be able to offer a variety of products to my clients.

loans.use: Compra de pollo, arroz, azucar, manteca, jabon, papel higienico, huevos y frijoles// Purchase of chicken, rice, sugar, lard, soap, toilette paper, eggs, beans.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en: Claudette J. provides her neighbors with essential supplies and food by running a small general store in her community of Munoz in the northern province of Puerto Plata in the Dominican Republic. Claudette is 29-years-old and raises her four children Angelo (16), Wendy (8), Luisa (12) and three-year-old Emilia. Claudette has been a successful participant in Esperanza's program in the past and is a member of an Esperanza Bank of Hope, which is a group of micro-entrepreneurs in a given community who go through business training and hold one another accountable to pay off their loans. With this $200 loan, Claudette plans to expand her clothing inventory in order to widen the variety of goods available at her shop.

loans.use: Expand clothing inventory

loans.name: Kerelie

texts.en:
Kerelie B. is a forty-seven year old mother of eight children. She started her food business when she was twenty-two years old but lost her business and everything the family had during the ten years of civil war in Sierra Leone.

After the war, Kerelie’s husband started petty trading in the town of Mogburaka but the income was mainly used immediately for family expenses with no savings. Kerelie then joined SMT and obtained a loan of $65 to expand her business which she had re-started with capital of $20. Her income supplements her husband's income and has improved the family livelihood. Kerelie is very much concerned about her children’s education and would like to expand her business to earn more income. She is now requesting a larger second loan.

loans.use: Increase her stock of food items at her market stall

loans.name: Leonice

texts.en: Leonice T. lives with Jean Claud Alfonso and together they raise her three children, Pedro Danilo , age 12; Usmilena, age 7; and one-year-old Jesus Manuel. Leonice is 32 years old and is from Haiti. This is her first year in business. Even though she has the equivalent of a 4th grade education, Leonice has now successfully completed business training and has demonstrated that she is able to handle this loan of $200 to expand her inventory of shoes and clothing, which she sells to the local community.

loans.use: Increase inventory of shoes & clothing

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata T. runs a business selling onions and hot peppers.  She is forty-five years old and married with three children.  Fatmata’s children are still young and in school.  Although her husband is employed as a driver, Fatmata needs to earn income to help support the family.  She runs her business in Magburaka town (Sierra Leone) and would like a loan so that she can purchase her products wholesale to earn more profit from her little business.

loans.use: Increase her inventory by purchasing wholesale

loans.name: Mimose

texts.en: Mimose F. is 30 years old and working to support her three young children by operating her own clothing store, which she has owned for more than two years. The savings she earns from her business goes to improve the health, living conditions and education of her children, 5-year-old Dariana F., 4-year-old Yulina and 2-year-old Arismendy. Mimose is requesting this $200 loan to purchase men and women's clothing to restock and increase her inventory. Her business is growing and she has shown that she can increase sales with a larger supply of product. This loan will not only improve her capital, but will decrease the number of trips she needs to make away from her family  to the regional market to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry T. is forty years old and married with four children. He sells second-hand clothes in Magburaka town (Sierra Leone). Once a week he takes the clothes to village markets. His business is the only source of income for the family.

To diversify his business, Henry would like a loan to purchase four bales of children's and women's clothes. He says that there is a high demand for these clothes in nearby villages. Henry is dedicated to providing his family the best of life.

loans.use: Diversify his stock of used clothing

loans.name: Alaude

texts.en: Aluade Jospeh is from Haiti and now lives with Santilis Silvestre in Munoz, Puerto Plata. Despite not knowing how to read or write, she has owned and operated her own business - a small grocery store based next to her home. She is requesting this loan so she will have the capital to purchase stores of her best-selling products: rice, sugar and cooking oil. Alaude has gone through Esperanza's business training program and is a member of a group of women who run their own micro-businesses in the same community. The meet every two weeks to pay off a portion of their loan together, exchange business advice as well as offer social support.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar & cooking oil

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul B. is married with four children. Forty-five years old, he runs a business selling second-hand clothes in the open-air market in Magburaka town (Sierra Leone).

With his previous loan from SMT, Abdul was able to expand his business. He is now requesting a loan of $175 to expand a bit more. He would also like to renovate his stall.

loans.use: Increase his stock of used clothing and renovate his small market stall

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.en: Isabelle M. is 60 years old originally from Haiti and lives with Chelise Misteler in Munoz, a small town in the northern region of the Dominican Republic. All of her children of grown up and moved out of the house. Isabelle spends most of her time running a general grocery store, providing food, beverages and basic household supplies to her community. She is requesting this loan of $150 to replenish her stock of sugar, beverages and rice, which are her most popular items. Isabelle receives ongoing support for her business as well as a place to develop relationships with the other women in her community who have created their own businesses. She meets every two weeks with the members of her solidarity group and their Esperanza loan advisor to repay their loans at Bank of Hope meetings.

loans.use: Invest in sugar, beer and rice

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria L. lives with L. Blanco and together they raise her six children, Yosel (19), Chidro (17), Mileni (15), Luissa (12) Yory (10) and Yulisa (7). Maria provides for her large family by running her own clothing store. However, her supply is relatively small but while her customer base is growing. Maria wishes to continue developing her business and has applied for this loan of $200. Maria will use the money to purchase pants from a regional market at low-cost to sell locally in her neighborhood.

loans.use: Increase inventory of pants

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa L. is forty-three years old, married with four children. The children are all in school. Her husband is also a petty trader selling rice, salt, and tomato paste in the market.

Hawa sells jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, and locally made beads. She started her business five years ago but could not expand it due to lack of capital. She then joined SMT.

Hawa would like to access a larger loan from SMT to purchase quality jewelry from the Republic of Guinea. She has many customers who are interested in better quality jewelry. She feels that with better quality, she would be able to earn more profit and improve her family's life.

loans.use: Improve the quality of her jewelry stock

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie Mardy is a 38-year-old from Haiti who now resides in a small community near the northern coast of the Dominican Republic. She has run her "Colmado Rosa" out of her home for more than two years. Marie has been approved for this loan of $150 to purchase sugar, milk and rice so she can restock her inventory. She has applied for this new loan so she can continue expanding her business, which is the source of income to support her children, Oscor (4), Martin (7), Estephani (8) and Piter (8).

loans.use: Purchase sugar, milk & rice

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. specializes in making peanut butter and roasted peanuts. She is a forty-year-old mother of five children and a widow. She recently obtained a stall in a government-owned market in Magburaka town (Sierra Leone).

Mary is the sole bread winner for her family and works hard to see that her children go to school. As Mary is dealing with a seasonal crop, she is requesting a loan of $175 to purchase ten more bags of peanuts and store them to be able to meet the demand during the period of scarcity in August and September. The loan will enable her expand her business and earn more income for the family.

loans.use: Purchase stock for the off-season

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu K. is forty years old with two children.  She lives in Momunta, one kilometer away from Magburaka town in Sierra Leone.  Married to a subsistence farmer, Isatu runs a small business at her home by the roadside selling foodstuffs.  That income supplements the food from her garden and provides for other family expenses.  Isatu would like to access a loan of $200 in order to expand her inventory and diversify into additional items.

loans.use: Increase and diversify her stock of foodstuffs

loans.name: Mummy

texts.en:
Mummy T. is thirty years old with two children and expecting her third one soon. Assisted by her husband, Mummy runs a small business selling personal care products and palm oil. She has no appropriate shelter for her business so she does the selling under a tree by the roadside near her house, a kilometer away from Mogburaka town in Sierra Leone.

Mummy would like to expand her business and would like a loan to purchase sixty gallons of palm oil to be able to stock up for the off-season period of July to October. The loan will also enable Mummy to build a small shelter for the business so she will be protected from rain and the hot sun.

loans.use: Increase stock for off-season and build shelter for business

loans.name: Isela Patricia

texts.es:
Isela Patricia is a very hard working woman and has a great desire to better herself. She is married and has a 12 year old daughter and an 8 year old son. Her husband is a factory worker where she lives. However, his salary is very low. In order to help with her home's expenses, Isela took an imitation jewellery course and has been making necklaces, bracelets and earings for five years. Having good quality products has helped her business grow and the number of clients increase continuously.

For her business to continue growing, Isela requires a loan of US $325. She will use this loan to purchase the raw material that she needs. She is committed to repay this loan within six months. Be part of this business' growth and help better this family's life. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Isela Patricia es una mujer muy trabajadora y con grandes deseos de superación, ella es casada y tiene una hija de 12 años de edad y un hijo de 8 años. Su esposo es obrero en una fábrica de su localidad, pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo, para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar Isela tomó un curso de bisutería y desde hace cinco años se dedica a este oficio. Ella confecciona pulseras, collares y aretes de piedras finas y la calidad de los productos que ella elabora la han ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar su número de clientes continuamente.

Para poder continuar creciendo e incrementar su producción Isela requiere de un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la compra de los insumos que necesita, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase imitation jewelery  raw material

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia has been selling cosmetics for over three years. She is married and has two little daughters. They were recently able to buy their own house. However, mortgage payments are withdrawn from her husband's salary and Claudia's family economy has suffered. This is why Claudia started this business. She started selling products amongst acquaintances and family members and little by little her number of clients has been incrementing and her business has grown.

Claudia needs a US$100.00 loan which she will use to buy more merchandise to be able to provide the products that her clients have requested. She wants to provide a good service in order to maintain her clients preference. She is committed to repay this loan within three months. Your help will be able to better this family's life. They appreciate and thank your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Translator.

Hace más de tres años Claudia se dedica a las ventas de cosméticos, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, recientemente pudieron adquirir su propia casa, pero los pagos hipotecarios son rebajados del salario de su esposo, razón por la que la economía familiar se vio afectada, ante esta necesidad Claudia empezó su negocio, inició sus ventas entre conocidos y familiares pero poco a poco ha incrementado su número de clientes y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

Claudia necesita un préstamo por $ 100 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los productos que le han solicitado sus clientes, ella quiere ofrecer un buen servicio para continuar con la preferencia de sus clientes y se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: José Isabel

texts.en:
Mr. José Isabel is married and has two children. One of them is in high school and the other is about to start his university studies. In order to pay for the household expenses and for his children's education, two years ago José decided to open his own bicycle repair shop and sales of spare parts. Before this, he worked for company doing the same type of work, but with the goal of providing a better income and quality of life to his family, he started his business in its own house. Luckily he has had a lot of work and was able to grow his business. Now we also goes out to sell in local markets with the help of his oldest son.

in order to buy the spare parts that he needs for his business, Jose is asking for a loan of $1,200 that he commits to pay back in 6 months. He will work hard to get his family and business ahead. Please help him to meet his goals. José and his family will be eternally grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor José Isabel es casado y tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos esta en secundaria y otro a punto de iniciar sus estudios universitarios, para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, José decidió abrir su propio taller de reparación de bicicletas y venta de refacciones hace dos años, anteriormente él trabajaba para una empresa realizando la misma labor, pero con la finalidad un mejor ingreso y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia empezó su negocio en su propio domicilio, afortunadamente ha tenido mucho trabajo y ha hecho crecer su negocio, ahora también sale a vender en los mercados rodantes donde recibe la ayuda de su hijo mayor.

Para comprar las refacciones que necesita en su negocio José solicita un préstamo por $ 1,200 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Él esta dispuesto a trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a su familia y su negocio, ayúdalo a lograr sus metas, José y su familia te lo agradecerán por siempre.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Mr. Guadalupe is married and has two small children. His wife is pregnant of their third child. He works for a company, but when he bought his own house, they started to discount the mortgage payments from his salary. And as a result he could not pay for all the household expenses, and he decided together with his wife to start selling groceries two years ago. This way they obtain an extra income that allows them to live better. They together work in the business and were able to make it grow and they want to turn it into a great success.

Since he started their store, he was able to increase its clientele and in order to provide them with a good service, he is requesting a loan of $325, which he will use to buy merchandise to increase is assortment.

Guadalupe commits himself to return this amount in five months. Play an important role in the well being of this family. Help them grow their business; they sincerely thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Guadalupe es casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos y está en espera de su tercer bebé. Él trabaja en una empresa pero al adquirir su propia casa, comenzaron a descontar los pagos hipotecarios de su salario, por esta razón no se podía cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar y entre él y su esposa decidieron iniciar con la venta de abarrotes desde hace dos años, de esta manera obtienen un ingreso que les permite vivir mejor, juntos atienden el negocio y han logrado sacarlo adelante, pero ellos desean que pueda creer y desarrollarse exitosamente.

En el tiempo que tiene su tienda ha logrado incrementar sus clientes y para darles un buen servicio ahora solicita un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para incrementar su variedad, Guadalupe se compromete a regresas esta cantidad en 5 meses. Se parte importante en el bienestar de esta familia, ayúdalos a hacer crecer su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria del Carmen has been selling shoes from catalogs for more than four years, after she suffered a work related accident and could no longer perform her normal job. Through sales she found a way to continue obtaining income for family. She has two adolescent sons that help her in her business, charging customers and delivering the products. She also has a small daughter. The wellbeing of her children is Maria’s greatest driving force to work hard every day despite her disability.

In order to increase her sales and provide a good service, Maria is requesting a loan of $325 that she will use to buy merchandise to fulfill the orders of her customers. She commits to repay the loan in four months. Your help will contribute to the development of this business, and to increase the quality of life of his family. Please help them out; they will be very thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria del Carmen se dedica a la venta de calzado por catálogo desde hace más de cuatro años, a raíz de que sufrió un accidente laboral se fracturó la cadera y quedó incapacitada para realizar el trabajo que normalmente desempeñaba, así fue como encontró en las ventas una forma de seguir obteniendo ingresos para su familia, ella tiene dos hijos adolescentes que la apoyan en su negocio en cobranza y entrega de lo productos, también tiene una pequeña hija. El bienestar de sus hijos es el motivo más grande que tiene Maria para salir a trabajar arduamente día a día, a pesar de su incapacidad.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas y brindar un buen servicio Maria solicita un préstamo por $ 325 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía con la que podrá surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 4 meses. Con tu ayuda contribuyes al desarrollo de este negocio y a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos, ellos te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Isidra

texts.en:
Mrs. Isidra is a single mother who has two married sons. She now lives alone with a grandchild, and she takes care of the cost of his studies and living expenses, the course she considers him to be one of her children. In order to obtain an income that allows her to increase the quality of their life five years ago she started her own business selling groceries. Her grandson helps her out, and together they have been able to get the business ahead and make it grow.

Through offering good service they have been able to increase their clientele and further develop the business. Now, Isidra is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to have a better variation of products. She commits to repay this amount in six months. Please become an important part in the life of this family. Help Isidra out, she sincerely thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Isidra es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que ya están casados, ahora ella vive sola con un nieto, y se encarga de cubrir los gastos de sus estudios y manutención, porque ella lo considera como un hijo más. Para poder obtener un ingreso que le permitiera mejorar su calidad de vida, desde hace cinco años inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, donde recibe la ayuda de su nieto, juntos han logrado sacar adelante el negocio y hacerlo crecer.

El buen servicio que ofrecen les ha permitido incrementar sus clientes y lograr un buen desarrollo del negocio, ahora Isidra solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, así tendrán una mayor variedad de productos, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, decídete a apoyar a Isidra, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Norma Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela is a young mother, responsible and hardworking. She has an eleven years old son who is starting secondary school. In order to obtain the income that will allow her to pay for her and her son’s expenses, Graciela sells several seasonal goods. The products that she sells most are cheese, desserts and shoes. She hopes that her son can finish his studies and will have better opportunities in his future. This is what Graciela works for everyday.

To fulfill customer orders and to increase the variety of the products she sells, Graciela requests a loan of $750 that she commits to pay back in 6 months. You can help improve the wellbeing of this family by helping Graciela to continue working. She and her son thank you for your trust and help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela es una joven madre, responsable y muy trabajadora, tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad el cual va a entrar a la secundaria, para obtener un ingreso que le permita cubrir los gastos de ella y su hijo Graciela realiza ventas de de diversos artículos varios de acuerdo a la temporada, los productos que más comercializa son quesos, postres y zapatos. Ella desea que su hijo pueda culminar sus estudios y tengas más oportunidades en su futuro, y para esto es que Graciela se esfuerza todos los días.

Para pode surtir los pedidos de sus clientes e incrementar la variedad de los productos que comercializa, Graciela solicita un crédito por $ 750 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar el bienestar de esta familia, ayudando a Graciela a que continúe trabajando, ella y su hijo agradecen tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.en:
Maria de Jesús is a hardworking and responsible woman. She is divorced and has three small children. The alimony she receives from her ex-husband is very low and is insufficient to pay for all the costs of her children. Because of this and to be able to take care of her children, Maria decided to open her own business selling groceries. She started with very few products but now she has increased a variety and made the business grow.

Luckily, she got the opportunity to buy a house, and in order to pay the mortgage she wants to grow her business even further. This is what she works for sale hard every day. She only needs a $325 loan, which she will use to buy merchandise and offer better service. She will repay this amount in three months. You can help to make the life of this family better. They sincerely thank you for your trust and help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de Jesús es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, ella es divorciada y tiene tres pequeños hijos, la pensión alimenticia que recibe de su exesposo es muy baja e insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de sus hijos, ante esta necesidad y para no descuidar a sus pequeños, Maria decidió abrir su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, inició con muy pocos productos pero ahora ha incrementado su variedad y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

Afortunadamente se le ha presentado la oportunidad de adquirir una vivienda y para poder cubrir la hipoteca desea que su negocio pueda creer aun más, para lo que trabaja arduamente todos los días, solo necesita un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía y ofrecer un mejor servicio, ella devolverá esta cantidad en 3 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria de los Ángeles lives alone with her husband because all of her children are married and don’t want be a burden to her. Because of their age, it is difficult for her and her husband to find a job. Therefore they decided to start their own business nine years ago. They have a store selling small goods, presents and groceries located in their own home. With this they have been able to pay for their expenses and they keep themselves busy. Their efforts, the friendship they have with their neighbors, and the time that they spend in their store have been key to the growth of the business.

At this moment Maria requests a loan of $550 that she will use to buy merchandise to offer a better variety and to remain the preferred business of her customers. She commits to repay this amount in 6 months. Become an important part of the life of this couple. They are thank you for your trust and the opportunity that you give them to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria de los Ángeles vive sola con su esposo ya que todos sus hijos son casados y no quieren representar una carga para ellos, por su edad es difícil para ella y su esposo conseguir un empleo, ante esta necesidad decidieron emprender su negocio hace más de nueve años, tienen una tienda de mercería, regalos y abarrotes ubicada en su propio hogar, con ésta han podido solventar los gastos de los dos y se han mantenido ocupados. El esfuerzo, la amistad que tienen con sus vecinos y el tiempo que le dedican a su tienda ha sido clave para el crecimiento de su negocio.

En estos momentos Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad y seguir contando con la donde preferencia de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de este matrimonio, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y la oportunidad que les das de mejorar.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe is married and mother of two small children. Her husband is a worker for a company in the town of Garcia, Nuevo León. However the salary he receives is very low to pay for all their family expenses. Recently they have had the opportunity to buy their own house, but this has considerably reduced the family income. In order to help her husband with the expenses, Maria decided to start selling used clothing. With this she is able to attain extra income while taking care of her children.

Little by little she was able to grow her business, and now she also sells her products in local markets which has incremented demand. In order to give good service and increase her merchandise she is requesting a loan of $550 that she will repay in six months. You can be an important part of the development of this business and increase the well-being of his family. Thank you very much for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Guadalupe es casada y madre de 2 pequeños hijos, su esposo se desempeña como obrero en una empresa de la localidad de García, Nuevo León, sin embargo, el salario que recibe es muy bajo para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia. Recientemente han tenido la oportunidad de adquirir su propia vivienda, pero esto ha reducido considerablemente el ingreso familiar, para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, Maria decidió realizar ventas de ropa usada con la que puede obtener un ingreso extra sin descuidar a sus hijos.

Poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio y ahora también comercializa sus productos en los mercados rodantes donde se ha incrementado su demanda y para poder dar un buen servicio e incrementar su mercancía solicita un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que regresará en 6 meses. Tú podrás ser muy importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y mejorar el bienestar de esta familia, muchas gracias por tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria is married and she has a business together with her husband selling used clothing. To increase their sales they have expended the products that they sell to include shoes and accessories. Luckily, they have had success with their business and are liked by their customers. Her business sense and her character, which allows her to builds relationships with all persons, have helped Ana grow her business.

At this moment, she is requesting a loan off $1200 that she will use to buy merchandise for the new season. This will allow her to better her service and variety. She will we pay this amount in six months. You can become a part of the accomplishments of this couple. They need your help and sincerely thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana Maria es casada y junto con su esposo tienen un negocio de venta de ropa de medio uso, para mejorar las ventas han incrementado los productos que comercializan, incluyendo zapatos y accesorios, afortunadamente han tenido éxito con su negocio y aceptación de parte de sus clientes, el gusto por las ventas y el carácter que le ayuda a tener buenas relaciones con las personas han ayudado a Ana para hacer creer su negocio.

Ahora ella solicita un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía de la nueva temporada que le permita mejora su servicio y variedad, ella esta dispuesta a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte en los logros de este matrimonio, ellos necesitan de tu ayuda y agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Arcenia Esperanza

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Arcenia Esperanza, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva y zapato, producto que distribuyo a domicilio y por encargo, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia, soy madre soltera y tengo un hijo, actualmente necesito surtir un poco mas mi negocio, tomando en cuenta entre mas producto ofresco mejores son los ingresos.

Hi, my name is Arcenia Esperanza, I have a small business selling new clothes and shoes, taking on orders from clients and delivering the product myself. I have many years of experience in this line of work which has allowed me to generate income for my family’s expenses. I am a single mother of one child. Currently, I need to stock my business, given that the more products I offer the better the income.

loans.use: Compra de Jeans de hombre y de mujer, camisa de hombre, trajecitos de niño y sandalia de mujer// Purchase of men's and women's jeans, men's shirts, boys suits, and women's sandals

loans.name: Fidelia Amparo

texts.es:
Hola Mi nombres es Fidelia Amparo, soy comerciante cuento con una pequeña pulperia (venta de productos Para consumo Humano), ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingreos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, este negocio ha venido aliviar un poco la situación economica de mi hogar.

Hi, my name is Fidelia Amparo. I am a vendor in a small grocery shop, located in the center of our community. I have many years of experience in this line of work, which has allowed me to contribute income to our home expenses and to fulfill my obligations with the distributors. This business has helped in alleviating my family’s economic situation. .

loans.use: Compra de manteca, huevos, azucar,salsa, espaguetis y harina.// Purchase of lard, eggs, sugar, sauce, spaghetti, and flour

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Hola mi nombre es Elizabeth, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de golosinas y pan de levadura, ubicado en mi casa de habitación, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y demas compromiso, gracias a los ingresos que persibo de este negocio mis hijos pueden estudiar y a la vez colaborarme en su tiempo libre.

Hi, my name is Elizabeth, my main activity is a business in my house selling sweets and bread. I have many years of experience in this line of work which has allowed me to contribute to my family’s expenses and other dues. Thanks to the income generated from this business my children can study and I can be there for them. .

loans.use: Compra de manteca, azucar, huevos,azucar, leche, canela y vainilla// Purchase of  lard, sugar, eggs, milk, cinnamon and vanilla

loans.name: Ana Berta

texts.es:
Mi nombre es Ana Berta, mi actividad principal es la reventa de tarjetas para celulares Tigo y Alo de diferentes denominaciónes, cuento con 2 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos en que se incurren en el Hogar, actualmente la demanda ha crecido y no cuento con el capital suficiente para tal inversión

My name is Ana Berta, my main activity is re-selling cellular phone cards (Tigo, and Alo) of various price range. I have two years experience in this line of work, which has allowed me to generate an income to help my husband with our household expenses. Currently, the demand for cellular phone cards has increased and I don’t have sufficient capital to invest. .

loans.use: Compra de tarjetas Tigo y Alo de diferentes denominaciones.//Purchase of  Cellular phone cards (Tigo, Alo) of various price range

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira is a young mother with a little kid, she has never received help from her partner for he son’s basic needs, for this reason Elvira began a business selling shoes with the help of her mother two years ago, fortunately her good service has helped grow her sales, she wants to continue growing to offer her son good education, and she is willing to work hard for it.

Right now Elvira needs a loan of $475to buy merchandise to provide her clients all their requests, improve the quality of her service and keep her clients happy, she promises to return the loan in 6 months. You can be an important part of her success, she needs your support and thanks sincerely any type of help you can offer her.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Elvira es y una joven madre de un pequeño, nunca ha tenido el apoyo de su pareja para darle lo necesario a su hijo, por esta razón Elvira ha tenido que esforzarse mucho, con ayuda de su madre inició con la venta de calzado hace dos años, afortunadamente el buen servicio que ofrece ha hecho crecer sus ventas, ella desea continuar creciendo para ofrecer una educación de calidad a su pequeño hijo, para lo que esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro.

En estos momentos, Elvira necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía con la que podrá surtir los pedidos que tiene, mejorar la calidad de su servicio y conservar su preferencia de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Elvira, ella necesita tu apoyo y agradece sinceramente cualquier tipo de ayuda que puedas ofrecerle.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Maria de Lourdes is a very good working woman; she is married and has two little children. Her husband is working but his salary is not enough to cover all the family expenses, besides he had big debts and couldn’t cover them by himself. Because of all this, Lulú with other two neighbours got together a group six years ago to start a business selling natural products and shoes, with their enthusiasm and effort they have succeeded and keep the business all this time.

Now they want to increase their business and in order to buy more merchandise Lulú is requesting a loan for $295 which she promises to pay in 6 months. With your help these 3 families can improve their life, help them grow their business.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de Lourdes es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos. Su esposo es empleado pero su salario era insuficiente para cubrir los gastos de su familia, además de que tenía unas deudas muy grandes y no podía solventarlas él solo. Ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, Lulú junto con dos vecinas de ella juntaron un grupo hace seis años para emprender un negocio con la venta de productos naturales y zapatos, el entusiasmo y esfuerzo que las tres han depositado en el negocio les ha permitido salir adelante y mantenerse por tanto tiempo.

Ahora desean poder hacer crecer su negocio y para poder adquirir más mercancía Lulú solicita un préstamo por $925 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda mejorarás la vida de tres familia, contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, ellas necesitan agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Jaime Benigno

texts.es:
Jaime is married and has two daughters, a 5 and 7 years old; and a 10 years old son. He used to worked in a company but was laid off after personal re-adjustment and in order to get some income began helping his brother who used to sell hats, when he noticed the profit was good, he decided to work by himself and started his own business, selling tattoos and then added selling hats with great results.

In order to offer better quality products, Jaime is requesting a $200 loan to buy merchandise, he promises to repay in 6 months. Jaime knows that with your help he will be able to improve his business and his family’s well being, so he thanks your support.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Jaime es casado y tiene dos hijas, de 5 y 17 años de edad, y un hijo de 10 años. Anteriormente él trabajaba en una empresa pero por reajuste de personal quedó desempleado y para obtener un ingreso comenzó a ayudarle a un hermano que vendía gorras, al ver que tenia buenas utilidades, decidió independizarse y emprender su propio negocio, inició vendiendo calcomanías y después incluyó la venta de gorras, obteniendo muy buenos resultados.

Para poder ofrecer productos de mejor calidad, Jaime solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Jaime sabe que con tu ayuda podrá sacar adelante su negocio y mejorar el bienestar de su familia, por lo que agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura is a single mother who as a 12 years old daughter and 8 years old twins. She used to work for a company but her salary was too low and she didn’t have time enough for her kids, so she decided to leave her job and open her own business 5 years ago. She started selling juices, yogurt, cream, and cheese in the cooperative schools near by her home; little by little she grew on clientele and fixed her house to offer a better service.

It hasn’t been easy for Laura to support her family alone, but her love for her children her biggest motivation each day, now she needs a loan for $750 to buy merchandise to get more variety and keep on being her clients favorite. Help Laura and help her business improvement, she and her family will thank you forever.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Laura es madre soltera de una hija de 12 años de edad y un par de gemelos de 8 años. Antes ella trabajaba para una empresa pero su salario era bajo y no le permitía tener tiempo disponible para sus hijos, por lo que decidió abandonar su empleo e iniciar su propio negocio desde hace cinco años. Comenzó vendiendo jugos, yogurt, crema y queso para nachos en las cooperativas de las escuelas cercanas a su hogar, poco a poco fueron incrementándose sus clientes y acondicionó un lugar de su casa para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio.

No ha sido fácil para Laura tener que sostener a su familia ella sola, pero el amor hacia sus hijos es el más grande motivo que tiene para esforzarse casa día, ahora ella necesita un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para tener una mejor variedad y continuar en la preferencia de sus clientes. Apoya a Laura y ayuda al desarrollo de su negocio, ella y su familia te lo agradecerán por siempre.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Maria Esther Verónic

texts.es:
Maria Esther is divorced and has an 8 years old daughter and a 10 years old son. In order to support her family and because she had no one else to help her, Maria decided to start her own business selling fruit in which fortunately she had succeeded and has grown in the last 2 years since she opened it. The love for her children and her wish to give them a good education has motivated her all this time .

In order to keep on growing, Maria is requesting a $475 loan to buy merchandise, as well as to offer better service and keep her clients preference; she will repay the amount in 6 months. This family needs your help; their well being is in your hands. Help them!

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Esther es divorciada y tiene una hija de 8 años de edad y un hijo de 10. Ante la necesidad de obtener los recursos para sostener a su familia y no tener la ayuda de nadie para cuidar de sus hijos, Maria decidió emprender su negocio de frutería en el que afortunadamente le ha ido bien y ha hecho crecer desde hace dos años que inició. El amor hacia sus hijos y el deseo de darles una buena educación han motivado a Maria todo este tiempo.

Para poder continuar creciendo, Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, así podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio y conservar la preferencia de sus clientes, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Esta familia necesita mucho de tu ayuda, en tus manos esta su bienestar ¡Apóyalos!.

loans.use: To Buy merchandise

loans.name: Bardomiano

texts.es:
Bardomiano is a young entrepreneur with big wishes of improvement, he started his beauty salon 4 years ago to get his independence and help his mother with some debts she had. Because of his love for this job and the good service he offers he has more clients now.

In order to buy among the near by counties and grow his business, Bardomiano is requesting a loan of $375 which would help him buy marketing products and supplies needed to keep on offering high quality services, he is promising to repay in 6 months. Be part of Bardomiano’s success, he will thank your trust and help you provide him.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Bardomiano es un joven emprendedor con grandes deseos de superación, inició su estética hace cuatro años por la necesidad de independizarse y ayudar a su madre con unas deudas que tenía. El gusto por este oficio y el buen servicio que ofrece han logrado que los clientes de Bardomiano cada vez sean mayores.

Para poder darse a conocer entre las colonias cercanas y hacer crecer su negocio, Bardomiano solicita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de artículos publicitarios e insumos que necesita para seguir ofreciendo servicios de muy buena calidad, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte de los logros de Bardomiano, él agradece mucho la confianza y el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Compra de insumos y publicidad

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria has been selling merchandise for 20 years, she is married has two children already married. She has always liked to sell and although she had a job at a hospital, she used to sell clothes and jewelry to get some extra income and improve her family’s quality of life. Unfortunately she had an accident that disabled her and was very depressed after it, now she receives a pension which is very low, but with her savings she was able to establish her own business, where she sells bed and bath accessories, this has kept her busy and has helped her to cover her medical expenses.

Now she is requesting a loan for $750 in order to buy merchandise to help her grow her business, she promises to repay in 6 months. With your help she will improve her life, help her realize her dreams, thank you.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 20 años Gloria se dedica a las ventas, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos ya casados. A ella siempre le han gustado las ventas y a pesar de que tenía un empleo en un hospital, ella vendía ropa y joyería para obtener un ingreso extra y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Lamentablemente sufrió un accidente que la incapacitó y estuvo muy deprimida después de esto, ahora recibe una pensión que es muy baja, pero con los ahorros que tenía logró establecer su propio negocio, donde vende blancos, así ha logrado mantenerse ocupada y para cubrir sus gastos médicos.

Ahora ella solicita un crédito por $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para hacer crecer su negocio, ella se compromete a regresar este préstamo en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás mejorar la vida de Gloria, ayúdala a la realización de sus sueños, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Buy merchandise (home products)

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn married in 1979 and has 2 sons and one daughter. Her husband passed away in 1997. She only managed to go to school through grade 3.

Saroeurn has been working in a brick kiln since 2002, and she is currently also growing vegetables to make extra money to support her family. All her sons and daughter have a job; her sons work in a company in Phnom Penh and her daughter is an administrator in a garment factory.

Saroeurn would like to borrow $500 from MAXIMA to fix her roof and the wall of the house so that the family will be not worry about the weather any more. They are friendly and honest. All members of the family have monthly income so we are sure they will pay back the loan without any problems.

loans.use: Fixing house - repairing the roof and wall.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Yi married during the Pol Pot regime and has 4 sons and 3 daughters. She has never been to school. Her husband passed away over 10 years ago. She is currently growing vegetables. Two of her sons have been transporting passengers for 8 years and her daughter is working in a garment factory. They are polite and well loved by their neighbors.

Yi would like to borrow $150 from MAXIMA to buy a new bicycle-carriage for her son. She hopes her son can carry more people and provide safer transportation for the passengers. This family has no problem paying back their loans because they have a regular income.

loans.use: Growing rice and purchasing a motorbike-carriage.

loans.name: Sunnareth

texts.en:
Sunnareth was married in 1965 and has four children but she is now a widow. She learnt to weave silk from her elders back in 1960 and is currently making silk products. Besides weaving, she grows rice and some vegetables as well. Her second daughter is a teacher in high school and one of her daughters weaves silk with her mother at home. The youngest son is working in a cable factory.

Sunnareth would like a loan of $150 to purchase house pillars for her daughter to build a new house. In view of their combined income and good character, we are sure that she has the capacity to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing house pillars for her daughter to build a new house.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Sunnareth Aeth pay off her loan early before contract. Thank you.

loans.name: Sytath

texts.en:
Sytath is a widow with two daughters. She learnt to weave silk from her mother in 1984. She finished her studies in grade 8, and she is currently producing silk products at home and raising a few cows.

She has already taken and repaid a loan from MAXIMA three times. The current loan amount requested is $200. She will use this loan to buy silk materials and sewing thread.

Sytath is polite and friendly. Since she has been borrowing money from MAXIMA, she is able to send her child to school and her family is doing better day by day. They are sure to have the capability to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread

payments.comment:
Dear lenders,

Sytath Mas already paid off the loan. Thank you very much to all lenders.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng married in 1979 and has three sons and one daughter. She has been making and selling silk products since 1980. Her husband is a high school teacher in the village. Her oldest son is a soldier in Phnom Penh. He is gentle but firm.

Seng has already taken and repaid two loans from MAXIMA. The current amount requested is $350. She will use some of this money to purchase silk material and sewing thread, and the rest of the money will go to buy silk products from the villagers to sell in the market so that she can make more profit. In addition, this allows local silk producers to sell their silk products at a price that is not much beow the market price. We are sure Seng will have no problem to repay the money.

loans.use: Purchasing silk material, sewing thread, and silk products from the villagers to sell in the market.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Seng Sun paid off her loan early before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Ranny

texts.en:
Rany was married in 1999 and has one son and one daughter. She finished grade 4 in a local school. She started her grocery business in 2006. Meanwhile, she also makes silk products when she can spare the time from her grocery store. Her husband is a policeman in the community.

Rany would like to borrow $400 from MAXIMA as a first loan, in order to buy more grocery items so that her customers can find many of their needs near their house. Rany really has the capacity to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing more grocery items

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Ranny Seth paid off her loan early before contract.
Thank you.

loans.name: Kemlauth

texts.en:
Kemlauth married in 1994 and has 2 sons and 2 daughters. She is currently providing public phone service at her house. She also started producing silk products in 1994. She finished grade 7 in a state-run school, and she learnt to grow vegetables from her neighbor. Her husband is a government official. Her second daughter is helping her to weave silk at home, while the other children are still at school.

Kemlauth has already repaid her first loan, and now she would like a loan in the amount of $300 to buy silk material and sewing thread to put in a new loom for her daughter. That way, they can expand her business and have more income to support the family.

Kemlauth is polite and loyal and doesn’t hesitate to give any necessary information to MAXIMA. We are sure she will repay this second loan without any problem.

loans.use: Buying silk material and sewing thread

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Kemlauth Chun paid off her loan early before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Rany

texts.en:
Rany is single. She lives with her nephew in the same house. She has been weaving silk at home since 1984. Her nephew is a goldsmith, who began his work in 2004. Rany left school after grade 4. Besides weaving silk, she knows how to prepare her loom and weave patterns on the silk as well.

Rany has already borrowed and repaid five loans from MAXIMA . This time, she would like to borrow $600 to buy tools for working gold for her nephew. That way, he can make necklaces, bracelets, rings, and earring to sell in the village. This business can help them to earn enough money to live on and the other people can buy jewelry near their house. We feel sure that they can pay back the interest and principal on this loan without any problem.

loans.use: Buying tools for working gold to make jewelery

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Rany Dor has enough money to pay off her loan early before contrac and requesting another loan.

Thank you.

loans.name: Oam

texts.en:
A 61-year-old woman, Oam H., is a widow and lives with her five children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a diligent mother, wo is her family’s main source of support since her husband passed away many years ago. Oam H. sells a variety of vegetables at the outdoor market in her area. She typically makes an average of $5 each day. Three of her children, therefore, work at one of the restaurants in the city as waiters, and the rest attend school. Her hard work and the progress of her business motivate her to go ahead in order to meet her clients’ needs. Currently Oam H. ( in the photograph she is the woman sitting on the left side) is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to increase her inventory and purchase a motorcycle for her business transportation.

In the future, Oam H. hopes to save sufficient money to expand her vegetable stand into a larger one so that she is able to increase her inventory as well as satisfy her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for her inventory and a motorcycle for her business transportation.

payments.comment: Oam Hoeum has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Peangh

texts.en:
Mrs. Peangh L. is 38 years old and a mother of three children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. To supplement her household income, she operates a small grocery stand at home and earns around $3 per day in revenue. Her husband works on a farm cultivating rice crops and a variety of vegetables.

Two of her children work in construction--the other is a student. In order to maximize her business size and to meet her clients’ needs, Peangh L. is currently requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more grocery products for her inventory. She eventually believes she will earn enough to expand her business and give her children a high level of education one day.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to invest in her stand.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: A 32-year-old woman, Yim S., is a widow and lives with her four children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. To meet her family’s expenses, Yim S. is both a construction worker and a farmer. She works on her farm growing rice crops and a variety of vegetables when she is free from her construction job. She earns about $5 each day, while three of her children (two are pictured here because Yim S. was unavailable to be photographed) help to finance the household by working as construction workers; the fourth child is a student. Yim S. is currently asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a plot of land to grow her rice crop and vegetables. She hopes to grow enough rice to have a reserve for the coming year. Yim S. is very grateful for  your help to make her family better.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to grow rice crops and some kinds of vegetables.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Yim Seang start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his stock of small radios, watches and other small goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his stock of stationary.

loans.name: Seyfulla

texts.en: S. Seyfull is 41 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He is the owner of one cow. Since 2001, his small business has been his first source of income for his family.  One cow is not enough to cover all the needs of such a big family. To improve conditions of his life he applied for a 900 USD to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow

loans.name: Shirinali

texts.en: S. Shirinali lives in Fatalikend village in Saatli. He is 39 years old, is married and has 5 children. He runs a small business of one milk cow and a calf. These cattle were enough to cover necessary family needs. He is going to broaden his farm and purchase one more milk cow and will begin selling the milk to local people.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow

loans.name: Aflatun

texts.en: Aflatun R. is 42 years old, is married, and has 3 children. He works as a teacher in a local school. At the same time he is keeping a calf for meat purposes. He is a successful businessman and is not going to stop. He developed his business and borrowed a 1200 USD loan from Aqroinvest CU to purchase one cow and one calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en: Rahmatullo Y., 46 years old, has a secondary education and works as a butcher. He is married with 3 children. He rents a sell-point for meat selling.  From his early youth, Rahmatullo helped his father in his butcher shop. Therefore he has long experience in this business. Rahmatullo buys cattle in a market, fattens them, and sells the meat. He is going to buy 4 cows using this loan of $1200, to increase his livestock numbers then sell the meat for a cheaper price to the population.

loans.use: To buy cattle and sell meat.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Mr. Tuy L. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and five children, who are students, in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He makes his living by purchasing charcoal from a far village, and resells them to retail outlets in his area. He can typically generate around $6 per day in income. His wife, meanwhile, stays at home looking after their children and cooking meals for her family. Therefore, Tuy L. plays an important role for his family and works very hard to meet the family’s expenses. Currently, he needs two cows instead of a car or motorbike to help him transport and sell his charcoal in this area. He would be grateful and appreciate any kind of help, which motivates him to go ahead.

loans.use: To purchase two cows to transport charcoal.

payments.comment: Tuy Long has successfully repaid his loan early! Thanks to you, he was able to expand his business and improve the life of his family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Ziver

texts.en: Ziver A. lives in Beylagan, Azerbaijan. She sells women clothinig in the Beylagan city bazaar. She has rented a small booth there. Ziver is married and she has three children. Her husband helps her in her business. Ziver has been a client of Normicro Beylagan Branch since 2005. She has borrowed two loans, which total $1,000, from 2005-2006. She used these loans to buy more kinds of goods. Now she needs $1,000 to buy more products to sell.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her clothing stand.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin J. lives in Beylagan, Azerbaijan He is married and has five children. He makes doors and fences in his yard from iron. Elchin has been a client of Normicro Beylagan Branch since 2003 and is one of their best clients. Since 2003 he has received four loans, which total $2,800,  for his business from them. In 2003 his loan was in the amount of $400. In 2004 he borrowed $600; in 2005 he borrowed $800; and in 2006 he borrowed $1,000. Now he needs $1,200 to buy more equipment for his business.

loans.use: for buying equipments

loans.name: Nghip

texts.en: Mrs. Nghip T. is 39 years old and lives with her husband (pictured in Siem Reap province, Cambodia). She is a housewife, while her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman and moderately makes around $3 per day in revenue. In order to increase her savings, Nghip T. is currently requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase her husband a motorcycle to transport him to work so that he will no longer need to pay for public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Adila

texts.en: Adila Z. lives in Beylagan, Azerbaijan. She is married and she has three children. Adila has a small shop near her home where she sells clothes, vegetables, fruits, and other items. She established her business a few years ago. In the beginning, she had little business capital. In 2005 she applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch and borrowed $300. She used this loan to buy more goods and was able to increase her daily selling. In 2006 her loan was in the amount of $500. Adila used this money to exand the area of her shop. Now she needs $800 to increase the variety of goods she sells.

loans.use: To expand her business selling clothes, vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Chann was married in 1984 and has one daughter and one son. Chann learned to weave silk products from her sister. Her family has two looms. Both Chann and her husband are weaving silk at home. She is illiterate because she did not have a chance to study due to the family's living conditions, while her husband finished primary school. They are happy to send their children to school. Now their children are studying in primary school in the village.

In the second cycle she wants to borrow $300 in order to buy sewing thread, silk material and spend on fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom. With their two looms, she can earn enough money to support her family. We are sure she has the capacity to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Chann Chem paid off her loan early before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Sokphorn

texts.en: Sokphorn was married in 1990. She has two daughters and one son who are studying in a local school. She is weaving silk products at home while her husband growing rice in the field. She is illiterate and her husband only finished grade four in a primary school. They are gentle, polite and honest. She asked for $200 in the fourth cycle from MAXIMA to buy sewing thread and silk material. Every year, they harvest enough rice from the field to eat, so the income from weaving silk is for extra food, to support their children for further education, and saving. She has enough capacity to pay back the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread.

payments.comment:
Dear lenders,

Mrs. Sokphorn Suon paid off her loan. Thank you so much for lending to Sokphorn Suon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to purchase more variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to purchase a power saw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to purchase a pig.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan would like to purchase a pig.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy would like to buy 2 young pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like buy two piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy 2 young piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose would like to buy a bull calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his kiosk and buy more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her paraffin-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his hotel business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose would like to buy two bales of second hand clothes and dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Edith would like to buy a dairy cow and animal feeds.

loans.name: Baudelina

texts.es:
Baudelina is only 38 years old and is already a widow and mother of 2 sons ages 11 and 8. After several years of fighting cancer, her husband passed away, leaving Baudelina alone with the 2 children and practically without money since all their savings were spent in treatments, medications and hospital bills. To overcome this situation and support her family, she opened a bar in her house where several workers from a brick factory, located a few blocks away, come to eat. Baudelina began selling beverages and sweets; little by little she started to have a regular clientele, first with 5 people until today where she serves lunch to more or less 25 people every day at different times. Her business is doing very well; she's been able to advance little by little. Her children can go to school and have a good life thanks to the revenues from the bar. Baudelina is seeing a considerable increase in her number of clients, therefore she would like to buy two long tables and chairs to sit 12 people, as well as plates, utensils and glasses. She needs these items urgently since she does not have enough of them. In order to buy these items, Baudelina is applying for a $500 loan and she will repay them in 10 monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Con tan solo 38 años de edad, Baudelina es una mujer viuda, madre de dos niños uno de 11 y otro de 8 años. Su marido,luego de varios años de padecer cáncer, falleció, quedando Baudelina sola con los niños y practicamente sin dinero ya que todos los ahorros que tenían fueron utilizados en tratamientos, medicamentos y gastos hospitalarios. Para afrontar su situación y abastecer a su familia, ella abrió un bar en su casa, donde van a comer varias personas que trabajan en una fábrica de ladrillos ubicada a pocas cuadras de su casa. Empezó vendiendo bebidas y golosinas y de a poco fue armandose de clientela, empezó dando de comer a 5 personas y hoy día ya son cerca de 25 las personas que van todos los días, en diferentes horarios, a almorzar al bar de Baudelina. Su negocio marcha muy bien, ella a podido progresar de a poco, sus hijos estudian y viven gracias a las ganancias que le proporciona el bar. Como la cantidad de personas que comen en su bar va aumentando considerablemente, Baudelina desea comprar dos mesas largas para 12 personas con sus respectivas sillas, además de platos, cubiertos y vasos, que últimamente le hacen bastante falta, pues no tiene utencilios en gran cantidad. Para poder adquirir estos elementos, Baudelina solicita un crédito de $ 500 que se compromete a devolver en 10 pagos mensuales.

loans.use: compra de mesas, sillas, cubiertos, platos y vasos.

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Mr. Cristino is 44 years old. He opened his own tapestry shop ten years ago, after having worked for several years at a tapestry that shut down and left him unemployed. His wife also contributes income to the family as she owns her own business selling clothes. They have three children together, they are all going to school and are excellent students.

Cristino's tapestry is doing very well, he has his own clientèle which is very satisfied with his work. In his tapestry he fixes all kinds of sofas, chairs and cushions.

He only owns one sowing machine and he is wishing to purchase a second one. This new sowing machine would allow him to work with thicker fabrics and even leather, since he wants to make his own designs of leather sofas which have a strong demand and sell for high prices.

The cost of the sowing machine he wants to purchase is of $550 at the local plaza. Hence he is requesting a loan for this amount which he is committing to pay back in a monthly basis.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


El señor Cristino de 44 años abrió su propia tapicería hace diez años atrás, luego de haber trabajado varios años en una tapicería que cerró dejandolo sin trabajo. Su señora también aporta con los ingresos de la casaella tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropas, tienen 3 hijos juntos, todos van al colegio y son excelentes alumnos. La tapicería de Cristino marcha muy bien, cuenta con una buena clientela que está bastante satisfecha con su trabajo. En su tapicería arregla todo tipo de sillones, sillas y acolchados; el cuenta con una sola máquina de coser y está muy deseoso de adquirir una nueva que le permitirá trabajar con telas mas gruesas y hasta cuero, pues el desea fabricar sus propios diseños de sillones de cueros que hoy día tienen bastante demanda y son vendidos a buen precio. El precio en plaza de la máquina que el desea adquirir es de $. 550, es por eso que solicita un crédito por ese monto que se compromente a pagarlos de forma mensual.

loans.use: Purchasing a sowing machine for tapestry/Compra de máquina de coser para tapicería

loans.name: Juan Ruperto

texts.es:
Mr. Juan is 42 years old. He has been working since he was 12 years old, when he started to work assisting his father in construction jobs. At 18, he moved to the capital in search for a job which he got in a Glass Work Shop. He saved for several years and learned a lot about the business since he had decided to go back to his hometown and start his own business.

It was hard to him to start with his own shop since he worked alone and had no help. Furthermore, he had to bring all of his supplies from the capital which is 4 hours away. Little by little his business progressed and today he employs two other people.

Since everything is going well, and the demand for his work has increased, Juan wished to repair his shop and build a room to exhibit his works, for which he is requesting a loan for $450.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


El Sr. Juan tiene 42 años de edad.
