Trabajo desde la corta edad de 12 años, empezó a trabajar como ayudante de albañilería de su padre, a los 18 años fue a la capital para buscar trabajo y consiguió un puesto en una vidriería, ahorro varios años y aprendió bastante sobre el rubro, por lo que decidió volver a su ciudad y abrir su propio negocio. Le fue muy difícil empezar con su vidriería pues trabajaba solo sin ayuda, además los materiales tenía que traerlos de la capital que queda a 4 horas de la ciudad donde vive, poco a poco fue progresando y hoy ya cuenta con la ayuda de dos personales más. Como todo marcha bien, y la demanda de su trabajo ha aumentado, Juan desea refraccionar su local y hacer un salón para poder exhibir sus trabajos, para lo que necesita un crédito de $ 450.

loans.use: Shop repairs and extension / Refaccion y ampliación del local

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Ms. Dorotea is 36 years old, married and with two children. Dorotea started her own general store in 1980 with the help of her mother in law. She started selling essential food products, then went into the sales of groceries, home articles and prepared foods such as empanadas, milanesas, tortas, etc.

This activity provides her with a good income. It has allowed her to support her family and give her children a worthy education.

She is requesting the loan to invest the funds into her business, since in the last months her clientèle has increased. She is planning on purchasing products such as oil, sugar, drinks and canned products at wholesale prices. This way she will be able to abate her costs and supply the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La Sra. Dorotea tiene 36 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Dorotea abrió su despensa en el año 1980 con la ayuda de su suegra. La señora empezó vendiendo artículos de necesidad prima, para luego ir incursionando en otras ventas tales como la mercería, bijouterie, además de comidas rápidas como empanadas, milanesas, tortas, etc. Esta actividad le genera buenos ingresos que le han permitido a mantener una familia y darles a sus hijos una educación digna. Desea el crédito para reinvertilos en su negocio, pues en los últimos meses han aumentado sus clientes. Planea comprar sus productos como aceite, azúcar, bebidas y productos enlatados al por mayor, de esta forma podrá abaratar sus costos y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase products such as oil, sugar, drinks and canned products at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
Mrs. Marciana is 49 years old. In her business she sells essential food products. She started selling products she grew at her own farm such as potatoes, eggs, corn, poroto, and cheese. With the profits she was able to grow the business little by little, and now she owns a General Store with a set clientèle.

With this activity and with the help of her husband, who works in a textile manufacturer, she was able to proviD. her 4 children with the education they deserve.

Her project is to increase the variety of products in her store, since she wishes to sell carbonated drinks, ice creams and milk-based products which her clients generally request. In order to do this, she needs to acquire a refrigerator which will allow her to keep these products cold since the heat in Paraguay is overwhelming and hot days are prevalent throughout the year.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La Sra. Marciana tiene 49 años D. edad, su negocio se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad, ella empezó vendiendo pruductos traidos D. su propia granja como papa, huevo, maíz, poroto, queso y con las ganancias pudo ir ampliando poco a poco el negocio, en la actualidad ya es una Despensa consolidada con clientela formada. Con esta actividad y con la ayuda D. su marido, quien es empleado D. una empresa textil, pudo darle la educación merecida a sus 4 hijos. Su proyecto es aumentar la variedad D. mercaderías, pues ella desea vender también bebidas como gaseosas, helados y productos lácteos que generalmente solicitan sus clientes, para ello desea adquirir un refrigerador que le permita mantener estos productos bien refrigerados, pues en nuestro país el calor en muy agobiante y los días calurosos son los que más abundan durante el año.

loans.use: Purchasing a refrigerator

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Carmen is 32 years old, married with 3 children. Because of work, she's been living in the city of Ybycuí for the last 10 years. Her husband works for a cotton "desmontadora" in the area, but his wages are not sufficient to support the family.

In order to face this situation, Carmen had to set up her own small business and make the extra income necessary. With the profits she has been able to help her husband and proviD. her children with a better education. Between them both managing to proviD. them with a better quality of live.

Carmen tells us that she is the best saleswoman in town, since she gets more sales everyday than the other stores in town. She wishes to keep growing for which she is thinking to expand the business. Since winter is drawing closer she wants to buy a greater quantity of winter clothing such as boots, sweaters, wool coats and overalls etc.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La Señora Carmen tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Por cuestiones D. trabajo del marido hace 10 años que resiD. en la ciudad D. Ybycuí. El marido es empleado D. una desmotadora D. algodón D. la zona, pero el salario que el percibe no es suficiente para sostener a la familia, por lo que para afrontar esta situación,Carmen, tuvo que montar su pequeño negocio para obtener ingresos extras. Con las ganancias a podido ayudar a su marido y proveer a sus hijos D. una mejor educación logrando entre ambos mejorar su calidad D. vida. Carmen nos cuenta que es la mejor vendedora del pueblo, pues es ella la que todos los días consigue tener mejores ventas que las demás tiendas. Ella quiere seguir creciendo y para ello tiene pensado expandir su negocio, ya que el invierno se acerca con mayor fuerza ella desea comprar en mayor cantidad ropa para invierno como camperas, buzos, abrigos, etc.

loans.use: Purchasing winter clothing (boots, sweaters, wool coats and overalls)/Compra de ropas para invierno (camperas, buzos,sweters, sacos de lana)

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg has combined his love of the outdoors and healthy living with a successful rental and sales business catering to outdoor sports enthusiasts. He is based in Truskavyets, a little town near the beautiful Carpathian mountains in western Ukraine. This area is popular with tourists seeking active vacations during both the summer and winter seasons. 

Oleg rents and sells a variety of recreational equipment for people to enjoy in the outdoors. He also offers guided tours of the region along with food and lodging. He has extensive experience in his field and enjoys sharing with others. This has earned him a great reputation and a loyal clientele. Oleg makes about $600-$700 per month, enough to support himself, his wife and his son. He is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase additional rental equipment, including rock-climbing gear and paintball guns. This loan will help him improve his high quality services and provide great experiences for many more customers.

loans.use: Purchase outdoor equipment to upgrade his rental/sales business

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: Larisa supports herself and her high-school age daughter with her small market business selling a variety of electrical goods and appliances. During the five years she's been in business, she has developed a great mix of products and a solid customer base. Her kiosk is popular with customers because she is able to sell at lower prices than some of the larger electronics stores. Larisa originally got involved in her own business at the encouragement of her sister. Her sister and brother-in-law continue to help her with the business. Eventually they would like to open larger sales location together. Larisa and her daughter live with her mother in her hostel and are able to help with her mother's expenses as well. Larisa is requesting a loan for $1200 to purchase a supply of cell phone accessories. These popular items will sell well and bring in additional income through the summer season.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of cell phone accessories

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: For the past twelve years, Svetlana has had her own business selling women’s clothing at the market in Melitopol, Ukraine. She purchases clothing imported from Turkey which she is able to get at good prices. She started her own business because she knew it would bring in good returns. Not only does it help meet the needs of herself and her husband, but she is also able to help her parents and her grandchildren financially. Svetlana is requesting a loan to help purchase new clothing inventory so she will be prepared for the busy, upcoming season.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en: Nadezhda Z. runs an attractive souvenir and dish sales business from her kiosk at the Central market in Melitopol, Ukraine. She sells many brightly colored knick-knacks and small items that are decorated in the traditional Ukrainian style and are popular with passing tourists. Melitopol is known as the gateway to Crimea, a very popular vacation destination for Ukrainians and Russians. She has been in business for about ten years. In a typical month she will make about $240 in profit. Nadezhda is married, and she and her husband, Valeriy, would like to use some of the income from her business to finish building their home. She is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase additional inventory and increase her assortment of merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria Dolores is married and has four children. Because of the necessity to obtain extra income that allowed her to help her husband with home expenses and its oldest daughter who is a single mother, Maria Dolores began to sell slushes five years ago in her house and during the weekends has a place in the markets. Slushes are drinks done with ice, sweetened with syrups of different natural flavors, very well demanded during hot weather days.

This is the best time of sales for Maria Dolores and in order to cover her demand she is requesting a loan of $550 which she Hill use to buy a “tirón” (a piece that is used to connect the car to the trailer which is her sales post), in order to carry the trailer, this will make easier for her to move around and offer a better service, she will repay her loan in 6 months. Help Maria to keep on growing in her business, be an important part in the life of this family, they will sincerely appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Dolores es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y a su hija mayor que es madre soltera, Maria Dolores comenzó a vender raspados desde hace cinco años en su casa y los fines de semana establece su puesto en los mercados. Los raspados son bebidas a base de hielo picado, endulzados con jarabes de diversos sabores naturales, muy consumidos en tiempo de calor.

Por esta temporada las ventas de Maria Dolores se incrementan considerablemente y para poder cubrir la demanda solicita un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que utilizará en la compra de un tirón (es una pieza que sirve para poder conectar un carro al remolque que tiene como su puesto de venta), para poder jalar el remolque, esto le facilitará los traslados y podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Maria a continuar creciendo con su negocio, se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy a tirón (hook between car and trailer)

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina has had her own business for twelve years. She runs a small kiosk where she sells women’s undergarments at the market in Melitopol, Ukraine. She and her husband, Victor, have two children -- a daughter, Irina, and son, Pavel -- and her business is an important source of income for her family. Valentina's income helps her daughter with college expenses and helps with her parents' expenses too. Lending services from Nadiya Ukraine were a key support for Valentina as she has developed her business. She has proven to be a great client and has maintained a perfect payment record. Valentina is requesting a short term loan of $400 to boost her available capital and allow her to purchase new inventory. We are grateful for the opportunity to further assist in the success of this dedicated entrepreneur.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Maseray

texts.en: Maseray is thirty-seven years old and has six children. Her husband assists her with the business and the couple work together to provide the family with a better livelihood.  Maseray sells palm oil, soft drinks and cold water in Mogburaka town of Sierra Leone and diversified her business with her first loan from SMT.  She is seeking her second loan to further expand her business, make more profit increasing her income.  Maseray says, “With six children, I need to work hard to provide them with basic necessities otherwise they will not grow up well”.  Meseray and her husband are determined to provide their children with best they can.

loans.use: Increase her diversified inventory of food stuffs

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama K. is married with four children and runs a small local restaurant.  She prepares rice with sauces of boiled local cassava leaves, sweet potato leaves, meat and fish.  Although her husband is employed as a government sanitary officer, a civil servant's salary is insufficient in Sierra Leone to meet all the family’s basic needs. Therefore, Adama’s income helps support the family.  She is requesting a loan to purchase six bags of rice and twenty-five gallons of palm oil for her restaurant.

loans.use: Stock of ingredients for her small restaurant

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata B. is married with five children.  Her husband is a petty trader while Aminata runs a small restaurant selling local dishes in the market town of Magburaka of Sierra Leone.  At thirty-five years of age, she has been running the business for two years. She is requesting the loan funds to purchase bags of rice and other stock.   She said during the rainy season it will be difficult to travel into the villages to purchase the local rice, therefore she needs to buy the stock now and store them to continue running her restaurant without difficulties.

loans.use: Purchase stock for small restaurant

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina L. runs a canteen in the San José Obrero School in the city of Capiata. Most of the students eat lunch at home, but they eat breakfast, their mid-morning snack, and their afternoon snack at Rufina’s canteen. In between classes, many students take the opportunity to buy empanadas, soft drinks, and sweets. Rufina pays the school the school $10.00 per day in rent. Additionally, when there is a big celebration or student activity at the school, the school rents a big refrigerator so that Rufina can keep the juices and soft drinks cold.

Rufina knows from past experience that near the time for winter vacation, which is in the month of July, the students spend more time at the canteen talking about their exams and their vacation plans. In anticipation of this increase in demand, Rufina wants to increase her stock of sweets, foods, and soft drinks. To do this she needs a loan of $400.00, which she is committed to paying back very punctually in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rufina L. regenta una cantina en la Escuela San José Obrero en la ciudad de Capiata. La mayoría de alumnos almuerzan en sus casas pero toman su desayuno, media mañana y media tarde en la Cantina de Doña Rufina. Entre clase y clase muchos alumnos aprovechan para acercarse a donde Doña Rufina a comprar empanadas, refrescos y golosinas. Doña Rufina paga a la escuela US$10 por día en concepto de alquiler del espacio. Además, cuando en la escuela hay alguna celebración o acto estudiantil importante, la escuela alquila un frigorífico grande para que Doña Rufina pueda mantener bien fríos los jugos y refrescos. Doña Rufina sabe por su experiencia de años anteriores que cuando se acercan las vacaciones escolares de invierno en el mes de julio, los alumnos suelen pasar más tiempo en su cantina para comentar sobre sus exámenes y sus planes para las vacaciones, en previsión de este incremento de la demanda Doña Rufina quiere ampliar su surtido de golosinas, comidas y refrescos para lo que necesita un préstamo de US$400 los cuales se compromete a reponer en 12 meses puntualmente.

loans.use: To buy sweets, soft drinks, and cookies

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia O. D. O. has a sewing machine in her house that she uses to make children’s clothing and lingerie. Once she has sewn a certain amount of clothing and lingerie, she and daughter go house-to-house selling them. She always sells all of her merchandise.

With the cold season approaching, Mrs. O. wants to begin making warm clothes, however, the sewing machine she has can’t sew heavy fabrics, which is why she would like to buy a new and more modern machine that will allow her to increase her variety of products. Mrs. O. has already researched different sewing machines and has decided on a Juki brand model that costs $500.00. In order to finance this machine, Mrs. O. needs a loan for $500.00, and she has committed to paying it back in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Virginia O. D. O. tiene una máquina D. coser en su casa que utiliza para confeccionar ropas para niños y lencería. Una vez que confecciona una cierta cantidad D. ropa y lencería ella sale con su hija a venderlas casa por casa. Siempre venD. al contado sus mercaderías. Ahora que se acerca la época D. frío la Señora O. quiere empezar a confeccionar ropa D. abrigo, sin embargo, la máquina que ella posee no cose tejidos gruesos, por lo que desea adquirir una maquina nueva y moderna que le permita ampliar su variedad D. mercaderás. La señora O. ya ha estado mirando precios D. distintas máquinas D. coser y se ha decidido por un modelo D. la marca Juki cuyo costo es D. US$500. Para financiar está máquina la señora O. necesita un préstamo por la cantidad del costo D. la misma y se compromete a devolverlo en 12 meses.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Marciano

texts.es:
In October of last year, Marciano Lopez H. started a business selling clothing for children, men, and women, such as: t-shirts, pants, shorts, and button-down shirts. Marciano gets his merchandise in the municipal market. He and his brother-in-law then sell them door-to-door all over the city. His sales are done on credit with weekly payments. Each week Marciano goes out to sell and also to collect payments for the clothes he has sold on credit. The demand for his merchandise has been increasing due the easy payment terms he offers. For the winter season he wants to increase his stock of merchandise. For that reason he is requesting a loan of $500.00, which he hopes to be able to pay in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Marciano Lopez H. empezó en octubre del año pasado un negocio de venta de ropas para niños, hombres y mujeres tales como: remeras, pantalones, bermudas y camisas. Don Marciano adquiere sus mercaderías en el mercado municipal de la ciudad; el realiza sus ventas a domicilio por lo que sale con su cuñado a venderlas casa por casa por toda la ciudad. Marciano realiza sus ventas a crédito con pagos semanales. Cada semana Don Marciano sale a vender y a cobrar los pagos de la ropa que ha vendido a crédito. Actualmente, la demanda de sus mercaderías a ido incrementandose gracias a la facilidad de pago que el ofrece. Para la temporada de invierno quiere aumentar su stock de mercaderías para ello solicita un crrédito de US$ 500 que espera poder pagar en doce meses.

loans.use: To buy an inventory of winter clothing

loans.name: Zulma Emilia

texts.en:
Zulma Emilia M. of B. is a widow and has a son. She sells furniture in her own house. Her business provides a steady monthly income to maintain her house.  Her son is a college student studying Electronic Engineering, which has a very  demanding schedule that makes it impossible for him to work at the same time. On weekends, he helps with the practical work of first year students in order to earn some income to help his mom with expenses. In order to finance his last year of college and fees for practical practice in his field, Zulma is using the money saved for expanding her stock of merchandise to pay for his study. 
Presently, she needs to buy furniture in large quantities to meet the increased demand for her merchandise. 
Zulma needs a loan of US$750 to buy tables, chairs, and beds that are currently in the most demand. Zulma dreams that her son will be a professional in the future, which will permit them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and beds

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa A. Domínguez is married and has 2 children, Emily, who is 5 years old, and Ángel, who is 8 months. Elisa is an entrepreneurial woman. Her husband contributes economically to the household, but she likes to work—her children’s wellbeing is her motivation. She is saving for their future so that they will be able to have access to a good education. She did not have access to much education; she only studied through 6th grade because her parents weren’t able to pay for school for her and her siblings.

Today, after much hard work, Elisa is the owner of a small grocery store located in her house. Thanks to the store, she is able to combine the time she needs for caring for her children with tending to business. Thanks to a good level of demand, and the good location of the store (there are no other groceries for a radius of several blocks), she has decided to add on to the physical area of the business. To do this she needs as loan of $800.00 to complete the expansion of the store and modernize it so that she can keep up with demand and offer more products.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Elisa A. Domínguez, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, Emily de 5 años y Ángel de 8 meses. Elisa es una emprendedora nata, su marido aporta ecónomicamente en la casa pero a ella le gusta trabajar, el bienestar de sus hijos es su principal motivo; ella está ahorrando para el futuro de ellos así el día de mañana puedan acceder a una buena educación escolar, ya que ella no pudo acceder a una, solo estudio hasta el 6to. año de la educación escolar pues sus padres no podian costear los estudios de ella y sus hermanos. Hoy día, y bajo mucho esfuerzo, Elisa es dueña de una despensa ubicada en su propia casa, gracias a ello, puede combinar el tiempo de crianza de sus hijos y cuidados que necesita su bebé, con la atención del negocio. Gracias a la gran demanda y la buena ubicación de la zona en que se encuentra (ya que es el la única despensa en varias cuadras a la redeonda) Ella ha decidido ampliar su negocio por lo que necesita un crédito de $ 800 para poder realizar la obra de expasión del almacén y modernizarlo para así poder cumplir con la demanda y ofrecer más productos en su despensa.

loans.use: Expansion and remodeling of the store

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa R. D. V. is 52 years old, married with four children. Her husband, Severanio V., works 15 hours a day as a bus driver. On his bus route, he passes by Ninfa's business several times a day. The children stay at home in the care of Ninfa's sister. While the couple is at work, the children work on the primary school curriculum. Ninfa and Severiano want their children to keep studying and have a good future.

Ninfa runs a small cafe where she serves soft drinks and typical Paraguayan food, such as breaded cutlets, empanadas, croquettes, and sandwiches. Business is good; the cafe is in a busy commercial area, and people who work there are her main clients.

Ninfa has an excellent credit record and has paid back previous business loans. Business is better than ever and now Ninfa wants to invest further in her cafe, making various improvements and enlarging the dining area. She is asking for $600, which she plans to repay over 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

Ninfa R. D. V. tiene 52 años, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos; su marido se llama Severiano V., el trabaja 15 horas al día como chofer D. autobus y durante su recorrido pasa varias veces por su negocio . Sus hijos quedan en la casa a cuidado D. la hermana D. Ninfa mientras ellos salen a trabajar, están estudiando y cursan la escuela primaria. Ninfa y Severiano desean que sus hijos tengan un buen futuro y que sigan estudiando. Nifa tiene un pequeño bar en el que sirve principalmente milanesas , empanadas, croquetas, sandwiches, comidas tipicas paraguayas, y gaseosas; ella posee muy buena clientela, pues, en la zona existen varias oficinas y comercios cuyos empleados son sus pricipales clientes. Ninfa posee una exelente referencia comercial pues ha solicitado anteriormente préstamos con los que con mucho ezfuerso fue armando D. a poco su negocio y ha sabido cumplir con sus obligaciones D. pago. El negocio va cada vez mejor por lo que Ninfa desea invertir en su local haciendo algunas refacciones para poder ampliar su comedor para lo que necesita un préstamo D. US$600 a los que ella se compromete a devolver en 12 meses.

loans.use: To remodel and enlarge her cafe.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina A. González has worked for several years in a clothing assembly shop where they pay her based on the number of pieces she produces. The wages she earns are not enough, so she does her own work at home in the evenings and on the weekends making custom ordered clothing for clients she has gained through the years. She uses a sewing machine that she obtained thanks to her savings. Delfina has been increasing her number of clients and this has generated better income for her, which helps add to the income she earns from the clothing assembly shop where she works. For this reason, Delfina would like to leave her job and open her own business.

To do this she needs a more modern sewing machine that can hold three spools of thread. This will enable her to work more quickly and increase her production. The machine she currently has only holds two spools, and this prevents her from sewing many of the styles people request. Delina has already decided on the sewing machine she wants to buy and it costs $350.00. If she gets the loan to finance the new machine and things go well, she is thinking of leaving the clothing assembly shop and working full-time at her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Delfina A. González trabaja desde hace varios años en un taller de costura donde le pagan en función a las piezas de ropa que produce. Los ingresos que obtiene no son suficientes por lo que Delfina trabaja de forma particular por las noches y fines de semanas en su casa confeccionando ropas para por encargo de una clientela que ha formado atra vez de los años. Su herramienta de trabajo es una máquina de coser que adquirio gracias a sus ahorros. Delfina ha ido ampliando cada vez mas su cartera de clientes y esto le va generando mayores ingresos cada día que superan ampliamente a los ingresos que provienen de su trabajo en el taller de costura al que va por las mañanas a trabajar. Por tal motivo, Delfina, desea independizarse y establecer su propio negocio, para ello necesita una máquina de coser de 3 hilos, más moderna, que la ayudará a agilizar su trabajo e incrementar la producción, pues la máquina de coser que tiene actualmente sólo tiene dos hilos y no le permite hacer mucho de los modelos que le demandan. Doña Delfina ya tiene localizada la herramienta que quiere comprar, una máquina de coser cuyo valor en el mercado es de US$350. Si consigue el préstamo para financiar su nueva máquina de coser y las cosas le van bien, Delfina piensa dejar el taller de costura y dedicarse de lleno a su propio negocio.

loans.use: To buy a three-spool sewing machine

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson V. is a very hardworking man. He makes clothes and hats in a small workshop he has in his house. He works there with his wife, Miriam, where each has a sewing machine. They make a certain number of pieces and then sell them to stores in the city market and surrounding areas.

Currently, Nelson and his wife are producing a lot of hats, especially for children. The sale of hats has increased significantly since Nelson invested in inks and stencils for silk screening, which he uses to put personalized names and drawings on his hats. According to Nelson, the hats that are in greatest demand are those that have the logos of various soccer clubs. With winter approaching, Nelson wants to invest in fabrics and materials for making coats, for which he needs a loan of $400.00.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Nelson V. es un hombre muy trabajador, realiza confecciones de ropas y gorras en un pequeño taller que ha formado en su casa junto con su esposa Miriam donde ambos trabajan con una máquina de coser cada uno. Ellos confecciona una cierta cantidad de piezas para luego salir a vender a las tiendas del mercado de la ciudad y alrededores. Actualmente lo que más está produciendo el señor Nelson y su esposa son gorras, sobretodo para niños. La venta de gorras se incrementó notablemente desde que Nelson invirtió en tintas y placas para serigrafia con los que realiza nombres y dibujos personalizados en sus gorras. Según cuenta Nelson las gorras que más se demanda son las que poseen escudos de diversos clubs de fútbol (soccer). De cara el invierno Don Nelson quiere invertir en la compra de telas y materiales para confeccionar ropa de abrigo para lo que necesita un préstamo deUS$400.

loans.use: To buy heavy fabrics for winter, buttons, zippers, threads, and dyes for silk screening

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en: A. Hakim, 29 years old, has a specialized secondary education. His specialization is car repair. He is married and has two children. He has a stall in the Dushanbe market, “Safariyon”, where he sells household goods. Many farmers come and sell their products in that market so they have the opportunity to buy household goods from Hakim. He has been in this business for 2 years. With a loan of $1000 he is going to buy household goods and increase his range of goods. Hakim is going pay off the loan amount in 12 months.

loans.use: To buy household goods

loans.name: Saidmurod

texts.en: Saidmurod A., 37 years old, has undergraduate education and is a builder. He is married and has 4 children. He has an apple orchard, land where he grows wheat, and a cattle-run with a barn. It has been 10 years since he started working in this area. With a loan of $1000 he is going to buy 200 meters of garden hose to water his trees and buy 3 bull-calves for fattening. This loan  can help him increase his yield, sell his apples at a lower price for the population, and provide  fodder grass for the winter. He is going pay off the loan in  6 months.

loans.use: To buy garden hose and 3 bull-calves

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: Memuna Banguran is forty years of age, married to tractor operator and has  four children. She runs a jewelry stall in market in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  She would like a second larger loan fund from SMT to purchase better quality jewelry.   Memuna says that with a larger loan she will be able to extend her business to the near by villages where she will earn more profit.

loans.use: Increase inventory of costume jewlery

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: Memuna S. is married with six children.  She sells cotton clothes in the Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  In Sierra Leone, women play a vital role in earning income for the families through running various small businesses but always lack capital to start, expand or build small shop and stalls. Memuna would like to improve her business stall and diversify her business with other types of clothes.  Therefore she is seeking a second loan of $200 from SMT.

loans.use: Diversify her stock of clothes and renovate her market stall

loans.name: Héctor Romeo

texts.es:
Héctor started selling spices 22 years ago. He was very young when he began because his family needed the income, since his father was the only one that worked and his salary was not enough to cover the family expenses and his children's education. Héctor started working and he paid his own studies and helped his family. He is now married and a father to a nine year old boy. He still sells spices, but he can now offer a greater variety to his clients in the surrounding markets.

Héctor needs a $825 dollar loan to buy merchandise and increase the variety of products he offers his customers. He will also use the money to buy a new place to carry out his business in a better way, replacing the old one he currently uses. He agrees to pay the money back in six months. Be part of Héctor's goals and help this family have a better quality of life, they appreciate your colaboration.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Héctor inició con la venta de especias desde hace 22 años, comenzó desde muy pequeño porque su familia necesitaba de más ingresos y sólo su padre trabajaba, su salario resultaba insuficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos, ante esta necesidad Héctor empezó a trabajar, de esta manera pagó sus estudios y apoyaba con algo en su casa. Ahora él ya está casado, tiene un pequeño hijo de 9 años de edad. Continúa vendiendo especias pero ahora puede ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes en los mercados rodantes.

Para incrementar la variedad de los productos que comercializa, Héctor necesita un préstamo de $ 825 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses, también planea destinar ese dinero a la compra de una estructura para sustituir la que utiliza actualmente y mejorar la calidad de su servicio. Forma parte en los logros de Héctor, ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise and remodeling

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo is married and has a beautiful three year old girl. With the birth of his daughter, the household expenses increased, and his salary was not enough to cover all the debts. Gerardo decided to start selling nutritional products two years ago to increase his income. He began selling the products to his friends and neighbors but soon gained many more clients and made his business grow.

To be able to increase the quality and variety of products he offers, Gerardo is asking for a loan of $825 dollars, which he agrees to return in six months. With your help, you can raise the quality of life of this family and be part of the growth of this business, they will appreciate it.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Gerardo es casado y tiene una preciosa hija de 3 años de edad. Con la llegada de su pequeña, los gastos en su hogar se incrementaron y el salario que recibe resultó insuficiente para cubrir todas las deudas, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, Gerardo decidió comenzar a vender productos nutricionales y complementos alimenticios hace dos años, inició sus ventas entre amigos y vecinos, afortunadamente ha logrado ganar muchos más clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Para poder incrementar la variedad de productos y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece, Gerardo solicita un préstamo de $ 825 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, se parte del crecimiento de este negocio, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La clienta es una mujer emprendedora, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos de 2 y 6 años de edad. Su esposo es taxista y el salario que recibe no es estable, por lo que en ocasiones se acumulaban deudas. Para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, al nacer su primer hijo, ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio con el diseño y elaboración de ropa, comenzó con una pequeña máquina que tenía, ahora ya tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde emplea a tres personas para que le ayuden a cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
El buen servicio que ofrece  ella y la buena calidad de sus productos la han hecho crecer como microempresaria, ahora ella solicita un préstamo de $825 dólares que empleará en la compra de una máquina de coser e insumos que necesita para poder surtir los pedido que tiene, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Forma parte del crecimiento de este negocio y mejora la vida de esta familia, muchas gracias por tu colaboración.

  Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is an enterprising woman, she is married and has two children, ages two and six.   Her husband is a taxi driver and his salary isn't  stable, so sometimes debts would accumulate.  To help her husband, she decided to start her own business, designing and making clothing.  She began after her first child was born and started with a small machine she already owned.  Now, she has a small workshop and three employees that help her cover the demands of her clients. 
The good service and fine quality she offers has made her business grow into a small company.  She wants a loan of $825 dollars to buy a sewing machine and materials so she can fill her customer's orders.  She promises to return the loan in three months.  The loan will help her business grow and raise the quality of life for this family, she thanks you for your help.

loans.use: Purchasing sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Verónica Isabel

texts.es:
Veronica is married and has three children, 8, 9 and 12 years of age. Veronica's father was left unemployed four years ago and in order to obtain an income that would permit an way out of his debts he began with the sale of ears of corn and snacks, in which he relied on Veronica's help; after her father left the business and she continued in order to help her husband with the expenses of their home. When they started they had very few products but Veronica has been increasing her stock and received good response from her clientele.

In order to continue growing with her business Veronica asks for a loan of $375 that will be used in the purchase of merchandise and in publicity in order to improve the quality of service offered, to make herself known in the neighboring housing developments and increase her sales; she firmly promises to pay back this amount in six months. Give Veronica the opportunity to grow; form part of her success; she and her family will thank you greatly for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 8, 9 y 12 años de edad. El padre de Verónica quedó desempleado hace cuatro años y para obtener un ingreso que le permitiera salir de sus deudas comenzó con la venta de elotes y botanas, en donde contaba con la ayuda de Verónica, después su padre salió del negocio y ella continuó para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Cuando empezaron tenían muy pocos productos pero Verónica ha ido incrementando su surtido ha recibido buena respuesta de sus clientes.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio Vero solicita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía y en publicidad para mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece, darse a conocer entre las colonias cercanas e incrementar sus ventas, sella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Dale a Vero la oportunidad de crecer, forma parte de sus logros, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu ayuda.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise and publicity for her snack stand.  Compra de mercancía y publicidad

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is married and has three children; she is disengaged as a nurse in a hospital in Apodaca, Nuevo Leon, where she comes from. The lack of work that exists in the country has impeded her husband's search for a job, before this necessity Cristina accepted the transfer of a family staionary store and after four years, between her and her husband, they have improved the place and the variety of the products offered, receiving good response from their customers.

In these moments, Cristina asks for a loan of $475 that they will use in the purchase of merchandise and in the remodelling of their stationary store; with that they can offer better service to their customers and continue growing as they have up to now; she will repay this amount in six months. Your help will be a great benediction for this family; help them to move forward; they thank you very much for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina es casada y tiene tres hijos, ella se desempeña como enfermera en un hospital de Apodaca, Nuevo León, de donde es originaria. La falta de empleo que hay en el país ha impedido que su esposo consiga un trabajo, ante esta necesidad Cristina aceptó el traspaso que le hizo un familiar de una papelería y desde hace cuatro años, entre ella y su esposo, han mejorado el local e incrementado la variedad de los productos que ofrecen, recibiendo buena respuesta de sus clientes.

En estos momentos, Cristina solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía y en la remodelación de su papelería, con esto podrán ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y continuarán creciendo como hasta ahora lo han hecho, ella devolverá esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu ayuda será de gran bendición para esta familia, ayúdalos a salir adelante, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Remodeling and purchase of merchandise for a stationary store.  Remodelación y compra de mercancía

loans.name: Maria Ignacia

texts.es:
Maria Ignacia is a very hard-working woman; she is married and has two children. Her husband was left without employment for two years and debts were accumulating; in order to get out of economic troubles, Maria and two of her friends decided to create their own business, they dedicated themselves to the fashioning and sale of tamales, which is a typical Mexican food. The strength and good work that they realized has been the basis of this business's success.

In order to cover the demand for their products, Maria Ignacia asks for a loan of $925 that she will use in the purchase of "insumos" that she needs; she commits herself to pay back this amount in six months. Contribute to the growth of this business; form part of Maria's success; deciD. to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Ignacia es una mujer muy trabajadora, elL. es casada y tiene dos hijos. Su esposo se quedó sin empleo hace dos años y las deudas se fueron acumulando, para poder salir D. los problemas económicos Maria y dos D. sus amigas decidieron iniciar su propio negocio, se dedican a L. elaboración y venta D. tamales, que es un alimento típico D. México. El esfuerzo y el buen trabajo que realizan han sido L. base del éxito D. este negocio.

Para poder cubrir L. demanda que tienen sus productos, Maria Ignacia solicita un préstamo D. $ 925 dólares que utilizará en L. compra D. insumos que necesita, elL. se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento D. este negocio, forma parte D. los logros D. Maria, decídete a ayudarL..

loans.use: Purchase of tamale ingredients.  Compra de insumos

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Narcizo

texts.es:
Mr. Narcizo is divorced and has three children; he used to work in construction but this was a transitory job and on occaision he wouldn't obtain any revenue; his parents had a grocery store with the result that making good use of his experience in this line of business, he decided to open his own store and commenced selling a few grocery items and soft drinks seven years ago.

Little by little he has been shooting up more and in order to continue growing he asks for a loan of $650 that he will use on the purchase of fruits and vegetables in order to have a better assortment and to offer better service to his customers; he is prepared to pay back this amount in six months. You can help Narcizo and better his quality of life; decide to support him; he will thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Narcizo es divorciado y tiene tres hijos, él trabajaba en la construcción pero este era un trabajo temporal y en ocasiones no obtenía ningún ingreso, sus padres tenían una tienda de abarrotes así que aprovechando la experiencia que tiene en este giro decidió abrir su propio negocio y comenzó vendiendo pocos productos de abarrotes y refrescos desde hace siete años.

Poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor y para continuar creciendo solicita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de frutas y verduras para tener un mejor surtido y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, él esta dispuesto a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a Narcizo y mejorar su calidad de vida, decídete a apoyarlo, él te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for his grocery store.  Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
I run a small business selling soft drinks, juices, churros, candy, and bread. With this business, I help my husband out with the cost of the kids' education. My clients are all the people in my community. I would appreciate your help in buying provisions for my business and improving my income.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de refrescos, jugos, churros, candy y pan. Con este negocio ayudo a mi esposo con los gastos que tenemos de nuestros hijos para sus estudios. mis clientes son todos los de mi comunidad. Me gustaria que me ayudaran para poder surtir mi negocio y poder mejorar mis ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de refrescos, churros, confites, pan y otos

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: About a year ago, Diana started a business selling and renting videos, DVDs and CDs. She once operated a small grocery, but decided to switch to selling non-perishable items. Her company is in a small park in Ivano-Frankovsk, a good location with no competitors close by. Diana’s husband, Ivan, works as a security guard, but also helps with the business when he can. They are looking forward to the birth of their first child. Diana has requested a loan of $450 to help purchase a new supply of licensed DVDs and CDs. This is her second loan from Nadiya Ukraine. She used the first one to expand her business, and is grateful for the financial help. In the future, Diana would like to open a second sales location. We look forward to seeing how her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of DVDs and CDs

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris supports himself and his wife, Ida, by selling items for use in the home that everyone seems to need at one time or another. From matches, lighters and small tools to clocks, nails and glue--if a customer needs something small for use at home, Boris is likely to have it. He tries to maintain a large selection of items, and has developed a good reputation for running a shop where you can find what you need. His kiosk at the central market in Beregovo is in a good location that attracts customers.

Boris and his wife are facing some financial difficulties. Their home was damaged by a small earthquake, and the insurance company did not help them meet the cost of repairs as it should have. Boris is facing much higher out-of-pocket costs to fix the damage, and needs to generate more income from his business as he works to have his home repaired.

Boris has asked for a loan to help purchase new inventory. The type of business he runs experiences high product turnover, and the loan will help him buy a large number of new items to sell.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a widow who supports herself by selling clothes. She is a smart and capable businesswoman who enjoys her work. Her business is located at the new Image shopping center in Beregovo, which is popular with locals and tourists. Elena has been in business for about eight years and no longer has to pay rent, because she now owns her retail space. In the future, she would like to expand to a second location and hire an employee to help with sales. Elena has asked for a loan to help purchase new inventory so that she can keep up with fast-changing summer fashions. We are happy to have this opportunity to help a hard-working entrepreneur.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: I've dedicated myself to selling bottled drinks. I also sell snacks, bread, rolls and candy. The drinks sell the most since there are businesses close by that sell food and they always buy their drinks from me. With this business I help my family. Currently I need capital to be able to add more supplies to my business and I need your help.

loans.use: Buy more bottled drinks to sell

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en: Lubov has developed a successful small business by selling very practical items – socks and hosiery. Her kiosk at the Rushski market in Melitopol is stocked with a colorful selection of socks, leggings and women’s hosiery. In a typical month, Lubov sells about $2,000 worth of products and makes around $840 in profit. One of the things she likes about this type of retail operation is how easy it is to handle small items, such as socks, rather than other, larger items. She is also helping her daughter establish a small enterprise. Lubov has requested a loan of $900 for her own business to purchase new products and maintain an adequate inventory.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is a widow who supports herself and her 17-year-old son with a business that sells drapes and window decorations. She started her company four years ago, when she was unable to find a stable job but came across a good business opportunity where there was not a lot of competition. Since that time, she has built a strong reputation in her trade. Customers appreciate being able to purchase the items they need, the home-decorating advice and expertise Svetlana offers and her calm demeanor and ability to relate to people. Svetlana has asked for a loan to help purchase new inventory so that she can continue to provide high-quality products to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Estefani Carina

texts.es:
Estefani is a very enterprising and active woman; she is married and comes from the Apodaca region in the state of Nuevo Leon. Her husband is a factory worker, however, the salary he receives is very low and insufficient to cover all the expenses of his home; before the necessity of an extra income, Estefani began with the sale of cosmetics via catalogue, where she has been saving since the year she started.

Now in order to give a push to her business so it can grow, Estefani asks a loan of $475 that she will use in the purchase of merchandise in order to supply the orders of her clients and to improve her service; she offers to pay back the amount in six months. Today you can help who needs it the most; decide to help Estefani; thank you very much for your contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Estefani es una mujer muy emprendedora y muy activa es casada y originaria de la localidad de Apodaca en el estado de Nuevo León. Su esposo es obrero en una fábrica, sin embargo, el salario que recibe es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, Estefani comenzó con las ventas de cosméticos por catálogo, donde ha estado mejorando desde hace un año que empezó.

Ahora para darle un impulso a su negocio y pode crecer, Estefani solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes y mejorar su servicio, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, decídete a apoyar a Estefani, muchas gracias por tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (to fill client orders).  Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Paraska

texts.en: Paraska runs a little business selling shoes and clothing at the popular Image shopping center in Beregovo, Ukraine. She has been in business for about four years, has worked hard to develop and improve her company, and recently made a large investment in it by moving into retail space she purchased in the Image center. Paraska once ran a small grocery, but decided to switch to clothing because it generates higher returns. Lending services from Nadiya Ukraine have been instrumental in helping Paraska develop her business. She has proven to be a wise steward with her funds and has repaid every loan on time. Now she has come to us for a loan for $750 to use as working capital to purchase additional sportswear and shoes to sell. She hopes that this summer will be profitable, and she will be able to generate enough sales and income to meet her needs.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of sportswear and shoes

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora Alicia is married with three children, ages 2, 5, and 7. Her husband works in a tire shop, but his lack of responsibility for his family have made it very difficult for Dora and her children to have basic necessities such as food, clothing, and an education. In order to not depend as much on her spouse, and to give her children what they need, Dora began selling cosmetics, clothing, shoes and jewelry from her home four years ago.

Fortunately, Dora’s sales have grown from the beginning, and once she saw that her clients liked her products, she decided to open a spot in a market with additional and better quality merchandise. In order to stock her business, she is asking for a $275 loan which she has agreed to pay in 3 months. You can help her by contributing to the growth of this business, and to a better quality of life for this family. They thank you for your trust and assistance.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Dora Alicia es casada y tiene tres hijos de 2, 5 y 7 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en una vulcanizadora pero su falta de responsabilidad para con su familia han logrado que Dora y sus hijos tengan serios problemas para obtener lo necesario para poder vivir bien, como alimentos, vestido y educación. Para no depender tanto de su pareja y poder ofrecerle a sus hijos lo que necesitan, Dora inició con las ventas de cosméticos, ropa, zapatos y joyería desde hace cuatro años en su propio hogar.

Afortunadamente sus ventas han mejorado desde que inició y al ver que sus productos eran bien aceptados por sus clientes, decidió establecerse en un mercado con mayor mercancía y de mejor calidad. Para poder surtir bien su negocio solicita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 3 meses. Decídete a apoyarla, contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y mejora la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos te agradecen mucho tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe is an enterprising young woman with a great desire to better her situation. She is a single mother with a four year old child. Four years ago, she decided to open her own business in order to earn an income while still having time for her son. Drawing on her knowledge of work as a beautician, she prepared a small space in her home as a beauty parlor. Little by little she has become know amongst her neighbors for her good service, and this has helped to gain additional clients.

She now asking for a $550 loan to expand her beauty parlor. She will use the loan to pay to remodel and to purchase supplies that she uses for hairdressing. She has agreed to pay the loan in 6 months. You can help Maria to do great things by giving this business the boost that it needs to continue growing. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Guadalupe es una joven emprendedora con grandes deseos de superación, ella es madre soltera de un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso y disponer de tiempo para no descuidar a su hijo, ella inició su propio negocio hace cuatro años, aprovechando los conocimientos que tiene de estilista, acondicionó un pequeño lugar en su casa para acondicionarlo como estética. Poco a poco fue dándose a conocer entre sus vecinos y la buena calidad de servicio que ofrece la ha ayudado a mejora continuamente e incrementar sus clientes.

Ahora necesita ampliar su local para lo que solicita un préstamo de $550 dólares que, además de la remodelación, empelará en la compra de insumos que utiliza en su estética, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Mari puede hacer grandes cosas, decídete a darle el impulso que necesita este negocio para continuar creciendo, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Remodeling and purchase of supplies

loans.name: Faviana

texts.es: I have run a small business making and selling corn tortillas for five years. My clients are my neighbors and other people who enjoy eating my product. I need a loan to buy raw materials so that I can increase my profits.

loans.use: By cornmeal, firewood etc

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
Aracely is a hard working, responsible woman. She and her partner have two daughters, ages 11 and 13, and a 9 year old son. Because their father’s income has not been enough to cover all of the household expenses, 3 years ago Aracely began selling produce and groceries in order to bring in some extra income. Though she started with just a few products, as her sales have increased she has been able to expand her business.

Demand for her products has increased lately, and Aracely is asking for a $1,100 loan to fill the need by purchasing additional merchandise. She has agreed to pay the loan in 6 months. You can be part of Aracely’s success by helping today to improve this family’s life.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Aracely es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora. Ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijas de 11 y 13 años de edad y un hijo de 9 años. El ingreso que su pareja aporta al hogar resultaba insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos, así que para poder obtente un ingreso extra, Aracely inició con la venta de frutería y abarrotes hace tres años, comenzó con muy pocos productos pero, gracias a que sus ventas cada vez fueron mejorando, ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio.

La demanda por sus productos se ha incrementado mucho en esta temporada y para poder cubrirla, Aracely solicita un préstamo de $ 1,100 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Aracely, hoy es momento de ayudar, decídete a mejorar la vida de esta familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina is married with 5 children. Her husband works as an assistant in a business in Apodaca, in the state of Nuevo Leon, but the salary that he receives is very low. Angelina began selling shoes from catalogs four years ago to help her husband with the household expenses. She has been fortunate enough to see her business grow, and now she no longer just sells from catalogs. She has opened a space in her home to display merchandise to increase sales.

Angelina is asking for a $200 loan which she will use to purchase merchandise in order to expand her selection so that her business will continue to grow. She will repay the loan in 3 months. You can be part of the successful development of this business by supporting Angelina. She and her family give their sincere thanks for your trust and assistance.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Angelina es casada y tiene 5 hijos, su esposo trabaja como ayudante en una empresa de la localidad de Apodaca, en el estado de Nuevo León, pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo, para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa, Angelina inició con las ventas de calzado por catálogo hace cuatro años, afortunadamente ha tenido buenos resultados y para mejorar su negocio ya no solo vende por catálogo, ha acondicionado un lugar de su hogar para mostrar la mercancía e incrementar sus ventas.

En estos momentos Angelina solicita un crédito por $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para tener un mejor surtido y poder continuar creciendo, ella devolverá este préstamo en 3 meses. Tú puedes ser parte del desarrollo exitoso de este negocio, decídete a apoyar a Angelina, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga is married with two children, ages 7 and 14. Her husband is a taxi driver who does not receive a set salary. Because of that, it is sometimes very difficult for them to cover all of the expenses of their home. Olga began selling perfume five years ago to help out her husband and to have some extra income. Olga’s strong sales skills have helped her grow her business.

In order to fill the orders made by her clients, Olga is asking for a $200 loan, which she will repay in 3 months. With this loan, she will be able to offer better service and to gain more clients. You can be an important part in the growth of this business and in the life of Olga and her family. They send their thanks for your support.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 7 y 14 años de edad. Su esposo es taxista y no recibe un salario fijo, por lo que en ocasiones es muy difícil cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar, para ayudar a su esposo y tener un ingreso extra, Olga inició con la venta de perfumes desde hace cinco años. La facilidad de palabra que tiene y su gusto por las ventas han ayudado a Olga a hacer crecer su negocio.

Para surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes Olga solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares, que se compromete a devolver en 3 meses, con esto podrá mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece e incrementar sus clientes. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de Olga y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
Maria Concepcion is a hard working woman who labors every day to progress. She is married with three children, who are 14, 9 and 7 years old. Her husband has a small stand where he sells corn, but the income is not stable, and sometimes it is very low. The family was able to purchase some land where they could build their own house, and the payments that they are making have reduced their income even further. Because of that, Maria began selling cosmetics from catalogs 7 years ago. Maria’s great desire to offer the best to her family and to get ahead have motivated Maria to work hard.

Maria is getting more clients every day, and she is asking for a $200 loan which she will use to purchase merchandise to meet the demand. She agrees to pay back the loan in just 3 months. You can be an important part of in the life of Maria and her family by contributing to the growth of her business. They send their thanks.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Concepción es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza día a día por salir adelante, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 9 y 14 años de edad y el más pequeño de sólo 7 meses de edad. Su esposo tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende elotes, el ingreso que obtiene no es estable y en ocasiones es muy bajo, se les presentó la oportunidad de adquirir un terreno para construir su propia casa y los pagos reducían aun más los ingresos, por esta razón Maria comenzó sus ventas de cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 7 años. Los deseos de darle lo mejor a su familia y de poder salir adelante han motivado a Maria a trabajar mucho.

Sus clientes cada vez son mayores y para cubrir su demanda Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar este préstamo en solo 3 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de Maria y su familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.es:
Eleazar is 32 years old, and is married with 2 small children who attend elementary school. His wife cares for the children and works as a homemaker. More than five years ago, he began working for a construction company where he became skilled in plumbing and painting. Once he had finished his contract with the company, he decided to go into business for himself. As his clients have recommended him to others, he has been able to earn a living for his family and offer them better quality of life.

Eleazar is requesting a $250 loan which he will use to purchase materials and tools that will allow him to do high quality work more quickly. In order to grow his business Eleazar would like to open a shop and contract two people to help him. Your help will help this business to successfully grow. Thank you for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Eleazar tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos pequeños que estudian la primaria, su esposa se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos. Él inició hace más de cinco años ofreciendo sus servicios a una constructora, ahí aprendió el oficio de plomero y pintor, al terminar su contrato decidió trabajar por su cuenta, sus mismos clientes lo recomendaban con otros, de esta manera es como ha logrado sacar adelante su familia y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.

Ahora Eleazar solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de materiales y herramienta para realizar su trabajo más rápidamente y con mejor calidad. Para poder hacer crecer su negocio Eleazar desea establecerse en un local y contratar a dos personas que le ayuden, con tu ayuda será posible el desarrollo exitoso de este negocio, muchas gracias por tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and tools

loans.name: Maria Del Rocío

texts.es:
Maria del Rocio is 41 years old. She and her husband have a daughter, who works together with her father in a refinery. Recently, this family was able to purchase their own home, but the payments that they make have significantly impacted their income. Two years ago, Maria began selling groceries in order to help her husband pay the bills. Her husband and daughter help her as time allows.

Though her store is small, Maria believes that it will grow if she can offer better merchandise on display shelves, and if she can increase the variety of the products that she offers for sale. In order to do this, she is asking for a $475 loan which she will repay in 6 months. Please help Maria’s store to gain momentum by supporting her. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del Rocío tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija, la cual trabaja en una refinería junto con su padre. Hace poco les fue posible adquirir su propia vivienda, pero los pagos que realizan han disminuido considerablemente el ingreso que recibe esta familia, para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, Maria inició con la venta de abarrotes hace 2 años, donde recibe la ayuda de su esposo e hija cuando tienen tiempo disponible.

Su tienda es pequeña pero Maria desea hacerla creer y sabe que podrá hacerlo si muestra mejor la mercancía en estantes e incrementa la variedad de productos que ofrece, para esto solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Ayuda a Maria a darle un impulso a su negocio, decídete a apoyarla, ella y su familia te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Purchase of displays and merchandise

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra Patricia is 32 years and a single mother of a precious 3-year-old girl who is in kinder garden. Sandra started selling shoes and home decorating goods through catalog order two years ago because she became reponsible for supportting herself and her daughter, while still giving her the care and attention necessary. She was able to sell her merchandise to her friends when she first started up and, after that, her clientele began to grow gradually. This is how she has been providing for her daughter.

Sandra needs a loan in the amount of $475.00 to fulfill the orders she has received. This amount will be used to purchase merchandise. She commits to repaying the loan within 6 months. You could help improve this family’s living standards by contributing to the growth of the business. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra Patricia tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de una preciosa niña de 3 años que estudia preescolar. Sandra inició con la venta de zapatos y artículos decorativis para el hogar por catálogo hace dos años, por la responsabilidad que tiene de sacar adelante a su hija ella sola y a la vez tener el tiempo para darle el cuidado y las atenciones que necesita. Comenzó vendiendo con sus amistades y poco a poco ha incrementado su número de clientes, de esta manera ha logrado sacar adelante a su pequeña hija.

Para poder surtir todos los pedidos que tiene, Sandra solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a mejorar la vida de esta familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Manuela Janeth

texts.es:
Manuela is 26 years old. She is a young entrepreneur and an overachiever. She is single and attending college. She already works for a company and, recently, purchased her own home - mortgage payments are deducted from her paycheck. She began selling shoes through catalog order only two years ago to pay for college expenses. The biggest forces behind the growth of her business are enthusiasm and her will to grow.

Now she needs a $250.00 loan so that she can purchase merchandise to satisfy her clients’ demands. She commits to paying back her loan within 3 months. You could help Manuela achieve her goals. Do not let her dreams be interrupted. Thank you very much for trusting and for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuela tiene 26 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora con grandes deseos de superación, ella es soltera, está estudiando su carrera universitaria y trabaja en una empresa, recientemente ha adquirido su casa propia, que le descuentan por nómina. Para poder cubrir los gastos de sus estudios inició con la venta de calzado por catálogo hace dos años, el entusiasmo y las ganas que tiene de salir adelante han sido el impulso más grande que tiene para hacer crecer su negocio.

Ahora Manuela necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Manuela, no permitas que sus sueños se vean interrumpidos, muchas gracias por tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: San Juana Maribel

texts.es:
San Juana is 38 years-old, married and has two sons. One of them works and the other is getting ready to begin his college classes. Her husband works at a gas station and his income is not enough to cover the house's and their son's college expenses. Faced with the need of creating another source of income, San Juana started selling cabinets two years ago out of an adapted room in her home. Business has gradually improved and now she has a greater amount of customers.

To expand her business and take it even further, San Juana requests a loan in the amount of $375.00. It will be used to purchase more cabinets and other merchandise to build up a better inventory and to continue being her clients' favorite retailer. She commits to paying the loan back within 6 months. You can contribute to this business' growth and help improve this family's quality of life. They truly appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

San Juana tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos uno de ellos trabaja y el otro esta por iniciar sus estudios universitarios. Su esposo trabaja en una gasolinera y el ingreso que recibe es muy bajo, insuficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, San Juana inició con la venta de abarrotes hace dos años, acondicionando un pequeño lugar de su casa, poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor y ahora cuenta con un mayor número de clientes.

Para ampliar su negocio y darle un impulso, San Juana solicita un préstamo de $375 dólares que empleará en la compra de estantes y mercancía para tener un mejor surtido y continuar con la preferencia de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a esta familia a mejorar su calidad de vida, ellos te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Compra de estantes y mercancía

loans.name: Glenda Yamileth

texts.en: I have been selling seasoning for cooking for 3 years. I generally purchase large quantities so that I can package and sell them individually to neighbors and markets. I need buy more and increase my profits. I need your help.

loans.use: To sell cooking seasonings

payments.comment: Gracias por apoyarme, mis ventas estan mejorando y necesito invertir un poco mas de capital.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
Eleuteria is married and has two sons: a 12 and a 5-year-old. She is originally from San Luis Potosi, later she moved to Guadalupe, in Nuevo Leon state, in search of better opportunities. She has been selling clothes for the last four years. She went into this field because her sister would give her clothes as gifts. She would, then, sell the ones that did not fit to generate an extra income and, slowly, she began receiving more orders and needed more merchandise.

Fortunately, demand for merchandise is up and she has outlets in different street markets where she has had good profits. In order to acquire more merchandise for the new season, Euleteria needs a loan in the amount of $250.00, which she commits to repaying in three months. Your help can help improve her family's life and contribute to the growth of her business. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Eleuteria es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 12 y 5 años de edad, ella es originaria de San Luis Potosí, pero en busca de mejores oportunidades se mudó a la localidad de Guadalupe, en el estado de Nuevo León. Eleuteria se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace cuatro años, inició porque tiene una hermana le regalaba ropa y al no ser de las tallas correctas, para no dejarlas sin uso y obtener un ingreso extra, las vendía, poco a poco fue recibiendo pedidos y comenzó a surtir mas mercancía.

Afortunadamente la demanda por sus productos es buena y ahora se establece en algunos mercados, donde logra tener altas ventas. Para poder surtir más mercancía de la nueva temporada, Eleuteria solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que se compromete devolver en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás mejorar la vida de esta familia contribuyendo al desarrollo de su negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a hard-working woman. She is married and has two daughters: the eldest is a five-year-old and the youngest is just a one-month-old baby. For the past four years, Elizabeth has dedicated herself to selling toys and baby's apparel. She started her business after her husband's contract with the construction company he was employed with ended. With her husband’s income missing bills started to pile up and she decided to generate her own income to try to fill the gap.

It's been less than one month since her second child was born. During this period, her business received less attention because she's had no one else around to help out. Now she is able to return to work and she needs a $250.00 loan to purchase merchandise that can boost up her business. She commits to paying her loan back within three months.

This is an important matter for this family's well-being. Please, help Mrs. Rodriguez's business grow. She truly appreciates your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth es una mujer muy trabajadora, es casada y tiene dos hijas, una de 5 años de edad y otra de sólo un mes de nacida. Desde hace cuatro años Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de juguetes y artículos para bebé, inició su negocio después de que su esposo terminó el contrato en la constructora en la que estaban empleado, al no contar con un ingreso las deudas de su hogar comenzaron a acumularse y para poder ayudar a su esposo decidió abrir su propio negocio.

Hace apenas un mes que nació su segunda bebé y descuidó un poco su negocio porque no tenía a nadie que le ayudara, pero ahora que puede regresar a trabajar necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, ayuda a Elizabeth a crecer con su negocio, ella agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: I have been selling sweets and candies for 2 1/2 years. I need to replenish my inventory so that can keep selling this month. With this business I help my family and children with their studies and other needs.

loans.use: Buy candies, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Luz Areli

texts.en: My business is making and packaging tortillas, and I have been doing so for 3 1/2 years.  I sell in my community and I support my family with the income I earn. Currently I need capital to be able to add more supplies to my business.

loans.use: Purchase corn and packaging for tortillas

loans.name: Thelma Elizabeth

texts.es:
I run a small business from my home selling used clothing. My clients are my neighbors. This business has helped me and my family a lot. Now I need to buy more stock, because I have had several requests and want to give my clients better service. I would be very grateful for your help.

Translated fro Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

Yo tengo un pequeño negocio en mi casa de venta de ropa usada. Mis clientes son mis besinos. Este negocio me ayudado mucho y a mi familia tambien. ahora nesecito comprar mas ropa en este mes porque tengo varios encargos y quiero darles un mejor servicio a mi clientela. Me gustaria mucho que me pudieran ayudar.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

payments.comment: Mis ventas han mejorado, ahora necesito invertir para surtir en esta temporada mi inventario.

loans.name: Hortencia
