texts.en: I have been selling women´s beauty products (cosmetica, shampoo and conditioner) for 2 1/2 years. My clients are neighbors and women who work in offices. With the income I earn, I support my family and provide for my children´s education. I also sell candy in my home.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics (creams, eye shadows, shampoo, conditioner, etc.)

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
Ada is a 46-year-old divorced mother of three, one of whom still lives with her. Ada is a fighter, and she has struggled to make life better for her family despite her adversities.

When she was young, she studied dress design and dressmaking and worked several years in a shop. She has an entrepreneurial spirit and has always looked for ways to get ahead in her profession. She scraped together some savings and opened her own shop, where she custom-tailors clothes for men, women, and children. Her specialty is evening gowns, but she also produces sports clothes, uniforms, children's clothes, etc.

Thanks to her fine craftsmanship, she has many clients, who advertise her business by word of mouth. Business is booming, and clients want increasingly complex designs. She can't manufacture some of these designs on her outdated sewing machine, and she wants a newer model that costs $400. This machine is faster and can be used on many kinds of fabric. This machine will help her fill customer orders and work more rapidly and efficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

Ada es una señora de 46 años, separada y madre de 3 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos aun vive con ella; Ada es una mujer luchadora que supo llevar adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. Cuando joven estudio corte y confección, trabajo varios años en una textilería. Ella siempre fue emprendedora, y busco siempre progresar en su profesión, por lo que junto unos ahorros y abrió su propio atelier, donde hoy día ella confecciona ropas hechas a medidas para damas caballeros y niños. Su especialidad son los vestidos de gala, pero también confecciona otro tipo de ropas como deportivas, uniformes, ropa para niños, etc. Ella cuenta que gracias a su buen trabajo siempre tiene muchos clientes, estos a su vez hacen buena publicidad de ella y las demandas de su trabajo aumentan considerablemente; a la par de que aumenta la demanda los diseños también se vuelven mas complejos, y con la máquina de coser que ella trabaja no le permite realizar muchos de los diseños que le piden. Ada desea adquirir una máquina nueva, cuyo valor en el mercado es de $ 400, y que es más rápida, cose diferentes tipos de telas y que le ayudara a satisfacer sus demandas y trabajar de forma rápida y ágil.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Business Description

Ms. Clara has been the owner of her pharmacy for ten years now. She started her store after she finished her degree in medicine, with some savings she had accumulated. She rents the storefront for her pharmacy and consulting from which she provides a low-cost service to her customers. Her pharmacy is open from 8am to 10pm from Monday to Sunday. She sells a variety of medicines as well as milk, juices etc. She hires one employee to help her in the store.

Loan Use

Dr. Clara wishes to invest in adding a beauty supply section to her pharmacy. She would like to purchase shampoos, hair dyes and other accessories to re-sell. She would also like to hire another employee to help her, because she has high demand in her pharmacy right now.

Personal Information

Ms. Clara is married and is 42 years old. She has two young daughters who are both school aged. Her husband works in a molding shop for industrial factories. Her home is 2 stories and made of cement; both she and her husband work to support the family. She wishes to continue to work, and after growing with us, to give opportunities to others to work with her in her small-business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

La señora Clara es dueña de una farmacia, tiene 10 años en este negocio. La inicio a raíz que obtuvo su titulo de médico con unos ahorros que tenia guardado. Ella arrienda un local para la farmacia y el consultorio. Ella atiende a sus pacientes a bajo costo. En la farmacia se atiende de de 8am hasta 10pm de lunes a domingo. Ella vende todo tipo de medicinas, además de leche, jugos etc. Tiene un chico que le atiende la farmacia

Uso del Préstamo

La Dra. Clara desea invertir en un gabinete de belleza que puso frente a su farmacia. Desea comprar shampoo, tintes y accesorios para este negocio, además de contratar a otra persona para que le ayude, porque la demanda en su gabinete es alta.

Información Personal

La Sra. Clara tiene 42 años de edad y es casada. Tiene 2 hijas menores de edad que están en la escuela. Su esposo tiene un taller de fabricación de moldes para fábricas industriales. Su casa es de 2 pisos de cemento. Y ambos sostienen su hogar. Su deseo es seguir trabajando y al crecer ella con nosotros, darle la oportunidad a otros para que sean parte de su microempresa.

loans.use: To invest in a beauty supply section for her store.

loans.name: Bélgica

texts.es:
Business Description

Ms. Bélgica sells"basic needs" groceries such as: noodles, rice, oils, beef, chicken, etc. She tends her store from 6am to 10pm. She has 15 years experience in her store. Ms. Bélgica began her business with money her husband gave her for the groceries, which she managed to save from and began to purchase more merchandise. Ms. Bélgica's store is run from her own home and she has plenty of experience.

Loan Use

Ms. Bélgica wishes to apply for a loan to stock more merchandise for her store, such as chicken, meats and vegetables because her store is very well located and she has high demand from her customers for these items.

Personal Information

Ms. Bélgica is 55 years old, she is separated from her husband and she has 4 children, 2 who are adults and help with the household expenses and the others go to High School. Her husband pays her child support every month to help with her childrens' studies and to purchase food. Her home is made of wood and cement, but is also very modest. She has fought to support her home and family. She hopes that this loan will improve her business and this will improve her own quality of life and that of her family's.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

La señora Bélgica se dedica a la venta de víveres de primera necesidad como, fideos, arroz, aceites, carne de res, pollo, etc. Ella atiende en su negocio desde las 6am hasta las 10pm. Ella lleva 15 años dedicada a esta actividad. La señora Bélgica inicio su negocio con el dinero que su esposo le daba para la comida ella iba ahorrando y así empezó a comprar mercadería. Doña Bélgica tiene su tienda en su mismo domicilio y tiene experiencia en el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

La Sra. Bélgica desea el crédito para abastecerse de mas mercadería como pollo, carne y legumbres ya que su negocio tiene una muy buena ubicación y existe gran demanda de los clientes en el sector de estos productos.

Información Personal

La Sra. Bélgica tiene 55 años de edad, esta separada de su esposo, tiene 4 hijos, 2 son mayores de edad y le ayudan con los gastos del hogar, tiene un hijo especial y otro que estudia en el colegio. Su esposo le da una mensualidad para los estudios y alimentación de sus hijos. Su casa es propia de madera y cemento, muy modesta. Ella es una mujer que ha luchado por sacar adelante su hogar. Ella desea con este crédito mejorar su negocio y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.)

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise, such as chicken and meats.

loans.name: Aura

texts.es:
Business Description

Ms. Aura has worked for ten years selling clothing but two years ago she decided to open her own eatery. She began her business with some money her husband gave her from his earnings as a driver. Since then, she has sold things such as fish and rice, rice and vegetable stew with chicken, fritters, sodas, and beers. Her business is located in her own home. She tends to customers from Friday to Monday from 7pm to 3am.

Loan Use

Ms. Aura wishes to apply for a loan to purchase more rice, beef, chicken and drinks. She has already been loaned money at a rate of 20% and is losing money, and so she hopes she can receive a loan from us so that she can improve her business.

Personal Information

Ms. Aura is 42 years old and she lives with her husband of 20 years. She has 4 children, but only one remains dependant on she and her husband. Her husband and her older daughter help her in her store. In the mornings her husband also works a driver and his earnings help support the family as well. Her home is one story cement. She hopes to improve her business and hopes that this loan will help her to improve her family's quality of life as well.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

La señora Aura tiene 10 años dedicada al comercio, ella vendía ropa, pero hace 2 años decidió poner un comedor en su casa. Ella inicio su negocio con un dinero que le dio su esposo que es chofer. Desde entonces vende arroz con pescado, arroz con menestra y pollo, fritada, colas, cervezas. Su negocio esta en su propio domicilio. Atiende de viernes a lunes desde las 7pm hasta las 3am.

Uso del Préstamo

La señora Aura desea su crédito para comprar más arroz, y carne de res, pollo, cerdo y las bebidas, ya que ella ha estado prestando dinero al 20% y esto ha bajado un poco su capital, por eso desea este crédito con nosotros y de esta manera mejorar su negocio.

Información Personal

La Sra. Aura tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo hace 20 años en el sector, tiene 4 hijos, solo uno depende de ellos. Su esposo y su hija mayor le ayudan en el negocio. Además por las mañanas su esposo trabaja de chofer y con sus ingresos ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Su casa es de 1 piso de cemento. Ella tiene muchos deseos de superación por eso anhela que con los créditos que pueda tener mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her eatery.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Luis is a clothing salesman who now also has his own tailoring shop. He began working from the time he was very young, so that he could feed himself. He travels to and from many different locations within his province, and he currently works with his wife Norma, who has been a big help to him. He works from 8am to 6pm.

Loan Use

Mr. Luis needs this loan to purchase more merchandise, since his demand is high, and he would like to travel to new provinces to sell his products. He would also like to improve his home.

Personal Information

Mr. Luis is 55, married and has 5 children, 4 of whom are adults, only one is still in school. Family life is very important to him. His wife helps him in his shop and his children help him with the household expenses. His home is 1 story, cement. He also has a car he uses as a taxi occassionally, providing some additional income for his family. His ambition is to grow with us and to give a better future to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Luis se dedica al comercio en lo que se refiere a vente de ropa y ahora a lo que es taller de costura, comenzó desde muy pequeño por la necesidad de conseguir el pan de cada día tuvo que dedicarse de lleno a ese labor. Viajando desde diferentes lugares de la provincia supo mantenerse, actualmente trabaja con su esposa Norma, donde le ha servido de gran apoyo entrando de lleno al negocio de la mano de su esposo Luis. El trabaja de 8am hasta 6pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Don Luis necesita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería, ya que por la demanda de sus clientes sus ventas aumentaron, inclusive ahora ya recorre otras provincias con la necesidad de vender promocionar aun mas sus productos. Además desea ir mejorando su casa.

Información Personal

Don Luis tiene 55 años, es casado, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 son mayores de edad y solo uno estudia. El tiene una excelente relación familiar. Además su esposa le ayuda con el negocio y sus hijos le ayudan con los gastos del hogar. Su casa es de 1 piso de cemento. El también cuneta con un carro donde hace fletes y esto es un ingreso adicional para su hogar. El aspira a crecer con nosotros y de esta manera darle un mejor futuro a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Cesar has been working as a grocer of fruits and cheeses for 20 years now. He learned this trade as an adolescent working for his Uncle and then took this experience to start his own business. He sells his fruits from a bicycle and he travels throughout his neighborhood with his products. He starts working at 8am and finishes at 6pm, with a lunch break from 1pm-3pm, from Monday to Friday and during the mornings on Saturday and Sunday from 8am-1pm.

Loan Use

Mr. Cesar wishes to purchase more fruits, and since he also has experience selling prawns, he would like to expand this area of sales. By doing this, he will be able to better tend to his customers and to meet his high demand which is increasing. With this loan he will be able to expand his business even more.

Personal Information

Mr. Cesar is 41, married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school. His home is made of cement and is only a single story and very simple. His older son helps him with his business and his wife takes charge of household chores. He very much wishes to improve himself and his home, so long as business continues to grow and he brings in higher earnings. He also hopes to improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Cesar se dedica hace 20 años al comercio de frutas y queso. El aprendió esta actividad porque desde adolescente trabajaba con su tío y con esta experiencia que adquirió decidió empezar a trabajar el solo. El vende sus frutas en un triciclo y recorre todos los sectores por su barrio. El empieza a trabajar desde las 8:00am hasta 13:00pm y de 15:00pm hasta 18:00pm de lunes a viernes y los sábados y domingos del 08:00am hasta 13:00pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Don Cesar desea adquirir mas frutas, además que el tiene experiencia en la venta de camarón y desea incrementar esta línea de venta. Y de esta manera atender a sus clientes ya que la demanda que el tiene de sus productos esta en crecimiento. Con el crédito el puede lograr expandirse aun más.

Información Personal

Don Cesar tiene 41 años es casado, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian. Su casa es de cemento de un piso y muy sencilla. Su hijo mayor es quien le ayuda con el negocio y su esposa se dedica a las cosas del hogar. El tiene mucho deseo de superarse y aspira mejorar su casa conforme su negocio vaya creciendo y tenga más ganancia. Además de mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and other products.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Business Description

Ms. Blanca has a grocery store where she also sells stationary supplies. Her store is in her home, in an area very lucrative for these types of sales. She began her business with a $100 loan from a family member.

Loan Use

Blanca will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as office supplies and stationary, because she lives diagonally from a school. She also wishes to improve her business' facade and would like to repaint the exterior and to place a sign that draws more attention.

Personal Information

Blanca is 36, and out of her five children, four go to school. Her home is made of cement and she has a stable family life. She is sure that her business will allow her the opportunity to give a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer,Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Blanca tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes, viveres y de articulos de papeleria que atiende en su casa donde dispuso unlocal para dicha venta. Este negocio lo inicio con $100 que prestó a un familiar.

Uso del Préstamo

Blanca usará el préstamo para comprar más mercaderia en especial articulos de oficina y papeleria porque ella esta diagonal a una escuela tambien va a acondicionar la fachada de su negocio pues desea pintar y poner un letrero mucho mas llamativo

Información Personal

Blanca tiene 36 años de sus cinco hijos cuatro estudian su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar, ella tiene la seguridad que su negocio le dará la oportunidad de poder educar bien a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise such as office supplies and paper.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Business Description

Ms. Alexandra began her business four years ago, selling her products as a traveling saleswoman. She travelled between different sectors of her city, but decided in the end to place her business in her home. She sells basic needs items, and her sales increase evey day.

Loan Use

She is confident that this loan will allow her to purchase more merchandise for her store. With her customers continuning to ask for new products, she needs to stock a variety of items in order to satisfy the demand so that her customers don't take their business elsewhere.

Personal Information

She is 44 years old, her home is made of cement and her goal is to have a larger store within her home so that she can better tend to her customers, but this has been difficult as she has not had the capital to invest.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora Alexandra empezó su negocio hace 4 años con un capital producto de venta de mercadería ambulante, ella recorría diferentes lugares de la ciudad pero decidió ponerse una tienda en su propia casa, vende productos de primera necesidad y su actividad en cuanto a las ventas han aumentado cada día mas

Uso del Préstamo

Ella confía en el préstamo que se le entregue para de esta manera poder comprar mas mercadería para su tienda ya que los clientes cada día hacen nuevos pedidos, pues quiere tener variedad de productos para que así sus clientes no tengan que comprar en otros lugares.

Información Personal

Tiene 44 años y un hijo, su vivienda es de cemento, sus metas siempre es tener un local grande en su casa para de esta manera poder atender la necesidad de sus clientes pero le ha sido difícil ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. C. began his business with som savings 8 years ago. Before, he worked selling wholesale products in the center of the city, but decided to install a store in his own him. His business has grown and now his store sees many customers. He sells tinned vegetables, meats and other popular products.

Loan Use

He wishes to invest his loan to purchase more merchandise, because it is easier to buy some items on wholesale, to then resell to his customers at a more affordable price. He hopes that by doing this he will be able to attract more customers as his store is located in a central area.

Personal Information

Mr. C. is 32, married and has three children, one of whom goes to a nearby school. His home is made of cement and he has a healthy, stable family life. His goal is to stock his store and to be able to offer more to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

El Señor C. empezó su negocio hace 8 años producto de un ahorro que antes trabajaba vendiendo productos al por mayor en el centro de la ciudad pues decidió instalar una despensa en su propia casa, su negocio ha aumentado y hoy su tienda es muy visitada por los clientes ya que el vende legumbres embutidos, carnes y demás productos de consumo mayor

Uso del Préstamo

El quiere invertir su préstamo en comprar mas mercadería ya que ciertos productos es conveniente comprar al por mayor para poder luego distribuir a sus clientes a un costo económico pues con este mecanismo el quiere atraer mas clientes ya que su despensa esta ubicado en un lugar céntrico del sector

Información Personal

El señor C. tiene 32 años esta casado y tiene tres hijos uno de ellos estudia en un establecimiento cercano, su vivienda es de cemento y su estabilidad familiar es muy buena, sus metas es tener su local surtido y de esta manera poder tener de todo para los clientes.

loans.use: To invest in more merchandise.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Q. has a bicycle and motorcycle repair shop, which he began with money he received from his previous job's liquidation, 5 years ago. Currently, his wife also works in his shop, where she works primarily selling spare parts. Their shop is located on a principal road in the commercial center of the community, and has had success there.

Loan Use

He hopes that with this loan, he will be able to invest in a variety of merchandise such as spare parts. He is constantly buying them little by little and his customers must occasionally wait for him to have items in stock.

Personal Information

Mr. Q. is 30 years old and has 2 children. His home is made of cement and his children go to school in nearby schools. He suffered from an accident 5 years ago, and lost one of his legs. However, he always keeps himself busy and valiantly began his business from his own home, because he knows he must continue to work to support his family. His goal is to one day have a large shop where he can employ other people like him.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

El Señor Q. tiene un taller donde realiza reparaciones de bicicletas y motos el empezó su negocio hace 5 años con un capital que tenia producto de una liquidación de un trabajo en una empresa particular, al momento su esposa también trabaja en su local pues ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos. Su taller esta ubicado en una avenida principal de un sector comercial de la comunidad por lo cual tiene gran acogida

Uso del Préstamo

El espera con el crédito que se le otorguen poder invertir en variedad de mercadería tales como repuestos, ya que siempre el esta comprando poco y no tiene para ofrecer a sus clientes al momento de una reparación.

Información Personal

El Señor Q. tiene 30 años y 2 hijos su casa es de cemento y sus hijos estudian en establecimientos cercanos. Hace 5 años el sufrió un accidente de transito producto de esto perdió una de sus piernas, pero siempre se destaco por no dejarse vencer del tiempo y valientemente inicio el negocio en su propia casa pues el considera que tiene que trabajar para poder sobresalir junto a su familia, su meta es un día poder tener un taller grande donde incluso dar oportunidad de trabajo a personas como el

loans.use: Spare parts and other items.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Bartolome has his own store where he sells seafoods and meats. He began his business 3 years ago with money he earned from a business he and selling clothing in different sectors of the city. He helps his wife from his stationary store starting at mid-day, and he has seen his business grow with time because of it's good location.

Loan Use

He wishes to use part of the loan to purchase merchandise and the other part to repair and improve his store in order to give a better service to his customers.

Personal Information

Mr. Bartolome is 40 years old and has four children, who all go to school. His home is made of cement. His goal to to see his business grow and one day to hand over his business to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

El señor Bartolomé tiene un local donde vende mariscos y carnes, su negocio inicio hace 3 años con un capital que obtuvo con un negocio de ropa la misma que la vendía en diferentes lugares de la cuidad, en su local le ayuda su esposa a partir del medio día, su negocio a crecido con el pasar del tiempo ya que su ubicación es buena.

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere usar parte de su préstamo para comprar mercadería y otra parte para adecuar su local ya que su intención es dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes

Información Personal

El Señor Bartolomé tiene 40 años y 4 hijos de los cuales tres están estudiando, su vivienda es de cemento, sus metas es que su local crezca y un día sean sus hijos quienes administren su negocio

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and to improve his store.

loans.name: Saba Din

texts.en: Saba D. lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with all members of his family. He is married. He lived for a long time in other countries. He has good experience in shopkeeping. He has a small ice cream shop.  He wants to take an individual loan to buy new ice cream machines  and also rent a new and larger shop to attract more clients and make a good monthly income to help his family. He is very happy with this loan. He would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy ice cream machines

loans.name: Whed Allah

texts.en: Whed Allah lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with all members of his family. He is married. He has a retail shop and he has good work experience. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy extra items like boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, packet of crisps, and bags of potato chips so that he can attract more clients and support his family. He would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy extra retail

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina has a small kiosk at the Rushki Market in Melitopol where she sells a beautiful array of dishware and small souvenir items. She has been in business for thirteen years now. The income she makes has been a very important source of provision for her and her husband, Sergei, as they have raised their two daughters. Irina is able to provide financial help to her parents as well. Irina has a reputation as a goal-oriented, polite, and hard-working business owner. She had a serious surgery not long ago, but she continues to work and develop her business. In the future, she hopes to open a new sales location which would dramatically increase the size of her venture. Irina has requested a short term loan of $500 to give her some additional working capital to buy necessary inventory.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Michail

texts.en: Michail uses his small van as a taxi, transporting passengers around his home base of Ivano-Frankivsk or further if necessary. Michail started driving a taxi eight years ago after he finished a time of service in the Ukrainian military. He makes around $35 per day which is enough to support himself and his wife, Evgeniya, and their three year old daughter. Michail is a positive influence on those around him and demonstrates responsibility and a good work ethic. He has requested a loan for $700 to help pay for some maintenance on his taxi. We are grateful for this opportunity to assist him with his business and help keep him out on the road earning a living.

loans.use: Taxi maintenance

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria has a small business selling women’s clothing in Novaya Kahovka, located in south central Ukraine. Like many entrepreneurs in Ukraine, her business provides a great opportunity for her to earn a livable income and have the benefits of working for herself. She has been in business for one year, and is looking forward to the future and meeting her goals. She has requested a loan for $500 that will give her additional working capital to invest in her business. Victoria is the type of entrepreneur we want to assist at Nadiya Ukraine. We look forward to many more opportunities to help her develop her new venture.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en: Lubov is a seasoned entrepreneur from Novaya Kohovka, Ukraine. She has had her own business for the past ten years. About a year ago, she decided to move into a new area and started a business selling children’s toys and clothing. She was able to set up an attractive indoor sales location and has worked hard to see the new venture be successful. One of her main goals for having her business is to be able to improve the financial situation of her family. Lubov has requested a loan so that she can make a business trip to Turkey to purchase new inventory. Being in close proximity to Ukraine, Turkey is an excellent source of imported goods such as clothing. Lubov would like to purchase products in bulk at good prices so that she can make a good return and continue building her business.

loans.use: Business trip to Turkey

loans.name: Stephan

texts.en: Stephan is a hard-working taxi driver from the Ivano-Frankivsk region in western Ukraine. About a year ago, he decided to quite his previous job and start his own business driving a taxi. He works with a dispatching company called Radiotaxi 065, which helps direct him to waiting passengers and makes his work more efficient. Stephan is married. His business is the main source of income for he and his wife, Maria. Depending on how busy he is, Stephan will make between about $25 and $30 per day. He is ready to work seven days a week if necessary to earn as much as he can. Stephan has requested a loan for $300 to make a repair to the engine on his taxi. Having a reliable car is vitally important to the success of his business. We are happy to be able to help Stephan maintain his car and continue earning his livelihood.

loans.use: Repair engine on taxi

loans.name: Mohammed Alie

texts.en: Mohammed J. is 25 years of age. He is married with three children. At 18 he decided to start a small business of selling second hand clothing in the Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  Mohammed started the business first as a hawker.  Later with his first loan of $100, he was able to expand his business to a market stall.   He is requesting a second larger loan of $200 from SMT to purchase four bales of second hand clothing for the same purpose.

loans.use: Purchase 4 bales of used clothing

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma T. is thirty years of age and married with four children.  She sells palm oil in a small stall in the Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  Emma is very ambitious to become a wholesaler of palm oil. She is requesting a second loan of $200 from SMT for purchasing fifty gallons of palm oil and for renovating her stall.  She said, the loan will enable her expand her business and earn more income especially during the off-season period of July to October.  She hopes to save enough money one day to build a small family house.

loans.use: Purchase palm oil stock and renovate her market stall

loans.name: Fatumata

texts.en: Fatumata K. is forty years old and a mother of four children.  She started her business when she was young but could not continue during the civil war.  After the war, she started selling vegetables that she grew around her house.  She saved some of the income from the vegetable sales and diversified her business.  Married to a carpenter, her husband’s income is seasonal and cannot sustain the family all year round.  Fatumata now owns a small stall in the market in Magburaka of Sierra Leone, selling palm oil, rice, onions, butter, etc.  She is interested in increasing her inventory to increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase of additional food stock for her market stall business

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama L. is married to a carpenter and has five children.  A thirty six years old, she runs a small business selling peppers, beans, sesame seeds and palm oil in the Magburaka market in Sierra Leone.  As her husband does not generate income often, Adama takes more responsibility for providing for the family’s basic needs.  She plans to expand her business and increase her income.  For these reasons, Adama is requesting a second loan from SMT of $175.

loans.use: Purchase addtional inventory of food supplies

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: Memuna Thorlie is married and has six children.  At thirty-eight, she is running a small business selling cosmetics.  Her husband also manages a small business selling agricultural products.  Both are working cooperatively to provide the family the best livelihood.  She is requesting a loan of $175 to increase her inventory and generate more income.  They hope to repair the roof of their house with some of their extra income.

loans.use: Increase inventory of cosmetics

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata K. is married with three children.  She is thirty-five years of age and engaged in a fish selling business in the Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  With her previous loan, Aminata was able to expand her business.  Aminata would like a larger loan from SMT to purchase the fish directly from the fishermen instead of through a wholesaler. She plans to extend her business to the villages on village market days.  She supports her husband in meeting family expenses as he is currently jobless.

loans.use: Increase her rotating stock of fish by buying direct from the fishermen

loans.name: Fatumata

texts.en: Fatumata C. is thirty-four years of age and is married with four children.  Fish is one of the main foods in Sierra Leone.  The majority of the population eats fish everyday and therefore there is high demand for fish.  Fatumata sells fish in the Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  Her previous loan expanded her business and she had been assisting her husband in taking care of the family needs.  Fatumata will use the new loan funds for similar purposes.  She and her husband are determined to provide for their family’s future.

loans.use: Increase rotating stock of fish

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim S. was born in the Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.   He is twenty-three years of age, single, and lives with his parents.  He dropped out of school and started a business of selling second hand clothes in town. He is assisting his parents in meeting the expenses of their large family.  He hopes to be more financially stable before he starts his own family so that he can provide for his children's education.  Ibrahim would like to expand his business and income for a better life.

loans.use: Expand stock of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Fazal Ahamad

texts.en: Fazal Ahamad lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with all members of his family. He was in London for about 7 years he came home 9 months ago and opened a burger shop. He took his 5th cycle group loan and bought all the materials for his shop to make a good business. Now he wants to take anther loan to enlarge his shop and expand his business to support his family. He is happy that he can support all the members of his family.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Fadah Mohammad

texts.en: Fadah Mohammad lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is living with all members of his family. He is a butcher. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy a freezer and also enlarge his shop to attract more clients and make contracts with restaurants to bring them meat. He is happy with this loan because it will improve his income.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and enlarge his shop

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
A. Beatrice is a married mother of three children. She came to Kampala in 2000 when the insecurity in northern Uganda worsened. She first settled in Buyale in the Masindi district. Eventually, she resettled at Acholi quarters, Kireka in Kampala with her family.

Being a hard working lady, she joined the stone quarry to work as a means of survival. After a while, she joined the Life in Africa organization. She started learning how to make paper beads like the other ladies, to earn extra income. This brought a lot of changes to her life and she hopes to put up a permanent home for her family. She hopes to do this when peace comes back to northern Uganda.

As for now she wishes to resume a business of selling produce. She had such a business before moving to Kampala. She will be buying from Buyale and reselling in retail in Kampala. Therefore, she wishes to borrow 250,000 Ugandan shillings. This converts into USD150. Her budget is as below:

2 bags of beans, costing 100,000 shillings each. This will total 200,000 shillings;

transport costing 70,000 shillings;

and possible emergencies that would cost 30,000 shillings.

She has already saved 50,000 shillings. She expects a profit of 60,000 shillings every month from the 2 bags. She will therefore be grateful if she is given the loan.

loans.use: Buying Produce

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
A. Doreen is a married mother with 3 children. She comes from northern Uganda. Her husband works as a police officer. As a hard working lady, she does not sit home without supporting the husband. She makes paper beads, to earn more income to support her family.

She joined Life in Africa in 2005. Since then she has been an active member during group production. She participates in about 3 activities a day. She feels she has a lot more free time and wishes to occupy this time with business. At the barracks where she stays, there are many people who use charcoal stoves for cooking. For this reason, she wants to start selling charcoal for more income.

She requests a loan of 250,000 Ugandan shillings, which she will repay in 7 months. This equals a loan request of USD150. Her budget is as below:

15 sacks of charcoal, each at 15,000 shillings, which equals 240,000 shillings in total;

Empty sacks, each at 1000 shillings, which will equal 15,000 shillings in total;

This totals 255,000 shillings.

For this business she does not need transport because lorries keep moving around selling charcoal to resellers. She will also use her outside store for keeping the charcoal. On top of that, she has already saved 5000 shillings to top up this business.

loans.use: Buying Charcoal

loans.name: Melon

texts.en:
Melon is a single mother with four children in her care. She comes from Mbarara district in the western part of Uganda. Currently, she lives in one of the suburbs of Kampala known as Nsimbiziwome. Before Melon joined LiA life was not easy for her, especially having to raise children as a single mother. She chose to work cooking food for Indian couples. The time came when her Indian employers left the country and went back to their home country.

With the wages she had saved, she decided to start a small salon business in 2005. The business has been going well and it enables her to generate a little income to feed her children and also cover her other family bills. From this business, Melon generates a profit of 150,000 Ugandan shillings. Melon is requesting a loan of 250,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD150) to add to her savings of 50,000 shillings to be able to expand her business. With this money, she hopes to buy some more salon machines and also a few salon supplies to be able to attract a larger number of customers and also cater to them efficiently and effectively.

She expects to earn a profit of 250,000 shillings per month since she is going to work together with one lady who is a beautician and a young male who is responsible for male haircuts and treatments. She hopes to repay this loan in four months.

LOAN BUDGET:

Buying a hair cutting machine, costing 100,000;

Buying 1 sitting chair, costing 50,000;

Buying a small hand dryer, costing 30,000;

Buying 2 customer chairs, costing 50,000;

Buying rollers (4 packs), costing 10,000;

Buying a smoother, costing 50,000;

The total cost will be 290,000.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
O. Joseph is an Acholi by tribe. He comes from Pader district, Agayo county, Tenge Parish and Wang lobo village in Northern Uganda. He is 23 and a senior four student. In sports, Joseph is very good at athletics and high jump is his favorite. He was among the top five that represented Uganda at the national level in Nairobi, Kenya, in East Africa.

Like any other Acholi, Joseph’s family members also fled from their home district to central Uganda due to Joseph Kony’s rebel war that has left thousands of people homeless and thousands of others either dead or abducted. He is currently living in the displaced person's camp in Acholi Quarters, Kampala, Uganda. Because of his love for education, he pays his own school fees.

He joined Life in Africa in 2006, where he is now working as a night security guard. During the daytime he goes to school. Since he joined Life in Africa, he has been so active and particularly helpful on payment days when hundreds of Life in Africa members come through the doors to get their payments. He guides them to follow the line and also translates into Acholi for those who don’t understand English very well.

Joseph has been thinking of how to supplement his income so that he may continue with his studies and at the same time do his Life in Africa job and his thought is to do some business that he can operate either when at school or on weekends. His plan is to be a mobile photographer in his free time. Most people in Uganda do not have cameras and when they have any functions, they hire mobile photographers. People like to take photos to exchange with their friends and to remember important events like weddings, study tours and many others.

The total cost of each film and to produce the photos will be 20,000 Ugandan shillings. He expects a profit of 35,000 Ugandan shillings per film. For this project, he needs 250,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD150) that will be used to do the following:

Camera at 200,000 shillings;

Film at 5000 shillings;

Dry cells at 5000 shillings;

12 frames for others who may need them at 2,500 each. This will total 30,000 shillings;

Reserve for developing and printing photos at 10,000 shillings.

Total equals 250,000 Ugandan shillings.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
A. Caroline is a married lady. She has 6 children who all go to school. Her husband is a soldier based in Mubende, Uganda. She comes from Soroti in Eastern Uganda, though her husband comes from the West Nile region in Uganda. She is a good lady, known to some of our members for a long time. She is also a hard working lady who wants to earn more income than relying on the monthly salary of her husband.

She wishes to boost her local brew business by borrowing 250,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD150) to add to the business. She will be able to make a profit of 80,000 shillings per month. This business will serve as her daily income. She also gets her husband's allowances paid directly to her monthly, due to the heavy work and distance from Mubende to Kampala.

In other words the husband cannot travel to Kampala frequently. She will brew 3 times a month. Her budget is as below:

3 millet bags, each at 55,000 shillings, totaling 165,000 shillings;

Firewood at 20,000 shillings;

Millet for yeast at 50,000 shillings;

Transport at 5,000 shillings;

Caroline will be very happy to receive the loan to boost her business.

She also budgets 10,000 shillings for an emergency.

The total comes to 250,000 shillings.

loans.use: Buying items to be used

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
N. Milly is a Muganda lady from Impala village, which is found in the Entebbe district. She is 34 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are going to school and the other two are still at home. Before Milly joined Life in Africa she used to be a full time house wife and didn't have much to do. Life was really not so easy, having many children to take care of and also having to sustain the family. At the time, her husband was also facing some problems with his work that was on a contract basis, where sometimes the payments would be delayed.

Milly is a creative wife and she was involved in making crafts on a small scale at her home, which she would sell in order to try to raise an income for the family. The income generated was not really enough to sustain the family bills and needs and as a result, Milly chose to search for work to sustain the family. After a little searching, Milly was able to find work with Life in Africa. She was one of the people on the Invisible Children bracelet project. This job was a great support in boosting the family's income, but life has to go on. Milly, as a member of Life in Africa, is very instrumental in the community; she is very good in making handcrafts and also at sharing her craft making knowledge with the other community members. She has good interpersonal skills and consistent conduct.

From the salary earned and her savings, Milly was able to make an investment in the form of building rental houses. She managed to build three single room tenant houses and currently two are occupied and the other one is still incomplete. The first two single room rental houses also still need plastering. Currently, Milly has been charging 50,000 Ugandan shillings per room for the two rooms and has been generating an income of 100,000 shillings. Milly is requesting a loan of 250,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD150) to enable her to finish her third house to acceptable housing standards and also to do the plastering on the other two rental houses.

Milly will employ one person for the work. After the completion of the third room and plastering, Milly plans to increase the rent for her houses from 50,000 shillings to 60,000 shillings and she is expecting a monthly income of 180,000 shillings. This will allow her to save enough money from the rentals to build two more rental houses. The two single rooms are going to be built over a long time. It's a long-term investment depending on the profits saved.

LOAN BUDGET

Buying cement (6 bags) for 120,000 shillings;

Buying sand with one trip for 70,000 shillings;

Buying water (50 jericans worth) for 5,000 shillings;

Labour costs 50,000 shillings;

Contingency costs 5,000 shillings;

This totals 250,000 shillings.

loans.use: Building

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a Ugandan by nationality and a married woman with four children. All of them currently attend school. She came to Kampala in 1998 when the war in the north escalated and forced her and her family to take refuge. They have since settled in Acholi quarters. While in Kampala, she worked in a stone quarry, and earned a small living.

L. Rose has a stone quarry and was her primary business before she joined Life in Africa. This business involves paying labor to dig the stones, crack them to the sizes needed and then load them into the customer's truck. She used to produce two truckloads per month.

After sometime she was introduced to Life in Africa. Since she has been a friend to some ladies involved in making paper beads, she found it very easy to become proficient in making the beads. She is now a member with full confidence, earning up to 150,000 Ugandan shillings per month.

L. Rose is asking for a loan of 250,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD150) to increase her capital and if given the loan, she hopes to make three trips in a month and make a profit of 80,000 per trip. She promises to pay back this loan in a period of 6 months.

Her budget is as below:

Digging stones to cost three times 20,000 shillings;

Cracking the stones to cost three times 40,000 shillings;

Transporting stones out of pit to cost three times 15,000 shillings;

This totals 225,000 shillings. With 25,000 shillings in case of emergency, the overall total becomes 250,000 shillings.

loans.use: Stone quarry

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is Ugandan by nationality, an Acholi by tribe, and a widow with four children. When she lived in her village, things were not easy, as the war never gave her and her children safety or peace. The rebels attacked them to steal food, saucepans, and clothes, and burnt the house they were living in. Fleeing for her life with her children was all she could do. She came to Kampala in 1999 and settled in the Acholi quarter, where she has been staying until now. When she settled in the Acholi quarters she began a stone quarry business from which she earned some money to sustain her children and herself. Life has been so hard since her late husband passed away. She began to do whatever came her way to make a living, but things were never easy.

A time came when a friend of hers told her about Life in Africa, where she came and finally became a member. She joined the paper beads group from which she later learnt to make the beads, and now is earning good money from it. Since she joined Life in Africa, her life has never been the same.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 250,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD150). She will use the money to expand her quarry business, where she was making one trip with the profit of 40,000 shillings and sometimes 45,000 shillings per month. She promises to pay back the loan within a period of five months.

Her budget is as below:

Removing top soil for a cost of 25,000 shillings;

Digging the stones for a cost of 50,000 shllings;

Breaking the stones into smaller sizes for a cost of 15,000 shillings;

Transport out of the pit for a cost of 15,000 shillings;

Loading onto the truck for a cost of 10,000 shillings;

Emergency, costing 10,000 shillings;

For a total of two trips per month, at 125,000 shillings per trip, her total equals 250,000 shillings. She expects to make a profit of 80,000 shillings per trip.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy his merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en: Mrs Dieu is 49 and her husband is 49 years old. They have 3 children between 23 and 19 who are going to the university. They have 8000 square meters of land for growing rice. Her husband works as a laborer but the work is not stable and the expense of tuition is high, so Dieu’s selling food for breakfast is important for increasing their income by about $1/person/month, bringing it to an average of $11.5/person/month. She wants to borrow $50 for her selling business.

loans.use: Selling food for breakfast

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
Business Description

Aracely sells office supplies, all kinds of gifts and general groceries and household supplies. This business is in her own home, in an area she conditioned to serve this purpose. With some savings and personal necessities she became motivated to start her own business, after realizing it would be the only one in her area.

Loan Usage

Aracely wants to use her loan to invest in the purchase of more groceries and supplies. She also wants to remodel her shop to be able to sell gas for domestic use, since no one else sells it in her area and some customers have inquired for it.

Personal Information

Aracely is 32 years old and has three children, two of which are in school. Her home is made of cement and is in a strategic place. Her goal is to have a well conditioned locale to be able to give the best service to her clients and thus to improve her quality of life.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Aracely tiene a la venta articulos de oficina, todo tipo de regalos en general venta de abarrotes. Este negocio lo tiene ubicado en un local que acondiciono en su propia casa. Con unos ahorros y la necesidad de por medio y el notar que seria la unica tienda en su sector se motivo a poner su propio negocio

Uso del Préstamo

Aracely piensa invertir en la compra de mas víveres y ademas reacondicionar su local para poder vender gas de uso domestico pues es algo que muchos de sus clientes le han solicitado y nadie en el sector tiene a la venta ese producto.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 32 años y tres hijos de los cuales dos estudian ademas su vivienda es de cemento y esta en un sitio estrategico. Su meta es de tener un local acondicionado para atender bien al público y con ello poder mejorar sus calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries and supplies and remodeling her home/business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Business Description

Hilda sells groceries and house supplies in a main street of her community. This business is located in her own home, after she conditioned a part of it to serve this purpose. She started the business with the help of her husband, who lended her money to start.

Loan Usage

Hilda wants to use the loan to invest in purchasing more groceries and to remodel the aspect of her locale. She wants to paint the walls of her shop and put up a bigger door so she can better service her customers.

Personal Information

Hilda is 50 years old and has three children, all whom are grown up. Her house is made of cement and is in a strategic place in town. Her goal is to have a well-conditioned locale to be able to offer the best service possible to her clients, and to improve her quality of life.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Hilda tiene a la venta víveres y abarrotes en una calle principal de su sector. Este negocio lo tiene ubicado en un local que acondicione dentro de su propia casa. Empezo su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo quien le presto el dinero para comenzar

Uso del Préstamo

Hilda tiene pensado invertir el prestamo en la compra de mas mercaderia mejorar el aspecto de su local enluciendo las paredes y ampliando en ingreso al local con una puerta mas grande para poder atender de mejor forma asus clientes.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 50 años y tres hijos que ya son mayores su vivienda es de cemento y esta en un sitio estrategico. Su objetivo es de tener un local acondicionado para atender bien al público y con ello poder mejorar sus calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries and remodeling her locale

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Business Description

Robert has a workshop where he repairs vehicle motors. Since the location of his workshop is excellent, he receives plenty of customers. He started his business after separating from the mechanic that taught his his craft. Robert and a friend began the business together, and today he only works with one employee.

Loan Usage

Robert needs this loan to buy better tools, because there are cars coming into his workshop that are very new and require them. He will also buy other mechanic's instruments and use the loan to remodel the shop's exterior.

Personal Information

Robert is 37 years old and has a one year old son. His house is made of cane. His objective is to have his locale in his own home and achieve a better quality of life.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Maite Barragán

Descripción del Negocio

Robert tiene un taller donde repara motores de vehiculos y por tener una excelente ubicación sus clientes son bastantes. Empezo su taller luego de separarse de quien le enseño el oficio y comun compañero emprendieron el negoico, Actuamente trabaja solo con un oficial.

Uso del Préstamo

Robert necestia el credito para comprar herramientas mas sofisticadas pues llegan automoviles de nueva generacion y otros articulos de uso mecanico. Otra parte lo usara para mejorar la fachada de su taller.

Información Personal

El tiene 37 años y un hijo de un año su casa es de caña y. Su objetivo es de tener un local en su propio casa para atender bien al público y con ello poder mejorar sus calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchasing tools

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Business Description

When she was young, Carmen began selling food with her mother. She enjoys the business because this was her dream. Little by little, with her savings she decided to buy a cart and begin working on her own. Her mother helped her a lot in the beginning. She could fit on the side of her home a spot for her cart. She worked only on weekends from 4 p.m. until 11 p.m. On the other days, she worked as a guard for a business looking after a health center.

Loan Use

Her desire is to be able to buy food products so that she may offer better service to her clients. Also, she is going to change some reeds on her restaurant walls that are damaged.

Personal Information

Carmen is a single mother. She is 29 years old and has a son who is 13 years old. She only wants to be able to give her son an education. Her mother is the person that helps her in the preparation of the food. Her desire is to be able to begin constructing a little cement home and give a better life to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Carmen desde joven junto a su mama se inicio con la venta de comida. Le gusto ya que esa era su sueño. Poco a poco con sus ahorros decide comprarse una carreta y comienza a trabajar sola. Su mama la ayudo bastante en su inicio. Pudo adecuar al lado de su domicilio un local para poder tener su carreta. Trabaja solo los fines de semana en horario de 4 p.m. hasta las 11 p.m. Además los otros días trabaja de guardia para una empresa cuidando un centro de salud.

Uso del Préstamo

Su deseo es poder tener comprado ya sus productos con el que ella le brindaría un mejor servicio a sus clientes. También va ha cambiar algunas cañas de su local que están dañadas.

Información Personal

Carmen es madre soltera. Tiene 29 años y un hijo de 13. Ella sola a podido darle la educación a su hijo. Su mama es la persona que le ayuda en la preparación de la comida. Su deseo es poder comenzar a construir su casita de cemento y darle una mejor vida a su hijo.

loans.use: Improve restaurant site and buy food to cook.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Business Description

Narcisa has four years experience with her business. When she was young, she began working at home where she was saving money. With this effort, she was able to buy a refrigerator and shelves, and by her own initiative, she began her little shop. The business has gone very well for her. She works every day of the week from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m.

Loan Use

She will invest the loan to boost her business with another line of products. Some of the products include: milk, games, candies, and cleaning products.

Personal Information

Narcisa is a single mother. She has two children that are studying. Narcisa is 31 years old. Her older son helps her by attending to the clients when she is on vacation. Her main desire is to attain security for her business and finish constructing her little cement home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Narcisa tiene una experiencia de 4 años con su negocio. Desde joven se inicio trabajando en casa de donde fue ahorrando. Con su esfuerzo logro comprarse una nevera y una percha. Por iniciativa propia pone su tiendita. Le ha ido muy bien. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá surtir su negocio con otra clase de productos. Como lo son: leche, jugos, confites, y productos de limpieza.

Información Personal

Narcisa es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos los que estudian. Ella tiene 31 años. Su hijo mayor le ayuda con la atención de los clientes cuando esta en vacaciones. Su deseo primordial es poder darle seguridad a su negocio y terminar de construir su casita de cemento.

loans.use: Boost her business with more products: milk, games, candy, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve the diversity and size of her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in cleaning products

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok P. is 46 years old and sells vegetables for a living--earning approximately $2/day. She lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband, a mototaxi driver, and their 6 children. Two of her children work at a garment factory in Phnom Penh and send back part of their wages to help the family. The other 4 children go to school during the day and help their mother with the crops in their free time.

Mrs. Sok P. would like to take this loan in order to purchase a small piece of land where she can grow more crops. In the future, she hopes to continue with this trend of expanding her landholding so that she can grow more and more to sell to the market. She feels that her farming business will help to send her children to school until they are old enough to find their own jobs.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land for growing crops

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Mrs. Prom K., 48 years old, runs a small roadside stand selling gasoline and oil, and offering small repair services.  Her husband works with her as the mechanic, focusing mostly on minor motorbike repair such as fixing flat tires.  Mrs. Prom K. sells small containers of gasoline and oil and together they earn around $7/day.  The couple has 5 children, 3 of whom are fortunate enough to attend school, while the other 2 help with the family business.  This loan will be used to purchase some spare parts for their store, as well as more gasoline and oil.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts, oil, and gasoline for her shop

loans.name: Lev

texts.en:
Mrs. Lev P. is 48 years old and lives in Siem Reap with her husband and their 5 children. Mrs. Lev P. helps her husband in his carpentry business, and when she has time, also sells souvenirs in front of the Angkor Wat temple complex. Two of her children were fortunate enough to get good jobs with small private companies, and they earn enough to help contribute to the family income.

Mrs. Lev P. will use this loan to buy carpentry tools for her husband to use so they can expand their business. She hopes to continue taking out loans after this one is repaid because she is confident that her and her husband can succeed in their business. If successful, she can stop selling products to tourists and focus on building up the family business so her children can receive a high quality education.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry tools

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Lev Phek start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Hoeung

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeung H. is 49 years old and runs a small grocery business in Siem Reap, Cambodia.  Her husband works alongside her, and together they earn about $4/day.  The couple has 3 children, 1 of whom is a teacher. The other 2 are still in school.  Mrs. Hoeung H. will use this loan to buy more grocery products so her store has a larger variety of offerings.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Hoeung Hoy start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Hot

texts.en: Mr. Hot H. is 44 years old and works as a small fisherman in Siem Reap Province.  He earns about $4/day at this job, but 2 of his sons also work to supplement the family income.  One son is a construction worker, and another works in a massage shop.  Mr. Hot H. pays for his sons to get to work everyday, but this is too expensive to keep up.  He will use this loan to buy a motorbike that his sons can use to get to and from work.  He knows that this will be a much cheaper option in the longrun.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport his children to and from work

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Hot Hai and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Mrs. Moa K. is 42 years old and lives in Siem Reap with her husband and their 6 children.  Mrs. Moa K. and her husband fish for a living, earning about $4/day.  Two of their children work in construction while the other 4 are students.  Mrs. Moa K. and her husband are currently using old fishing nets with holes.  She will use this loan to buy new nets so no fish escape and so that they can earn more income on every trip out.  In the future, they hope to be successful enough to buy new, bigger nets so they can further improve their business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Moa Khun start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Ngham

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngham S. is 46 years old and lives in Siem Reap with her husband and their 6 children. She runs a small carpentry business, but only makes about $1/day in profits. Her husband drives a horse-cart and earns $3/day, while 2 of her children work in construction and contribute to the household income.

Mrs. Ngham S. will use this loan to buy some materials for her business. Any excess materials she has will go into repairing their house to prevent it from leaking during the monsoon season which has already started. In the future, she would like to make her business more profitable so that she can send her children to university.

loans.use: To purchase materials for carpentry business.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en: Mrs. Houn R. is 26 years old and operates a small floral shop in Siem Reap, Cambodia.  She can earn about $3/day in this business, while her husband earns $7/day working as a driver for a tourist company.  Together, they support 2 young children.  This loan will be used to purchase flowers for Mrs. Houn R.' shop.  As her business grows, she hopes to buy bicycles for her children to ride to school.

loans.use: To purchase more flowers for her shop

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Houn Ros start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Phe

texts.en: Mrs. Phe S. is 31 years old and rents a small stall in a market in Kampong Cham, selling lemon pickles.  She earns about $2/day in her business, and her husband earns $4/day as a horse cart driver.  This combined income is just enough for Mrs. Phe S. and her husband to support their 2 children.  She will use this loan to purchase more lemons and to pay rent for her stall.  She hopes to purchase a motorbike or car in the future so that she can transport her unique food to other markets around Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase lemons and pay for stall rental at the market

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Phe Soknav has paid this loan back early.

Thanks to your support, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to help finance their small businesses and to support their families. We hope you will continue your support on Kiva.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en: Mrs. Kuch N. is 58 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband and their 1 child.  She operates a small restaurant that sells fried fish, rice, and pickles.  She earns about $4/day in this business, while her husband earns $2/day working construction.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Kuch N. to buy some cooking supplies and utensils for her restaurant.  She will also use a small part of the loan to buy her husband tools so that he can earn more income per day.  In the future, she hopes to make a more proper restaurant with a full menu in order to better satisfy her clients.

loans.use: To purchase utensils for her restaurant, and tools for her husband's business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Luch Neang has paid this loan back early.

Thanks to your support, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to help finance their small businesses and to support their families. We hope you will continue your support on Kiva.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Nol

texts.en: Mr. Nol C. is 51 years old and lives in Kampong Cham with his wife and their 5 children.  He works growing, harvesting, and selling crops--mostly rice.  He earns about $3/day in profit doing this business, and his 2 sons work as drivers, helping to support the family as well.  Mr. Nol C. currently sells his rice only at the nearby market in Kampong Cham, but he would like to expand his selling area.  This loan will be used to buy a motorbike so that he can take his harvest to new markets.  With any leftover money, he will buy more seeds so he can harvest more crops next year.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport his crops to the market, and also to buy seeds for farming

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng S. O. produces and sells Prahok, a type of Cambodian cheese that includes fish.  She also sells cucumbers and can earn about $4/day in profits from her business.  Her husband is a soldier and earns $1/day from the government.  The couple lives in Kampong Cham with their 4 children--2 of whom help their mother with her sales.  Mrs. Heng S. O. plans to use this loan to purchase a motorbike with a trailer so that she can transport her goods to the market.  In the future, she hopes to make her business bigger so that she can send her children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport her Prahok cheese and cucumbers to the market.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Heng Sam Oun has successfully repaid this Kiva loan.

Thanks to your investment, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to help finance their small businesses and support their families. We hope you will continue your support on Kiva.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan C. and her husband live in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver, earning $2/day, while Mrs. C. sells Khmer noodles on the roadside, earning $3/day. Together, they have four children whom they support and send to school everyday.

This loan will be used to purchase a car so that they can start a new business of delivering freshwater to the provinces. The couple is confident that this business will be successful because all Cambodians need fresh water.

It is also an important business that will allow Cambodians to drink clean water and fall ill less frequently due to consuming unclean water. In the future, Mrs. C. hopes to make the freshwater delivery service her primary business, allowing her to end her current food business.

loans.use: To purchase a car for transporting freshwater to all provinces

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Phan Chanith has paid this loan back early.

Thanks to your support, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to help finance their small businesses and to support their families. We hope you will continue your support on Kiva.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Tek

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Nim is 27 years old and works two jobs in Kampong Cham. First, she is a garment factory worker and earns a daily income of $2 from this job. Second, she sells dried fish on the roadside, giving her about $1/day. Her husband is a driver for a private company and earns about $3/day in this business.

This loan will be used to purchase dried fish to resell in her stall. In the future, she hopes to expand her fish sales so she doesn't have to work in the garment factory anymore.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish for her roadside stall

payments.comment:
Congratulations!  Tek Soknim has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Leav

texts.en:
Mrs. Leav S. is 29 years old and works with her husband weaving and selling clothes. Their main products are silk scarves. Mrs. Leav and her husband earn about $4/day combined in this business.

Although they can increase their production speed right away, they still need to buy more raw materials (thread and cloth) to work on. Thus, their loan will be used to purchase more materials so they can increase production. In the future, they hope to open a large shop where they can sell their items.

loans.use: To purchase more silk and thread for her clothing business

loans.name: Ham

texts.en:
Mrs. Ham T. is 25 years old and lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and their two children. She works as a farmer and food seller, earning $3/day while her husband earns $3/day as an electrician. Mrs. Ham T. has a working arrangement with a local plantation owner from whom she buys bananas in bulk for a very good price.

She plans to use this loan to purchase bananas from the plantation and resell them at the local market for a profit. She is very excited about this opportunity and hopes one day to have her own plantation so that she does not have to buy her stock from another person.

loans.use: To purchase bananas wholesale from a plantation to resell at various markets.

payments.comment: Congratulations to Ham Thorn for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Chein

texts.en: Mr. Chein K. H. is 28 years old and, along with his wife, holds down two different jobs.  His main job is as a mechanic, fixing mostly motorbikes and some cars.  He earns $3.50/day in this business. His wife and he also raise some pigs on their plot of land.  These businesses combined give them just enough income to support themselves and their three children.  Mr. Chein K. H. plans to use this loan to purchase some motorbike spare parts and some more pigs.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike spare parts for his shop and more pigs to raise.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Chein Kim Heang has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Mrs. Chum K. is 49 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with her husband and their four children. The family runs a small transportation business, mostly delivering people's products to and from the market on a trailer attached to a motorbike. Two of her daughters work in a garment factory, while the other two help their parents with their transportation business.

Mrs. Chum K. will use this loan to purchase a new trailer, as their old one is very worn down and cannot handle a lot of weight. In the future, she would like to open a small business selling rice in addition to their current business.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer for her family's transportation business

payments.comment: Congratulations to Chum Kan for repaying the Kiva loan early!

texts.en:
Mrs. H. is 53 years old and lives in Ninh Giang, a rural district in Hai Duong province, approximately 50 miles southeast of Hanoi. She has 3 sons, aged between 21 and 29. The youngest son is at college, where he studies economics. She's married; her husband is also 53, and together they have had a construction workshop for 10 years. They make concrete pillars. At the moment they have 34 employees. Besides the construction shop, she has a drink stall where she also sells lottery tickets. Like almost everybody else in the district, she has a rice paddy and raises pigs.

Before joining TYM, their annual profit was $1,875. Nowadays their profit is $7,500 per year. They want to buy more materials to make more concrete pillars.

loans.use: She wants to buy more materials for her construction shop

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Mrs. Hem P. is a 35 year old widow living in Phnom Penh City. She works very hard to support her 2 school-going children by selling vegetables at the local market. She is hoping to receive this loan so that she may purchase more vegetables to sell. Currently, she has a lot of demand from her clients, but cannot afford to purchase anymore vegetables up front.

This loan will help her to increase her sales so that can support her family. In the future, she has dreams of opening a grocery store that sells all kinds of food.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for her vegetable stall

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok S. is 53 years old and works as a seamstress in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. This job gives her a daily income of a little over $1. Her husband is a carpenter and a construction foreman. Their two children have already started their own families.

Mrs. Sok S. would like this loan so that she and her husband can build a house to rent out. They are confident that this will give them additional monthly income. Mrs. Sok S. also hopes to use their rental income to start a small tailoring shop of her own.

loans.use: To build a house for renting out

texts.en:
Mrs. T. is 37 years old and married; her husband is 45 years old. They live in Ninh Giang district, a rural area in Hai Dung province, approximately 50 miles southeast of Hanoi. They have 3 children, between 12 and 18; they are all at school. Together with her husband, she trades beer. They buy it in Hai Phong province and trade it in Hai Dung. During summer they sell a lot of beer; during autumn and winter they also sell cakes and fruit, because they don't sell that much beer any more. Before selling beer they also raised ducks, but because of the bird flu they had to switch to another kind of business, which is why they sell beer at the moment.

Before joining TYM their average monthly income was $95. Nowadays they make $185 a month. The loan will be used to buy more beer from her supplier.

loans.use: She wants to buy more beer from her supplier

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 31 years old and married; her husband is 32. They have 3 children, between 2 and 12. The oldest two are at school. They're living in Ninh Giang district, a rural area in Hai Dung province, approximatellly 50 miles southeast of Hanoi. Besides working on her rice paddies, she has an incense factory. In this factory she has already six employees and during Tet, Vietnamese New Year, she has 10 people working for her. Before joining TYM her average income was $62.50 per month, but nowadays she earns $125 per month. To make working on the rice paddies easier, she wants to buy a plow. The rest of the loan will be used to buy more ingredients for incense.

loans.use: She wants to buy a plow and more ingredients for incense.

loans.name: Abdul Khalaq

texts.en: Abdul Khalaq lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he lives with all the members of his family. He has 10 years work experience in Iran and he came  from Iran a year ago and started his business In Afghanistan. He is a metal worker and has a metal shop.
