He wants to expand it so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new machines and extra materials to make a good life for his family.

loans.use: To buy new machines

texts.en: Mrs. V. and her husband are both 58 years old. They have 3 children; two are already married and her youngest son, 27, is single and lives at her house. They live in Ninh Giang, a rural district in Hai Dung province, approximately 50 miles southeast of Hanoi. She grows vegetables in the fields and also buys vegetables from others to sell at her shop. Besides the vegetables, she also sells duck and pig meat at her shop. A few years ago she switched her rice paddy into a fishing pond because of the higher profit. With selling vegetables she makes $62.50 per month and the fish give her an additional $50 each month. To help her son, she wants to borrow money so he can open a restaurant next door. She also wants to build a bathroom next to her house.

loans.use: She wants to buy inventory for a new restaurant and also wants to fix her bathroom

texts.en:
Mrs. H. is a 52-year-old grandmother and a  woman of great distinction in her village. She's on the executive board of the local Womens Union and the Farmers Union. Besides that, she runs  an herbal shop with her 53-year-old husband. She has great knowledge of herbs and plants, so she prepares and buys them, while he sells the herbs at the shop. They live in Ninh Giang, a rural district in Hai Dung province, approximately 50 miles southeast of Hanoi. Besides the herbal shop, they also have rice paddies and raise chickens. She wants to invest more in her herbal shop and wants to finish her bathroom. That's why she applied for a new loan. 
The profit of their shop is $187.50 per month.

loans.use: Buy more herbs for her shop and build a bathroom.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is widow, and she lives with her children. Her husband died from cancer in Pakistan 4 years ago. She is supporting her family. She is a tailor. She wants to expand her business, so she wants to take a group loan to buy tailoring machines to make a good income and help more with her family. She is happy. She would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy new machines

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 32 years old; her husband is 39. They have 2 children, 7 and 11, who are both at school. He used to be a project officer, but nowadays they work together in their tree business. They live in Ninh Giang, a rural district of Hai Dung province, approximately 50 miles southeast of Hanoi. They grow small ornamental trees in their garden, a kind of bonzai trees, and sell them. She wants a new loan to buy more young trees to grow. Besides the trees, they have more than 1 hectare of rice paddies and grow flowers. Their income is $125 a month. Before joining TYM, they had no money to send their children to school and invest in their house. Nowadays, life's getting better.

loans.use: She wants to buy more young trees for her tree business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his stock of bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married, and she wants to help support her husband. She is skilled in embroidery, and she has good experience in her job. She wants to take a group loan to buy 3 more machines for her students to attract more clients. She wants to make a good income for her family to send her children to better education centers to study. She is happy with this loan.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Khudam

texts.en: Khudam H. lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region, with his two children. His wife died, so he is bringing up his children by himself. He is 47 years old and has been raising cattle for six years. He wants to expand the cattle breeding to provide his family with a good future. He is applying for a loan of $475 to buy a cow to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

texts.en: Mrs. L. is a 44 year old widow.  She has 4 children between the ages of 22 and 14, of whom 3 are at school and one is married.  Besides her 1 ha of rice paddies and the chickens she raises, she also grows and sells ornamental trees - a kind of Bonzai tree.  She lives in Ninh Giang, a rural district in Hai Dung province, approximateL. 50 miles south east of Hanoi.  Her financial status improved a lot after joining TYM.  Now she's able to send her children to school and build a better house.  Her profit nowadays is $125 per month.  She is requesting a loan to buy more young trees, which will be sold after they've grown.

loans.use: She wants to buy more small, young trees for her business

loans.name: Tadjeddin

texts.en: Tadjeddin A. has been running his cattle breeding business for 10 years.  He lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He is married and has two children. He wants to expand his business in order to cover all his family expenses, so he is requesting a loan of $725 to buy a pregnant cow.

loans.use: To buy a pregnant cow

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuon C. is 38 years old, married and a mother of 3 children who lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She stays at home, cooking meals and looking after her children. To bring in income for the family, her husband is a self-employed taxi driver and makes around $5 per day in revenue. Meanwhile, two of their children are students while the youngest is still too young to attend school.

To help her husband's business run better, C. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a simple car for him so that he can replace the old one he currently uses in his taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a simple car to run a business.

texts.en: Mrs. G. is 52 years old and together with her 54 year old husband she runs a farm.  They have rice paddies, raise chicken and ducks, and have a small fish pond.  They have 3 children between the ages of 28 and 20.  One has finished her studies, one is in the army, and one daughter is training to be a cook.  Mrs. G. lives in Ninh Giang , a rural district in Hai Dung province, approximately 50 miles south east of Hanoi.  Because of the low profit of their rice paddies, they're turning the rice paddies into fishing ponds, and that's why she has applied for a new loan.  She needs the money to buy fish and build the pond.  After being a TYM member for four years already, their life has changed a lot.  Now they're able to send their children to school and invest in their house.  Their annual profit is $1,875.00.

loans.use: She wants a loan to buy fish and build a fish pond

loans.name: Abdul Mahbob

texts.en: A. Mahbob lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated but he doesn’t like working in offices. He likes to work for himself. He is a taxi driver. He wants to take a group loan to buy a new engine for his car and change the tires of his car to expand his business and make a good monthly income to support his family. He would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy a new engine

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 32 years old, and her husband is 35 years old and has is own grocery shop in Hanoi.  She lives in Ninh Giang, a rural district in Hai Dung province, approximately 50 miles south east of Hanoi.  Her husband's shop opens before 7am and closes after 9pm.  This means that her husband is rarely at home because traveling 50 miles on a motorbike on bad roads takes time.  He comes home every 20 days.  They have 2 children, 4 and 13 years old, and they are both at school.  Besides raising ducks and pigs (although due to an epidemic she has no pigs anymore), she also has rice paddies.  She uses the rice to cook rice wine and then sells it.  She makes a profit of $31.00 per month.  To increase their income, she is requesting a loan to invest more in her husband's shop, so he will be able to create a bigger inventory, which will help them to increase their income.

loans.use: To invest in her husband's grocery store

texts.en: Mrs. L., 35 years old, buys pigs from farmers in her village.  She sells the meat at the market.  With this business she makes $ 125.00 per month.  Her husband is 36 years old and is a merchant.  Whatever the people need in the village, he can find it, e.g. motorbikes, fighting chickens etc. etc.  They have rice paddies and cows, but their main income is the meat selling business.  Their children, aged 16 and 13, are both at school.  They live in Ninh Giang, a rural district in Hai Dung province, approximately 50 miles south east of Hanoi.  The one thing she likes the best about TYM is that it's possible to repay the loan on a weekly basis, so the principals are low and she doesn't have to pay a large term at the end.  She is requesting a loan to buy more pigs, so she can increase her income.

loans.use: she wants to buy more pigs to sell the meat at the market

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 56 years old and her husband is 54.  They have 4 children.  2 daughters are still at home - age 22 and 21 years.  They live in Ninh Giang, a rural district in Hai Dung province, approximately 50 miles south east of Hanoi.  While her husband trades tobacco, she raises chickens, fish and cows, and works on the ricefields.  She is requesting a loan to buy 30 chickens and 10 dogs.  In Vietnam, dog meat is a traditional delicacy and most people eat it during winter because the meat warms you up.  It's quite expensive, so she hopes to make a good profit with this investment.  At the moment her profit is $ 31.25 per month.

loans.use: She wants to buy 30 chickens and 10 dogs

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a thirty year old father of two young children, ages 1.5 and 4. He has had his business selling bicycle parts for two years. Operating out of Lupida, a small town in western Kenya, Peter sells all types of parts, including tires, rims, breaks, spokes, and peddles. 

Currently, the biggest obstacle he faces is a lack of capital. There is high demand for bicycle parts in the area because bicycles are the central form of transportation in the region. It is the main way that people move from town to town, from the farm to home, etc, and bicycles are even used as an integral form of commercial transportation. Called ‘Boda bodas’, young men put pads onto the back of their bikes and take people for rides for about 10 Kenya Schillings (1 USD is about 67 Ksh).

As it is, Peter receives 10-20 customers per day, and is able to collect a daily profit of about 150-200 Ksh. He hopes to receive a Kiva loan so that he can increase his supply of bicycle parts, and believes that with a loan, he can increase his profits to 300-400 Ksh per day. 

Peter’s business helps him to provide for his two young children. He is able to give them the basic necessities, but in the near future he will have to start paying for school fees. While primary education is provided by the government in Kenya, families still face minor costs for uniforms and books. Moreover, when his children reach secondary school, he will have to pay much more substantial costs in order to educate them. Peter has ambition to grow his business to meet future challenges, and hopes that a Kiva loan will help get him there.

loans.use: To increase his stock of bicycle spare parts.

texts.en: Mrs. B. and her husband are both 55 years of age.  They have 5 children between the ages of 18 and 31. Only one daughter and one grandchild are at home.  Mrs. B. lives in Ninh Giang, a rural district in Hai Dung province, approximately 50 miles south east of Hanoi.  She has 1 ha of rice paddies and she raises cows, pigs and chickens.  Also, she has some fields with strawberry plants.  Vietnam does not have a good climate for strawberries, but the leaves are used for the silkworms because they like strawberry leaves.  Before her eyes where not so bad she also had silkworms, but nowadays she only has the strawberries.  She is requesting a loan to invest more in her livestock, so her profits will increase.  At the moment their monthly profit is $81.00.

loans.use: She wants to buy more livestock

loans.name: In

texts.en:
In I. is 36 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She lives with her husband and family in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes her living by growing yams, raising pigs and typically makes around $5 each day. Her husband works in a small private company and earns a small salary which contributes to the household expenses.

In order to generate additional income from the farm, In I. (pictured here in a yellow tee-shirt) is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a plot of land and additional seeds, farm tools and fertilizer to make her land more productive. In the future, she hopes to earn enough to open an industry producing yam powder, which is popular with the people in her area.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land, seeds, fertilizer, and some farm tools to invest in her plantation.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! In Im has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Sefer

texts.en: Sefer B. is 37 and lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He is married and has one child. He has raised cattle for eight years, and now he would like to buy two more cows to increase his income, to meet all the needs of his family. To do this, he needs a loan of $825.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Khy

texts.en:
Mrs. Khy S. L. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To meet her family’s expenses, S. L. sells a variety of fruit along the road in her neighbourhood, where she can make an average of $5 each day. Her husband is a self-employed chef and also makes about $5 a day in revenue.

S. L. is asking for a loan of $1000 to increase her inventory by purchasing more fruit to meet her clients’ needs. She hopes to earn enough money to expand her business as well as build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit  for her fruit stand

loans.name: Keat

texts.en: Mrs. Keat S. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes her living by operating a grocery store at home and typically makes around $10 in revenue, while her husband helps in financing the household by selling charcoal to many places in the province. Two of her children are students, and the rest are too young to attend school. Keat S. hopes to use this loan to purchase a car for her husband’s business, so that it is more comfortable to operate his transportation business. In the future, she would like to be able to expand her inventory in order to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To purchase a car for her husband's business.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Keat Srey has paid this loan back early.

Thanks to your support, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to help finance their small businesses and to support their families. We hope you will continue your support on Kiva.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Saadat

texts.en: Saadat V. is 26 years old and lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. She is divorced and doesn't have children. For three years she has been running her own orchard, and this business gives her the opportuniy to support herself. Now she needs a loan of $475 to buy pesticides to improve her orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her orchard

loans.name: Nushaba

texts.en: Nushaba M., a 29-year-old woman, is married and has a child. She has her own orchard in Yenikand village in the Salyan region and has been in this business for five years. Now she needs a loan of $475 to buy pesticides to improve her orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her orchard

loans.name: Muslum

texts.en: Muslum A. has five children. He is 57 years old and lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He has raised cattle for 20 years. Now he requests a loan of $725 to buy two cows in order to improve his cattle breeding and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Logman

texts.en: Logman G. is a single 27-year-old man who lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He has raised cows for four years. Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy a cow to produce more milk.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en: At first, Rafoat dealt with the purchase and sale of small goods.  It enabled her to earn a living and keep her family.  But the children grew up, and the family expenses increased.  It was necessary to think about the future because everybody is engaged with the business she did, and many buyers became more captious and bought less.  Rafoat remembered her maidenly trade – sewing.  She decided to sew, and started with national dresses and embroidered pillows.  At first the things looked bad, but she continued to sew quality items and learned to rely on buyers' taste.  Nowadays she knows what they prefer and sews such things.  Having received her first loan a year ago, Rafoat used her loan to purchase a sewing machine.  Paying off the first loan, she took a second and started to buy material for sewing from a wholesale market 80 km from her home.  Rafoat now plans to arrange more mass production.  She needs $1000, which she will use for the purchase of a sewing machine and raw material.  Then she can provide jobs for other women who will help her in her business.

loans.use: For the purchase of a sewing machine and raw material

loans.name: Fariza

texts.en: Fariza  is a 38 year old woman.  She trades wheat flour in the market of Neftobod in the Isfara district.  She has been engaged in this kind of business for 3 years.  She began trading with 10 kg of flour and has since passed to large–scale sale of flour, i.e. wholesale.  She buys 30–40 flour bags and sells them as wholesale and by retail.  She is requesting a loan for the acquisition of a special place to keep the flour, expand and improve her place of trade.  Her daughter is pictured in the photo.

loans.use: For acquisition of a special place to keep the flour

loans.name: Sabokhat

texts.en: Sabokhat is already retired, but she cannot be at home.  She has work experience in trade, and so went to trade at the markets.  She lives with her husband in a 2-room flat separately from her children.  To purchase of her goods she goes to the neighborhood republic – Uzbekistan Kokand city, which is 50 km away.  She needs money in order to purchase more goods and justify the trip.  Her sons can lend her the money, but she does not want to burden them.  When she heard about MicroInvest, she decided to get a loan of $160.  This loan was spent for the extension of her assortment of goods.  Her business is developing still, and now she would like to receive $800 for 12 months to increase her turnover.

loans.use: To increase her turnover

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has a small store where she sells sodas, juices and beer. She already owns two large freezers thanks to the profits the business has generated. Six months ago, Maria took out a loan with Mifex that helped her improve her sales and eventually upgraded one of her older refrigerators. She is now hoping that a second loan will help her venture into selling dairy products such as cheese and yogurt.

Maria and her husband have 10 children, and 6 of them still live at home. She has been living in this very poor community for many years. Her home was once in very poor conditions and vulnerable to the rising shore, but she has made various improvements thanks to her business.

loans.use: Invest in dairy products

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old and works with his two brothers in a small shop in the Kirkuk market. They sell clothes for women. He applied to AL-Aman to get $1200 to purchase more clothes for his shop and make new advertisements. He is looking to develop himself and earn more money.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more clothes for his shop and make new advertisements

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old and has a small shop in Kirkuk to sell flowers. He applied to get $1000 to add more space for this shop. He has a big family, and he is responsible for them. He is very active and works hard to increase his income and enhance his standard of living.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Development

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old and works as a mechanic in the north of Kirkuk. He wants to borrow $1000 from AL-Aman to develop his garage and hire three unemployed people and purchase new equipment. He is working to earn more money to develop himself and his family. He is expecting his first child in the next month and therefore wants to prepare for him.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new equipment

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 34 years old and has a small restaurant in Kirkuk. He applied for a loan from AL-Aman to get $1200 to purchase new furniture and chairs with a desk. He has four children, and all of them are in school. Through this loan, he wants to develop himself and enhance his standard of living.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new furniture

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Two years ago Maria decided to start her own store out of her home. She started off with just $100 in capital and slowly was able to increase her product line and her customer base. She now sells basic foods and snacks for kids. She opens her business every morning and closes late at night. With profits above her expectations, Maria has been continuously investing in her business.

Late last year, Maria received a loan so she could invest in meats such as beef and chicken. She was able to invest successfully and make some minor improvements to her store. She is now looking forward to receiving another loan and investing in dairy products.

Maria moved to Guayaquil from Esmeraldas, a predominantly Afro community, about ten years ago. She attained her land in a popular invasion of a territory now named Nigeria. She still does not have the paperwork for her home, which is built out of a bamboo like wood. Currently there is no pavement where she lives because the tide brings in the water. She has 5 small children and a husband who works for the local water company.

loans.use: Invest in dairy products for her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria runs a small food stand where she sells all types of typical Ecuadorian dishes. Her daughter helped her start this business 2 years ago by buying Maria the small barbecue in the picture. Maria started off by selling just empanadas and shish kabobs, two of Ecuador’s more popular foods. She now has a large of variety of foods and dishes that she makes. She used her last loan to invest in the ingredients she needed to make her dishes.

With the profits from her loan she was able to expand her business. She wants to make reparations to her home in order to be able to offer seating for her clients. The first step is to add pavement to her home and make a section for her customers. She continues to save towards this goal. She has started selling various items for the home as a side business while her restaurant continues to grow. She hopes to invest in this business with a portion of her new loan, but will primarily focus on buying more ingredients.

Maria is 40 years old and has 4 children who are already grown up. One of her daughters still lives with her and helps her in the business. Her husband also contributes to the business when he is not working.

loans.use: Buy food for her stand

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva sells one of Ecuador’s most popular seafoods, crab, or cangrejo in Spanish. She and her husband have been in this line of work for about 15 years. She learned from her grandfather who was an expert in catching these animals in the muddy waters along the Ecuadorian coast. In the picture, you can see Eva and her husband in their canoe along the waters surrounding La Isla Trinitaria, a very poor sector on the outskirsts of Guayaquil.

Eva is now asking for her second loan with our organization through Kiva. She used the first to buy a new motor for the canoes she uses to catch the crab. The motor is now in need of maintenance and she needs the new loan in order to fix it. She also will continue investing in diverse types of seafood to sell from her stands. Since receiving her first loan she has employed two new people to help her with her sales.

Eva and her husband have 4 children, 3 of whom are still in school. The oldest son is already in college and works on his own in order to pay for the costs. She lives with her sister in a house she inherited from her mother.

loans.use: Fix the motor for her canoe and invest in diverse types of seafood

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
Business Description

Lili has 4 years of experience with this business. She started out selling items of clothing. Little by little she saved her money, and together with her sister decided to buy a cart for selling fast food. She came up with the idea on her own initiative, and she liked it. She works only on the weekends, from 5 p.m. until 11 p.m. She keeps her cart at her father's house, which has made it easier for her to run her business.

Loan Use

Lili wants this loan to buy supplies wholesale, which will make her work easier and she won't have to go out to buy her products. Also she would like to remodel her cart. This will help her provide better service to her customers. She would also like to start selling soft drinks and juices.

Personal Information

Lili is a single mother. She is 26 years old and has 2 children, who are both in school and are her reason for living. She has succeeded, thanks to her effort, in giving them the things they need. She has her own little house, which she is completing little by little. She hopes with this investment to improve her income and the life of her family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Lili tiene una experiencia de 4 años con su negocio. Se inicio vendiendo prendas de vestir. Poco a poco fue ahorrando y son ayuda de su hermana deciden comprarse una carreta para la venta de comida rápida. Fue por iniciativa propia que le agrado la idea. Trabaja solo los fines de semana en horario de 5 p.m. hasta las 11 p.m. Ella tiene su carreta en la casa de su papa. El cual le ha dado la facilidad para que ella monte su negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

Lili desea el crédito para comprar víveres al por mayor. Lo que ha ella le facilitaría el trabajo y no tendría que estar saliendo a comprar sus productos. Además desea un poco remodelar su carreta. De esta manera darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Desea también vender colas y jugos.

Información Personal

Lili es madre soltera. Tiene 26 años y dos hijos. Los que estudian y son la razón de su vida. Ella ha logrado gracias a su esfuerzo poder darle lo que ellos necesitan. Tiene una casita propia la cual poco a poco esta logrando terminarla de construir. Esperando con la inversión que realizara mejorar sus ingresos y la vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy groceries wholesale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes bought this tire repair shop from her uncle two years ago. When he moved to Spain he sold it to her for $1000 and although she did not know much about the business she convinced her mom to support her and her sister in this venture. Today she does not regret the decision to take over. Although she could only do small jobs at first she has learned the trade and now manages the business. She has an employee who does most of the heavy work and manual labor.

Lourdes is currently studying business administration at night at a local university. Her sister helps her run the business when she has schoolwork to do and her family is in full support of them. She is requesting the loan because she wants to buy materials in bulk and also wants to offer other products that her clients are demanding. She has already taken out a loan that she used for the same purpose. She found that the capital helps her purchase in bulk which saves time and money. The loans directly help her to dedicate more time to her studies and improve the business profits.

loans.use: Invest in tires, glue and patches for her shop

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Business Description

Julio has 30 years of experience in business. He started out selling seafood, but he had to switch products because of increasing competition. By his own initiative, he decided to start selling fruit. With this product, things have gone very well for him, and little by little he has been able to make some improvements to his home. He works every day of the week from 5 a.m. until 3 p.m.

Loan Use

This loan will be invested in the purchase of fruits, since he is a little low on capital. He will stock his business with a variety of fruits, and in that way give better service to his customers.

Personal Information

Julio is 64 years old. He has 4 children who are adults and who help him with his needs. His wife works as a seamstress, and earns income for that activity. Julio's desire is to be able to start constructing his little house out of concrete, since now it is made of cane, and in the winter time it gets damaged. He knows that, with this investment, he will be able to realize his dream.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Julio tiene una experiencia de 30 años en la actividad del comercio. Se inicio vendiendo mariscos. Pero tuvo que ir cambiando de productos ya que la competencia iba aumentando. Por iniciativa propia decide comenzar a vender frutas. Con este producto le ha ido muy bien que poco a poco ha ido realizando algunos cambios a su domicilio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 5 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de frutas ya que esta un poco bajo de capital. Surtir su negocio con variedad de frutas y de esta manera darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Julio tiene 64 años. Tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son adultos y lo ayudan en lo que el necesita. Su esposa se dedica a la costura teniendo ingresos por esta actividad. El deseo de Julio es poder comenzar a construir su casita de cemento ya que actualmente es de caña. Y en época de invierno sufre sus estragos. Sabe con la inversión que realizara podrá cumplir sus sueños.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fruits

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Business Description

Agripina started her business using a little money she had been able to save, and she dedicated herself to the sale of fast food and fruit. On the weekends her daughters help her attend to the business. She has been able to maintain her clientele thanks to the high quality of the products she offers.

Loan Use

Agripina wants this loan to buy accessories and improve her location, in order to offer better service to her customers.

Personal Information

Agripina is 50 years old, and her husband is a clothing vendor. They have 4 daughters who live on their own. Her home is of mixed construction (part concrete, part cane). She only completed the first grade in school, so she has not been able to have the best work opportunites. That's why she started her own business. Due to insufficient capital, she has not been able to make these improvements in her location.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Agripina Inicio su negocio con un poco de dinero que pudo ahorrarse dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y frutas. En los fines de semana sus hijas le ayudan en la atención del negocio. Su clientela se ha logrado mantener gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que Agripina ofrece en su negocio

Uso del Préstamo

Agripina desea el crédito para comprar accesorios y adecuar el local para brindar una mejor atención a los clientes de su negocio

Información Personal

Agripina tiene50 años su esposo es vendedor de ropa. Tienen 4 hijas que viven de manera independiente. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta .Por contar solo con el nivel primario de educación. No ha podido tener una mejor oportunidad de trabajo .Razón por la cual se decidió a iniciar su propio negocio. Por no contar con suficiente capital no ha pedido hacer mejoras en su local.

loans.use: To buy accessories and improve her location

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Business Description

Perla started her business with a little bit of capital she had saved, the fruits of her work as a schoolteacher. Perla runs her business all by herself, so she offers high-quality work and she has gained the confidence of her customers.

Loan Use

With this loan, Perla wants to renovate her equipment and incorporate new products, in order to offer better service to her customers.

Personal Information

Perla is 52 years old and single. She lives with her sister, who is a single mother and has 2 children who are in school. One of the children, in his free time, works at a hardware store. Perla hopes to improve her business and her income, so she can continue helping support her family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Perla inicio su negocio con un pequeño capital ahorrado fruto de su trabajo como maestra. Perla no cuenta con ayuda para la atención de su negocio. Lo que ha servido para ofrecer la buena calidad de su trabajo y ganarse la confianza de su clientela

Uso del Préstamo

Perla con el crédito desea renovar sus equipos de trabajo e incorporar nuevos productos para ofrecer una mejor atención y servicio a sus clientes

Información Personal

Perla tiene 52 años es soltera. En su casa habita una hermana que es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que estudian .1 de ellos en sus momentos libres trabaja en una ferretería. Perla aspira mejorar su negocio y sus ingresos para seguir colaborando con su familia

loans.use: To buy new equipment

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha is a divorced woman and has one son, who is divorced as well and works out of the city, leaving his three little children with his mother. Bertha has to support her grandchildren and for this reason she decided to start her own business. She began her business in her house with a few candies and soda sales, but with time she added more merchandise and this was how her business grew. Her business gave her enough money to feed her self and her grandchildren, but she wants her business to grow even more so she can offer a better life to her grandchildren and also help her son with his expenses.

Bertha is requesting a loan of $275 to stock her business with more merchandise. She is offering to repay this loan in 6 months. She thanks you very much for supporting her businnes and enabling her to continue with it.

Translated from the original Spanish by Admic Nacional staff

Bertha es una mujer divorciada y tiene un hijo, el cual esta divorciado y trabaja fuera de la ciudad, dejando con su madre, a sus tres pequeños hijos. Bertha tiene que mantener a sus nietos y por ello es que ella decidió poner su negocio, empezó poniendo un puestito en su casa donde vendia algunos dulces y refrescos, y con el tiempo fue surtiéndolo de más cosas que ofrecer y así fue como su negocio empezó a crecer. Su negocio le alcanza para poder alimentar a sus nietos y a ella, pero ella desea poder crecer más para poder ofrecerles algo mejor a sus nietos y así ayudar a su hijo con estos gastos.

Bertha está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para comprar mercadería y abastecer de más productos su negocio y poder crecer y lograr sus metas, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses y te agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria is married and has three daughters. Her husband works in a car paint business. She initially had a little grocery store that allowed her to help her husband with the costs of living. The store she had gave her a little income. She also sold natural products there and this gave her a better income, so she decided to dedicate herself just to selling these natural products. The year before, her husband was sick and he used these products, which helped him get better. Now she distributes these same products, and they have improved her income, so she wants to continue to offer the same products.

Maria is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase more products because she has a lot of orders to cover due to the great demand for these products. She is offering to repay this loan in 6 months. She and her family thank you very much for your support because it enables them to continue growing in her business and also obtain a better quality of life.

Translated from the original Spanish by Admic Nacional staff

María esta casada y tiene tres hijas mujeres, su esposo trabaja como pintor en un taller de carros, ella inicialmente tenía una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, con la cual podía ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. La tienda que tenía le daba ingresos pequeños y tenía también la venta de productos naturales y eso le daba un mejor margen de ganancia por lo que decidió dedicarse a ello. En una época su esposo estaba enfermo y consumía estos productos que lo ayudaron a mejorarse y ella ahora es distribuidora de los mismos, con lo que ha mejorado sus ingresos y desea continuar con el mismo.

María está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 750 para poder comprar más productos ya que tiene muchos pedidos que entregar debido a la demanda que tienen estos productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas para continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy natural products to meet the high demand from her clients

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
Six months ago Johanna was running a business where she sold clothes in her area. She took out a loan from Mifex so she could invest in more products to sell and stimulate her business. The loan Johanna received for her business had a very surprising effect. She was able to invest in new merchandise as she planned, but once she was able to save enough money she decided to venture into a new and more profitable business. Johanna now owns a small restaurant where she makes lunch and dinner. She is happy with the change in her life as she has been able to make more money.

She is now seeking a second loan so that she can invest in her restaurant. Although she has a steady client base, she wants to attract new people by improving the appearance of her business. She will invest in utensils, chairs, tables and other necessary items for a restaurant.

Johanna is raising her two daughters on her own. Her husband left to go to Spain about a year ago because he could not find work in Ecuador. She lives with her mother who helps her take care of the children when she is out working. Before her husband left he bought them a large refrigerator so they would be able to sell sodas and other soft drinks out of their home. Johanna’s mom is the one that mostly tends to this business. Johanna’s dream is to have her husband come back to help her raise their two daughters.

loans.use: Fix up her restaurant

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria is married and has two sons. Her husband is retired because he is sick and he only receives a small pension, which is not enough to cover the family expenses and educate their sons. So she decided to do the only thing that she knew, and she started to make and sell tamales, which are a very popular food in Mexico. As time passed, she began to sell shoes too, because she had to work hard to proviD. for her family. She has grown through recommendations from her first clients and she wants to continue growing. She now has a lot of clients and events to work such as children's parties.

Maria is requesting a loan of $475 to purchase the raw materials for her tamales. She has to take advantage of a large order right now, and currently she does not have sufficient resources to fulfill this order. She is offering to repay this loan in 6 months and she thanks you for meeting her urgent needs and supporting her business.

Translated from the original Spanish by Admic Nacional staff

María esta casada y tiene dos hijos hombres, su esposo esta retirado por enfermedad y solo recibe una pensión por el retiro que es insuficiente para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar y tenían que darle educación a sus hijos y por ello es que elL. decidió hacer lo único que sabia y se dedico a L. elaboración y venta D. tamales, que son muy consumidos en México. Con el tiempo incursionó también en L. venta D. calzado para poder tener más ingresos con los que pueda aportar al gasto familiar. Se ha ido haciendo D. clientes por recomendación D. sus primeros clientes y ahora ya tiene una clienteL. fija y continúa creciendo con su negocio que también atienD. a fiestas infantiles, eventos, etc.

María esta solicitando un préstamo por L. cantidad D. US $ 475 para poder comprar materia prima para elaborar sus tamales ya que se le ha presentado una oportunidad D. un pedido muy granD. y no tiene los recursos suficientes ahora como para cubrir ese pedido, elL. ofrece pagar el préstamo en un período D. 6 meses y te agradece mucho el pronto apoyo que le puedas brindar para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make tamales

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro is married and has four children, and his wife helps him with his business. He started his business after he became sick and had to leave his job as a trailer driver. It was at this time that his wife began to sell used clothing and and later he started to sell clothes bought in quantity from the USA. In this way, he was able to obtain a good price of resale and improve his income. His clients have been growing little by little and now he has a lot of them. One of his sons helps him in the business too by putting his little store in a small local market.

Alejandro is requesting a loan of $375 to purchase merchandise and also pay for any clothes that he has already ordered. He is offering to repay this loan in 5 months. He and his family thank you very much for your support, which enables them to continue growing his business.

Translated from the original Spanish by Admic Nacional staff

Alejandro esta casado y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposa ayuda en el negocio. Él empezó con el negocio después que tuvo una enfermedad por la que dejo su trabajo anterior de chofer de trailer, fue en esa época que su esposa inicio un negocio de venta de ropa usada y luego el empezó a comprar esa ropa de los Estados Unidos de Norte América en cantidad, ya que así puede obtener un buen precio de reventa y tener mejores ingresos. Sus clientes han aumentado poco a poco y ahora ya tiene muchos, uno de sus hijos ayuda también en el negocio, poniendo su puesto en los mercaditos de las colonias de su localidad.

Alejandro está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para comprar mercadería y pagar la ropa que ya tiene pedida para esta temporada, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria is a widow and has seven sons. Five of them are married and the last two are studying. She began her business nine years ago with the help of her husband, when they both sold their products in small markets of their city. They bought the clothes directly from the USA. In one of these trips to the markets, there was an accident and her husband passed away. She had to educate and provide for her sons. She added used clothes and bed sheets to her sales as her clients were requesting these new products.

Maria is requesting a loan of $550 to purchase bed sheets from the USA. She is offering to repay this loan in 6 months. She and her family very much appreciate your support that enables her to continue with her business and take care of her last two sons.

Translated from the original Spanish by Admic Nacional staff

María es una mujer viuda y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 5 ya están casados y 2 están estudiando. Ella inició con su negocio hace nueve años atrás, con ayuda de su esposo ambos se colocaban en mercados de las colonias de la localidad y vendían sus productos, ellos compraban la ropa directamente de EUA., y en uno de esos viajes fue que tuvieron un accidente y su esposo falleció. Ella tuvo que ver por la educación y manutención de todos sus hijos y agrego a la venta de ropa usada, edredones y sábanas que también le solicitaban sus clientes.

María está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 550 para invertir en pacas de edredones y sábanas comprados de EUA., ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y sacar adelante a sus dos últimos hijos.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan is married and has three little children with the youngest child being in kindergarten. His wife helps him with his grocery story business. He started his business because he had to buy medicine for his mother who was sick. Previously he worked as a driver and his salary was not enough to cover their expenses, so he decided to start his own business. Three years ago he began his business because a neighbor said he could sell him a grocery store. Juan saw that it would be a good opportunity and bought it.

Juan is requesting a loan of $375 to purchase merchandise and supply a greater assortment of products to his clients. He is offering to repay this loan in 6 months. He and his family thank you for the support that you give him.

Translated from the original Spanish by Admic Nacional staff

Juan esta casado y tiene 3 hijos pequeños, estando el menor en el kinder, su esposa lo ayuda en el negocio de abarrotes que tiene. Él inicio su negocio por la necesidad de ayudar a su mamá con los medicamentos que tenía que tomar, ya que la tenía enferma, y el antes trabajaba como chofer y sus ingresos no cubrían esta necesidad, por ello es que decidió poner su propio negocio. Hace tres años atrás fue cuando el empezó con su negocio que fue una oportunidad, ya que una vecina le dijo que le podía vender su negocio de abarrotes y Juan vio que sería una buena opción y la tomó.

Juan esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para comprar mercadería y así abastecer su negocio y poder tener mayor surtido de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and supply his clients with a great assortment of products

loans.name: Kenjong

texts.en:
Kenjong owns a small business selling natural juices. Throughout the year he will sell orange, grapefruit, pineapple, and watermelon juices to his customers, as he has done for the last 16 years. When Mr. P. moved from Manabi to Guayaquil, he was without work for quite some time.

Desperate and in need of a job, Kenjong’s business idea came to him while walking near one of the local universities. He noticed the large number of students buying things from the local vendors. The next day he bought a table, plastic cups, a juicer, and 100 oranges to begin selling fresh-squeezed orange juice to the college kids. Every day from 7am until 10pm for the past two years, Kenjong has been at this location, paying $112 a month in rent. Sometimes in the afternoon his wife will help him run the juice stand after she is done with work.

With two sources of income coming in, the Pins lead a modest but fulfilling life. Kenjong thanks God every day because his juice stand has changed his life and given him opportunities that he never had before. Kenjong is requesting this, his second loan, in order to continue investing in fruit so he may diversify his store and his offerings.

Kenjong is a 39 year old entrepreneur with two children and a loving, supportive wife. They own their own house, and thanks to the success he has had at the juice stand, Kenjong was able to reinforce the house with cement. They want people to know that they are a very hard-working family and that they use their money wisely to plan for future endeavors, such as expanding the business to new branch locations across Guayaquil.

loans.use: Invest in fruit and improvements to his store

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: A 36-year-old widow, Mai C., lives with her four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She sells Khmer noodles on the roadside of her village, and makes around $2/day in profit. Two of her children work at the nearby factory, and the rest of are students. Mai C. is currently requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more tools and some utensils for her business. She is so grateful for the big help of the loan, and hopes it will help to meet her clients’ needs and enable her to make additional profits.

loans.use: To purchase different tools and utensils for her business.

loans.name: Pharn

texts.en: Mrs. Pharn N. H. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband make a living by grinding rice and raising pigs in their field. With this business activity, it enables them to moderately make about $3.60 each day. N. H. hopes to keep investing in her business by using the loan to purchase more rice and pigs, as well as to satisfy her clients' needs. This couple is confident that they will beneficially use the loan to generate more profit, and this profit will enable them to purchase a plot of farm land for their business expansion in the next couple of years.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve the appearance of her store

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto sells and fixes kitchen stoves and other household appliances. He learned the family trade from his father over 25 years ago. He started off with a small stand in the fairs of Guayaquil four years ago, but now he has a larger spot in the markets. His son works with him at the location and his wife sells the products door to door.

Ernesto is seeking his second loan from Kiva and Mifex. He paid back his first loan completely on time and saw positive results in his business. He needs this new loan to continue investing in new and used merchandise. With these goods he adds new inventory to his business and increases sales. The extra income has allowed him to get started with his plans to improve his home which is now made of wood.

loans.use: Invest in new and used kitchen appliances

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Business Description

Mónica started her business with a little bit of capital from her family. She has the help of her son in attending the business, which is located in a school. It is the School Supply Store and Soda Bar of the school. Mónica works every day that school is in session, from 7 a.m. to 12 p.m. Mónica offers her customers sausages with french fries, empanadas, soft drinks, juices, various candies, and school supplies.

Loan Use

With this loan, Mónica wants to purchase new candy products, to have a variety so that her customers will have more options to choose from and be satisfied. She also indicated to us that she will improve her location where she puts the school supplies that the children are asking for, like pens, pencils, educational sheets, and more.

Personal Information

Mónica is 35 years old, she is separated from her husband, and she has 3 young children. They are in school. Her home is of mixed construction (part concrete, part cane). Since she doesn't have any help from her husband, it has been hard for her to get ahead with her family. Mónica hopes that with her effort and hard work their living conditions will improve.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Mónica inicio su negocio con un pequeño capital familiar. Para la atención del negocio cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo. Por estar su negocio ubicado en una escuela donde esta a cargo de la Papelería y del Soda Bar de la Escuela. Mónica atiende su negocio los días laborables de la Escuela. Su atención es de 7: AM a 12: PM. Mónica brinda a sus clientes salchipapas, empanadas, colas, jugos, confites varios y también invertirá una pequeña parte en compra de productos de papelería.

Uso del Préstamo

Mónica con el crédito desea adquirir nuevos productos de confites para de esta manera tener variedad para que sus clientes tengan más opciones para escoger y estén satisfechos. Además nos indico que adecuara el local para poner los productos de papelería que los chicos le están solicitando como plumas, lápices, laminas educativas y otros.

Información Personal

Mónica tiene 35 años esta separada de su esposo tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Ellos estudian. S u vivienda es de construcción mixta. Al no contar con la ayuda de su esposo le ha sido difícil sacar adelante a su familia. Mónica tiene la esperanza que con sus esfuerzos y trabajo su condición de vida va a mejorar

loans.use: To invest in food and school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in metal and other raw materials for her shop

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Business Description

Jacinta started her business with a little capital of her own. Jacinta, along with her husband, started a business buying and selling recycled materials, such as scrap metal from washing machines, refrigerators, and stoves, copper, cardboard, plastics, and other products. Jacinta indicates that she attends her business Monday through Saturday from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. Jacinta rents a piece of land where she lives and stores all the different recycled materials she sells on the days when she works.

Loan Use

Jacinta is asking for this loan in order to have capital available, because often people come to sell her recycling and she has to pay them on the spot, depending on the weight of their materials in pounds or kilos. Jacinta indicates that this business supports both her and her family, as well as the people who come to them to sell recycled materials.

Personal Information

Jacinta is 38 years old and has 3 children. She and her husband are keeping this business going and they say that, even though it's trash, for them and others who work in this field, recycling is the source of their income. She says that thanks to this business they have been able to buy a plot of land. Her longing is to be able to build a home and to give better food and education to her family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Jacinta inicio su negocio con pequeño capital propio. Jacinta junto con su esposo realizan el negocio de compra y venta de materiales de reciclaje como chatarras de lavadoras, refrigeradoras, cocinas, cobre, cartón, plásticos y otros productos. Jacinta indica que su negocio lo atiende de lunes a sábado desde las 6 AM a 20 PM. Jacinta alquila un terreno donde ella vive y almacena todos los diferentes materiales de reciclaje que le van a vender todos los días que ella atiende.

Uso del Préstamo

Jacinta solicita el préstamo para tener capital disponible porque a muchas veces le van a vender reciclaje y tiene que pagarles al momento lo que pesa sea esto en libras, kilos. Jacinta indica que con este negocio ella y su familia tienen el sustento diario y también las diferentes personas que les van a vender lo reciclado.

Información Personal

Jacinta tiene 38 años y 3 hijos. Jacinta junto con su esposo están sosteniendo el negocio y dicen que a pesar de que es basura el reciclaje para ellos y los que laboran en esto son sus fuentes de ingreso. Jacinta dice que gracias a este negocio logro comprar un terreno. Su anhelo es poder construir su casa y darle una mejor alimentación y educación a su familia.

loans.use: To have capital to buy her merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in wood

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Business Description

Daysi started her business with her own savings, along with her husband, 9 years ago, and it is located in her home. She works every day of the week from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. The products Daysi sells are rice, oil, meat, chicken, and various vegetables. She indicates to us that her business has helped her get ahead by improving her location, giving it more security. In the area where she lives, you have to be very careful.

Loan Use

Daysi indicates to us that with this loan she will buy more sacks of rice, boxes of oil, and soft drinks, and in this way meet the demand of her customers, which has increased. She indicates that greater investment means greater earning, and this will permit her to keep improving her home, which is already being remodeled.

Personal Information

Daysi has 3 children, 2 of whom are in school. Her home is made of concrete, but it is being improved. Daysi tells us that one difficulty in maintaining her business is other businesses in her area, and she knows that success means having her business well-stocked and providing good service. That's why she is requesting this capital, to continue offering her customers the variety of products they need.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Daysi inicio su negocio con ahorros propios junto con su esposo hace 9 años y lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio. Atiende a sus clientes todos los días de la semana desde las 6 AM a 22 PM. Los productos que Daysi vende son arroz, azúcar, aceite, carnes, pollos y legumbres varias. Ella nos indica que su negocio le ha permitido salir adelante en adecuar su local dándole mayor seguridad. En la zona donde vive tiene que tener mucho cuidado.

Uso del Préstamo

Daysi nos indica que con el préstamo comprara más quintales de arroz, caja de aceite, colas para de esta manera cumplir la demanda de sus clientes que han aumentado. Nos indica que mayor inversión mayor ganancia y esto le permitirá seguir adecuando su vivienda que aun esta en adecuación.

Información Personal

Daysi tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian. Su vivienda es de cemento, pero aun en adecuaciones. Daysi nos dice que una dificultad es mantener su negocio debido a otros negocios en el sector y sabe que el éxito es tener su negocio bien surtido y dar una buena atención. Razón por lo cual solicita un capital para seguir brindando a sus clientes variedad de productos y que estén al alcance de ellos.

loans.use: Rice, oil, soft drinks, and other products

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Business Description

Adelaida has 15 years of experience in the business of selling fish. She started out with her own savings, selling in one corner of her home. At present, Adelaida sells fried fish with rice and vegetable stew on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. Adelaida works by herself. She is a single mother, but she considers herself a fighter. Adelaida has seen development in her business, since thanks to her fish sales she has directed part of her capital toward buying yogurt in 2 or 4 liter containers which she delivers every 15 days and at the end of the month to the crew of a shrimp boat on the peninsula.

Loan Use

Adelaida is requesting this loan in order to increase her business. The demand has grown for her yogurt and fish sales. She also indicates to us that she has thought of investing in the purchase of milk, coconut, and sugar to make homemade ice cream. She could deliver it to 2 people who would sell it and she would earn a percentage of the sales. Adelaida wants to continue improving her home to give greater safety to her family.

Personal Information

Adelaida is 48 years old and has 1 son. Her home is made of concrete with an earth floor, and it is under construction.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Adelaida tiene 15 años con su negocio de venta de pescado. Empezó con ahorros propios vendiendo en esquina de su casa. Adelaida actualmente vende pescado frito con arroz y menestra los días jueves, viernes, sábados y domingos. Desde las 17 PM a 21 PM. Adelaida vende sola es madre soltera, pero se considera una mujer luchadora. Adelaida ha visto desarrollo en su negocio ya que gracias a la venta de pescado parte de su capital lo dirige también a la compra de yogurt de 4 y 2 litros los mismos que los entrega cada 15 días y fin de mes a personal de una camaronera en la península.

Uso del Préstamo

Adelaida solicita el crédito para incrementar sus negocio. Su demanda ha aumentado en la venta de yogurt y pescado. También nos indica que tiene pensado invertir en comprar leche, coco, azúcar porque ella elabora helados caseros. Y entrega a 2 personas que le venden y ganan un porcentaje por helados. Adelaida tiene como anhelo seguir adecuado su vivienda para dar una mejor seguridad a su familia.

Información Personal

Adelaida tiene 48 años 1 hijo su vivienda es de cemento y piso de tierra y esta en construcción.

loans.use: To invest in new products to sell and maybe make ice cream

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify and increase her inventory

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: Noun K. is a 72- year-old woman, and the mother of 4 children. She lives in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is an ailing mother and too old to work, so all the family’s expenses is a big responsibility for her children. One of her children helps by weaving handbags and selling them to a nearby retail shop. Two of her children sell sugar cane juice in the city, and the other attends school. In order to generate more income, two of her children have an idea of expanding her business by selling meatballs. To do this, Nimoy is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase some utensils and a motorcycle to operate a business. This will enable them to make more profits for her family.

loans.use: To purchase some utensils and a motorcycle to run a business.

loans.name: Nghuon

texts.en: Mrs. Nghuon M. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a farmer, growing rice crops and a variety of vegetables, which provides her with an average of around $2 each day. Her husband, meanwhile, is self-employed as a horse cart driver (a cart attached with a horse to transport passengers) and typically makes about $5/day. Nghuon M. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a horse and a cart for her husband to operate a business. In the future, she dreams of being able to have enough money to purchase another piece of productive land to expand her crops and make more profits.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and a cart to operate a business.

loans.name: Nghem

texts.en: Mrs. Nghem T. is 44 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband make a living by making wine, raising pigs and growing a variety of crops. With this business activity, the couple typically makes around $4/day in revenue. In order to maximize farm production, Nghem T. is currently requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a tractor in order to prepare her productive soil for the new seeds. In the future, this couple would like to add more pigs, so that they will make additional profits for the next few years.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Nghem Thol has paid this loan back early.

Thanks to your support, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to help finance their small businesses and to support their families. We hope you will continue your support on Kiva.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Chok

texts.en: Mrs. Chok S. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She makes her living by building rooms and renting them to the nearby garment workers. She can typically make around $2 each day, while her husband works at a private company as a driver and makes around $5/day. Additionally, 2 of her children work at a private company, and the other attends school. Due to the increase in the number of her tenants, Chok S. is currently asking for $1000 to build more rooms to rent out. In the future, she would like to be able to build as many rooms as she could to generate more income.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent out.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Chok Sophat has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Musabe

texts.en:
Musabe started her business over 10 years ago. She was married, but her husband died in 1997, leaving her alone with 7 beautiful daughters. All the difficulties of taking care of children and their home were on her shoulders from that point on.

Musabe was the manager of a kindergarten, but the salary was not enough to support her big family, so she decided to sell soft drinks in the open-air market. Gradually, she was able to increase her circulating capital and rented stall space in Shark shop in Panjshanbe for her present business.

In 2006 Musabe became a client of Micro Invest. Her first loan was US$ 150. Thanks to the loans, she was able to sign contracts with several sewing shops of traditional women's dresses for long partnership. Currently she has US$ 2000 in her turnover.

Today Musabe has many clients and is very satisfied with her place of business. In future she hopes to rent another stall for her eldest daughter. Musabe has two dreams: first to give all her children a good education and secondly, she dearly wishes that her family will not to be in need of anything.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly K. E. is a 47-year-old woman and mother of 1 child. She lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a landlord who builds different rooms to rent to the garment factory workers and can make a moderate amount, around $5 each day. Her husband, meanwhile, is too old to work, but he has three pool tables to service in his area which enables him to make around $5 each day. In order to maximize the size of her profits, Ly K. E. is requesting a loan amount of $1000 to build more rooms, so that she can fulfill her tenants' needs.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent out.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Mansura has been in business for 10 years. She is married and has 2 children, both of whom attend school. Mansura sells different kinds of candies such as chocolates, fruit-drops, caramels, and jellies. She always buys high quality products and has many clients who always come back to her shop.

During the summertime, Mansura sells a lot of candies, as it is time for weddings and other big family events for which people usually buy a lot of candies. She needs US$ 800 to buy her next batch of candies.

loans.use: Purchase of confectionery items

loans.name: Suraio

texts.en:
Suraio has a small candy shop in the central market of Khujand. She is a teacher and has higher education but she could not find a job with a good salary and so decided to sell food products. Suraio is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a doctor.

Suraio sells different kinds of candies, sweet biscuits and wafers. Her husband helped her to rent a place for her business and to work out contracts with suppliers from Russia, Uzbekistan and Kirgizistan. Today, the turnover of her business is fast and she has clients who come back to her shop frequently from districts of Khujand such as Konibodom, Isfara, Panjekent and Mastchoh.

In future Suraio plans to involve her elder son in the business and rent another market stall for him.

loans.use: Purchase of confectionery items

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 45 years old and has a small shop to sell shoes. He has five children, and two of them work with him. He wants to borrow $1200 to purchase more goods for this shop. He wants to enhance his standard of living and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: To develop his shop and purchase more goods

loans.name: Zohidboi

texts.en:
Zohidboi has been an active client of Micro Invest since 2001. He has always repaid his loan in a timely fashion. He started his business selling confectionery products in 1997 in a wholesale market. Gradually he increased the turnover of his business and in 1999 he was able to rent a small shop in the central market in Panjshanbe. Due the loans from Micro Invest, he was able to expand his assortment of goods, adding different kinds of candies to his business. Today Zohidboi's candy shop is one of the best known shops in the area. He has a lot of clients from all districts of Khujand. He has contracts with distributors of candies from Russia and Uzbekistan.

Zohidboi plans to use his next loan to purchase a big batch of goods. He needs US$ 1000 for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase of candies

loans.name: Abdugaffur

texts.en:
Abdurauf has been engaged in business over 7 years. He is married and has 3 children. He has higher education as a business manager. From 1980 to 1991 he worked as a manager in the big centralized shop. But after the collapse of the USSR, he was compelled to look for another job with a good salary.

Abdurauf could not find a job and so went to Russia to earn money. In 2000 he returned and was able to rent a stall in the Pasnjshanbe market. He bought tinned vegetables and fruits from a tinned goods factory and sold them in Panjshanbe.

Nowadays Abdurauf has many clients, not only from Khujand, but also from all regions. Gradually, Abdurauf has been able to increase the turnover of his business and buy fruits and vegetables to make tinned foods. His wife and his two daughters helped him with the processing, and his son sold tinned vegetables and fruits with his father at their market stall.

In future Abdurauf plans to rent another stall for his son. Now he wants to buy refrigeration equipment for fruit juices. He needs US$ 600 for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase of refrigeration equipment

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
S. Alijon has been in business for 7 years. He is married and has 2 children, both in school. His wife is a housewife. They live with his elderly parents and of course care for them.

S.'s stall is located in the center of Panjshanbe market. The turnover of his business is fast. He started receiving loans 4 years ago and has slowly increased the loan amount from US$ 100 to US$ 1000. He buys rice from constant suppliers every month in 300kg lots. He wants to increase the turnover of his business and plans to buy rice with the US$ 700.

loans.use: Purchase of rice

loans.name: Dadoboi

texts.en:
Dadaboi is married and has 2 children. He started his business over 7 years ago, renting a stall in an open-air market of Khujand. Over 7 years of working at the market, Dadaboi already has got enough experience to do his work successfully and has clients who always come to him. He also has a livestock farm where his children help him.

Dadaboi has been buying his rice from Isfara every month in 500 kg lots. This season he bought a new kind of rice: devzira. Devzira has a specific flavor and Dadoboi plans to conclude a contract with his suppliers to buy this kind of rice from them in future .

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Bihosiyat

texts.en:
Bihosiyat has been engaged in business for over 12 years. She is married and has 2 children. In 1995 she rented a stall in Panjshanbe market and started her business selling household goods. But over time she noticed that there is a more constant demand for food products and so decided to change her business from household goods to food products in 2000. She rented another stall at Panjshanbe market and started confectionery items.

As she attracted a lot of customers, Bihosiyat sold her goods in a short time. Gradually she was able to expand her assortment. She sold all kind of sugar products such as "navod", lump sugar, and granulated sugar. She also added confectionery products to her assortment: cakes, honey cakes, sweet biscuits and fancy cakes. She was later able to get refrigerated showcase for her goods.

Bihosiyat has one dream: to open a sewing workshop for her daughter. Now Bihosiyat is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to purchase addditional confectionery items.

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: A client of LAPO who has been with LAPO for 5 years, Joy is married with four children. She hails from Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria and sells bags of pure water to her community.  She wishes to borrow the above amount for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more bags of water for sale

loans.name: Ogieva

texts.en: This woman is proud to be a member of LAPO. She has a business worth 100,000 NGN (about $785), and she promises to expand it with an additional funds. She is from the Edo State in Nigeria and is requesting to borrow the sum of $450.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Stella tells us, "I have more than 4 years of experience in my business and it is my greatest source of income. With my earnings from it, I provide my children with their basic needs and also with education. I am asking for a loan of US$ 400 so that I can expand my business."

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: "LAPO has showered good things on me," says Mrs. Eunice Umeoberiri. She hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. Eunice hopes to expand her business with a loan of US$ 750.

loans.use: To buy more electrical equipment

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 63 years old and is married with five children. She specializes in the sales of cooked food  for the community. She is from Asaba Delta State of Nigeria. Joy is requesting a loan of $750 so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for food she serves in her little restaurant

loans.name: Christian

texts.en: Mrs. E. Christian is a businesswoman who sells baby clothing and various items for infant care to the community. She is from Asaba Delta State in Nigeria. She hope to increase the inventory of her shop with a loan of US$ 750.

loans.use: To buy more baby clothing for her inventory

loans.name: Uju

texts.en: Mrs. Uju I. owns and operates a small mini-store in her area, selling drinks and snacks to her community. She is 48 years old and married with five children. She feels sure that she can increase her business turnover and care for her children better with a loan of US$ 400 as added capital.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and snacks

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: A dedicated client of Lift Above Poverty Oorganization (LAPO), Mrs. Mercy C. has been in the fish-smoking business for 16 years. She is happily married with four children. With this loan of US$ 400, Mercy hopes to be able to expand her business by buying more fish to smoke for resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish  to smoke for resale

loans.name: Obiamuju

texts.en: "I am 42 years old," says Mrs. O. Obiamuji. She sells drinks and general merchandise in her store. She is eager to receive a loan of US$ 750 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and general merchandise for resale

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Mrs. Anna E. is a good cook. She was taught cooking by her mother and for over 10 years, she has been cooking for her community. She hails from Asaba in Delta State. She is requesting a loan of $625 to expand her little restaurant business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her restaurant

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen, who is 46 years old and a mother of seven children, sells local food specialties and other provisions to the community, a business she started back in 1982. She believes that with a loan of US$ 550 to add to her business capital, her turnover and her profit will increase tremendously and she will be better able to cater for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her little store

loans.name: Nkohi

texts.en: Mother of one child, Mrs. Nkohi O. sells cooked food and cold drinks to customers in her neighborhood of Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for five years now. Mrs. O. is looking forward to receiving a loan of US$ 750 to add to her capital and thus improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients for her little restaurant

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: "I am delighted to be working in sales of foodstuffs and clothes," says Mrs. Kate O.. A competent business woman, Kate is optimistic that her turnover will improve if she receives a loan of US$ 750 which will allow her to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To add to the inventory of her business

loans.name: Stella
