texts.en: Mrs. Stella O. is a business woman who sells clothes and jewelry. She is married with five children and is hoping to get a loan of US$ 750 to boost her business venture.

loans.use: To buy more clothes & jewelry

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is a well-trained hairdresser who has practiced her trade for 6 years. She hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria and is 33 years old, married with four children. Rose feels sure she can improve her business with a loan of $750.

loans.use: To buy more equipment & goods to sell in her salon

loans.name: Egwuogu

texts.en: Miss A. Eqwuogu is 34 years old. She has a little store where she sells handbags and shoes and and does her clients' nails. She hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria and is an experienced person in her business. She needs a loan of $ 750 so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and bags for her inventory

loans.name: Jeoffery

texts.en: "I have a business that is presently worth about US$ 1500 (Nigerian Naira 200, 000)," says Mr. Jeoffery O., "and I hope to expand my inventory with a Kiva loan." Jeoffery is 53 years old and father of six children. He is requesting a loan of $625.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for his inventory

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Mr. Oliver A. is a motorcycle transporter hoping to expand his business.  Oliver is 28 years old and hails from Asaba, Nigeria. He is requesting a loan of $625 to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a motor cycle

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia A., now 55 years old, learnt hairdressing for 1 year and six months before she started her business in the year 1986. She is married with five children and living in Asaba, Delta State of Nigeria. She believes that a loan of $ 750 will allow her to expand her salon and earn more profit to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more equipment & goods for sale

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: A businesswoman of distinguished character, Edith speaks highly of Lift Above Poverty Organization. She says she was rescued by LAPO when there was no way forward for her and her family.  Edith sells provisions and drinks to her community. She hopes to receive a loan of $400 that will allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Mrs. Rose M. is a trader who travels to other states to buy garri and sells it wholesale in her community. She is proud to be Lift Above Poverty Organization's client and says LAPO has helped boost her business. Rose is 35 years of age, married with four children. She hopes to get a loan of $ 750 so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of garri for resale

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en: Mrs. Clementina A. is 50 years old, a woman full of life who sells yams all day long. She hopes to get a loan of $ 750 to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more yams for resale

loans.name: Etobe

texts.en: Mr. Etobe N. is a businessman who travels to nearby states to buy clothes for resale. He specializes in the sale of men's wear. He is happy that whenever he needs funds for growth, LAPO always comes to his aid.  Mr. N. is now requesting a loan of $ 750 to expand his clothing business.

loans.use: To buy more men's wear for resale

loans.name: Osaafiane

texts.en: "I am proud to be a member of LAPO because LAPO has helped my business grow, and I now can send my children to school," says Mrs. A. Osaafiane, 28 years old.  A. is requesting a loan of $750 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more jewelery and drinks for sale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: "The catering business is very good if you can invest in it," Comfort M. says. Her business is presently worth about $500 (Nigerian Naira 70, 000) but she needs additional capital. Comfort is married with five children. She hopes to receive the Kiva loan of $ 750 so that she can expand her catering business.

loans.use: To buy more caking-baking equipment

loans.name: Queen Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Queen Victoria O. is a good cook who learnt her business for 5 years. She started her business in the year 2002 in the area of Asaba, Delta State. She is 37 years old, married with four children. She needs a loan of $550 so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia N. is an industrious woman who has benefitted from Lift Above Poverty Oranization's loans for the past three years. She is married with four children. Felicia feels certain that with a loan of $ 750 she will be able to increase her turnover and her profits to better cater for her children's needs.

loans.use: To buy more baby things

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria M. is a motorcycle spare part dealer. She is asking for a Kiva loan of $400 so that she can increase her inventory and improve the outlook for her future.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for resale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: A lovely young mother, Mrs. Stella G. is 34 years old, married with five children. She sells provisions and believes she can improve her business turnover  and her future if given a loan of $550. Stella hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria .

loans.use: To buy more provisions for resale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: An industrious woman who wants to provide the possibility for communication to the public, Regina sells GSM (phone) accessories. Regina is 47 years old, married with six children. She believes a Kiva loan of $ 400 will allow her to expand her business and help it continue to grow.

loans.use: To buy more accessories for resale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Mrs. Gina K. presently has a business worth Nigerian Naira 300,000 (about US$2,300) selling fish food for fish-farming. Gina hopes to expand her business with a Kiva loan of $750.

loans.use: To buy more fish feed for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace E. is 42 years old, married with six children, and hails from Asaba, Delta State, in Nigeria. She is someone who takes care of people in her community.  Grace hopes to expand her business with a Kiva loan of $750.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth U. is a woman of integrity. She honours what Lift Above Poverty Organization has done in her life, especially for her family, making her able to pay her rent and her children's school fees. Elizabeth sells fairly used clothes to the public. She hopes to be able to expand her business if given a Kiva loan of $400 to buy more bales of used clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more fairly used clothes for resale

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Mrs. Ngozi E. is 29 years old, married with four children, and hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food and provisions to her community. She is requesting a loan of $ 625 to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and food ingredients

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy O. is proud to be a dedicated client of  Lift Above Poverty Oganization. She says LAPO has brought solutions to her problems. Dorothy, a union leader in her group, is 32 years old with five children.  She feels certain she can improve her turnover if she receives a loan of $ 650 so that she can add to her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her inventory

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Mrs. Augustine U. is a union leader who sells cooked food and groceries to her community. She hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 40 years of age, married with two children. Augustine hopes to receive a loan of $750 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her inventory

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Mr. Monday O. sells provisions and has a business currently worth about US$ 1,150 (Nigerian Naira 150, 000). Monday is 38 years old, married with two children. He is eager to receive a loan of US$ 625 so that he can expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for his inventory

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope Onwuchukwa is a dealer in rice and provisions. She needs additional capital to boost her business. She feels sure that with a loan of US$ 750 she will be able to increase her turnover and thus her profit.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her inventory

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: "I am happy that Lift Above Poverty Organization has come to my rescue," says Mrs. Kate E..  Kate, who hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria, sells bags of rice and provisions. She is 35 years of age and has five children. She is pleased with LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of rice & provisions

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: River fish are very popular in Mrs. Mary M.'s area. She travels to other states to buy fish for resale. Her business is presently worth around N100, 000 (about US$800). She hopes to receive a US$ 550 loan so that she can further expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more river fish

loans.name: Amachi

texts.en: Mrs. Amachi E. is a married woman and has five children. She is a hard-working woman and has the interest of helping the poor with her goods. Amachi has been in the fish business for 10 years. She hopes to expand her business if she receives a loan of $625.

loans.use: To buy more river fish

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. B. began his business 8 years ago by selling fruits and vegetables. Since then, his store has grown and today he has one of the best grocery stores of the area. Helped by his wife, he sells provisions and first need products in his store.

Use of Loan

He would like to invest his loan in the purchase of more merchandise and to enlarge his store. He would like to buy seasonal products on sale. By buying at wholesale prices, his costs remain low and, therefore, can offer his clients a better price.

Personal Information

He has a six year old daughter who studies in a nearby establishment. His home is made of concrete and his goal is to expand his business each day.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Señor B. empezó su negocio hace 8 años con la venta de legumbres y frutas, hoy en día su negocio a crecido y cuenta con una de las despensas mejores del sector, vende víveres y productos de primera necesidad, en su local le ayuda su esposa

Uso del Préstamo

El quiere invertir su préstamo en comprar mas mercadería y ampliar su tienda, quiere comprar productos que por la temporada están en promoción, ya que si compra al por mayor resultan los costos mas bajos y de esta manera el puede vender a sus clientes a precios cómodos

Información Personal

Tiene una hija de seis años y estudia en uno de los establecimientos cercanos, su vivienda es de cemento y su meta es ampliar cada día su negocio

loans.use: Purchase more supplies and to enlarge his store.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. S. began his business 4 years ago with earnings he obtained by the liquidation from a private company job. His sales have increased due to the variety of dishes he has. His two granddaughters help him in his food store located on a highly transited street. He sells lunches and a variety of dishes of the area.

Use of Loan

He wants to invest his loan in refurbishing his food shop in order to provide a better service to his clients, who grow in number every day.

Personal Information

He is 63 years old, has 3 children who have each started their own families. Two granddaughters accompany Mr. S.. His house is made of concrete and his goal is to work on improving his store in order to satisfy his clients.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Señor S. empezó su negocio hace 4 años con un capital producto de una liquidación que obtuvo de un trabajo para una empresa privada, sus ventas han aumentado por la variedad de platos que dispone, a el le ayudan sus dos nietas y su negocio esta ubicado en una calle transitada, vende almuerzos y variedad de platos típicos de la localidad

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere invertir su préstamo en realizar adecuaciones en su local y de esta manera dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que cada día aumentan

Información Personal

Tiene 63 años , tiene 3 hijos de los cuales cada quien tienen formado sus hogares, a el le acompañan dos de sus nietas, su vivienda es de cemento y sus metas es mejorar cada día su negocio para de esta manera sus clientes estén satisfechos

loans.use: Improve appearance of store

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: "I am proud to have been a Lift Above Poverty Organization client for the past 3 years," stated Mrs. Florence O.. Florence is 30 years of age, married with five children. She lives in Asaba of Delta State in Nigeria and sells plantains and bags of rice to people in her area. Florence believes that a loan of $400 will allow her to expand her business successfully and increase her turnover.

loans.use: To buy more plantains and rice for her inventory

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Mrs. Clara I. is a dynamic client of Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) who specializes in the sale of basic foodstuffs to people in her area. Caroline is a young woman of 42, married with eight children, from Asaba of Delta State in Nigeria. She hopes to expand and improve her business with a loan of $750.

loans.use: To buy more items for her inventory

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: "Being a member of Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) has made a positive difference in my life," explained  Mrs. Caroline N., who now has a business worth over US$1,000  (Naira 150, 000).  Caroline is married with eight children and lives in a semi-urban area of Delta State. She sells basic foodstuffs to her community and plans to use the loan of US$750 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
"I am 49 years old, married with eight (8) children. LAPO has brought rain (i.e., growth) to my
business and my family," say Mrs. Maria B.. Maria is from Delta State of Nigeria and specializes in hair
dressing . She is eager to access a loan of US$ 450 so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more equipment & also goods for sale

loans.name: Vidalia

texts.es:
Vidalia lives in downtown Guayaiby, a small village in Santaní. She is married and has 2 children and her husband works in a ginning factory. In order to help support the family, Vidalia started a microbusiness in her house: she opened a butcher's shop with which she has been helping her husband pay for the household expenses, especially for their children's education.

Vidalia's business is doing well, she opened it 5 years ago and over that period she saw an increase in her number of clients. Today, Vidalia would like to see her business grow. She wishes to buy live poultry so she can raise and slaughter them for sale in her house, with the help of her brother, who already has experience with butchering.

They need a $900 capital to buy chickens and build their own chicken coop so they can increase their sales. Vidalia has already calculated the costs and how much revenue the business would be getting and she is very excited, because the demand for poultry meat and eggs is very high and they can fetch good prices.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra Vidalia vive en el centro D. Guayaiby un pueblo D. Santaní, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos; su marido es empleado en una fábrica desmotadora. Para poder ayudar con los ingresos D. la casa, Vidalia, armó su propia microempresa en su casa, ella tiene una carnicería, con lo que ayuda a su marido a solventar los gastos D. la casa, especialmente los estudios D. sus hijos. Su negocio marcha bien, ya van 5 años desD. que monto su carnicería y con el tiempo se ha hecho D. muchos clientes. Hoy Vidalia quiere crecer y expandir su negocio, ella desea comprar aves vivas para poder criarlas y fanearlas en su casa para la venta, con la ayuda D. su hermano que ya tiene experiencia en el faneamiento D. animales. Necesitan un capital D. $ 900 para poder comprar gallinas y armar su corral con lo que ira ampliando sus ventas; ella ha calculado el costo y las utilidades que le generará su negocio y esta muy entusiasmanda pues la demanda D. carne D. aves y huevos es muy alta y se comercializa a muy buen precio.

loans.use: comprar gallinas y armar un corral para cria de aves

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: "Life has become sweet and enjoyable since I became a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) member  several years ago," says Mrs. Rita M.. Rita is 35 years of age with three children.  She hopes to improve her business turnover with the requested amount.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her inventory

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario González owns a tire shop located on one of Santaní's busiest streets. He is single and owns his own house. He lives with his mom, whom he has been taking care of for several years. Mario opened his business ten years ago, providing tire repair services to an increasing number of clientele. Later, he began selling old and new tires, which were growing in demand. Mario wishes to offer more variety of new tires, since these are the items that generate the largest revenues. He needs a $350 loan to get him started.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Mario González es dueño de una gomería sobre una de las calles más transitadas de ciudad de Santaní. Es soltero,tiene casa propia y vive con su madre a quien cuida desde hace varios años. Mario abrió su negocio hace ya diez años, prestando servicios de auxilio y gomería, de a poco fue adquiriendo clientes y expandiendose a la venta de cubiertas usadas y nuevas, las cuales tienen bastante demanda. Mario desa renovar su stock de cubiertas nuevas, pues son estas las que le generan mayores ganancias, para ello solicita un crédito de $350.

loans.use: compra de cubiertas nuevas para la venta

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida is married and has 5 children. She has a farm, which she tends with her two brothers; they grow a popular root called manioc (also known as Yuka) which is an important part of the everyday meal in Paraguay. Brigida and her brothers also grow tomatoes, vegetables and corn. They work very hard, starting their day at dawn; in the morning they work the land and in the afternoon they go to the market to sell their produce, which can fetch good prices. Brigida wishes to upgrade her implements and buy new tools to help and speed up their work; most of the tools they use are rendered obsolete and that complicates their work.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Brigida es casada y tiene 5 hijos. Ella se dedica a la agricultura, posee una chacra donde trabaja junto a su dos hermanos donde cultivan mandioca (también conocida como yuka, una raíz muy consumida y que forma parte del alimento diario en Paraguay )., tomate, hortalizas y maíz. Trabajan arduamente desde tempranas horas de la mañana; trabajan y labran la tierra por las mañanas, por la tarde acuden al mercado de la ciudad para vender sus productos que son muy bien cotizados por los compradores. Brigida desea modernizar sus elementos de trabajo y adquirir nuevas herramietas que le facilitaran y agilizarán su trabajo, pues la mayoría de las herramientas con la que trabajan estan obsoletas y les dificulta su labor.

loans.use: Compra de herramientas nuevas para cultivo.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David is a married father of three, two sons, ages 19 and 15, and a 6-year-old daughter. His spouse is a housewife. His two boys are in school and also help him in his business, making wooden furniture. He learned the trade from his father and he decided to do the same. David worked before at another place and also he made worked by himself on the side but did not enough tools. Little by little, he was able to obtain these tools and open his own business.

David is requesting for a loan of $550 to purchase wood and some tools for his business and he plans to repay this loan within 6 months. He and his family thank you so much for your support in growing with the business and helping give David's children an education.

Translated from the original Spanish text

David es un hombre casado y tiene tres hijos dos hijos de 19 y 15 años de edad respectivamente, y una hija de 6 años de edad, su esposa se dedica al hogar. Sus dos hijos hombres están estudiando y también le ayudan en el negocio, el cuál es fabricar muebles de madera, oficio que lo aprendió de su padre y decidió dedicarse al mismo. David antes trabajaba en otro taller y por su cuenta poco a poco por que no tenía las herramientas necesarias, ya con el tiempo fue adquiriendo las mismas y pudo abrir su propio negocio.

David está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 550 para comprar madera y algunas herramientas para el negocio y ofrece pagar este préstamo en 6 meses, el y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le das y así poder continuar con su negocio y darles educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase wood and tools

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto is single and works as a artistic sign maker. Since he was in school he had a passion for drawing, and his teachers always asked to make posters for school events. Roberto started his job two years ago when a teacher of his recommended him for a job, and then he started taking on more and more clients and places to work. With this job, Roberto helps to his parents with family expenses.

Roberto is requesting for a loan of $100 to purchase materials needed to make his signs. He does not ask for payment before he finishes the job, and he has a lot of work at the moment. He plans to repay this loan in 3 months. He appreciates your support.

Translated from the original Spanish text

Roberto es un hombre soltero que se dedica a la elaboración de rótulos, desde la secundaría él tenía pasión por el dibujo y sus maestros siempre lo empleaban para realizar los dibujos en la escuela para días festivos. Roberto empezó con su oficio hace doce años cuando un maestro lo recomendó para hacer un trabajo y empezó a realizar este tipo de trabajo en algunos negocios de la localidad y eso le ha ido sirviendo de referencia para obtener más clientes. Con su trabajo Roberto ayuda a cubrir los gastos en su hogar.

Roberto está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 100 para comprar materiales para poder elaborar sus rótulos, ya que el no pide anticipos por los trabajos que realiza y ahora esta teniendo muchos contratos, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en 3 meses. Él te agradece mucho por el apoyo que le das para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase art supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Descripción del Negocio

Mrs. María sells traditional dishes such as fish soup, chicken stew, and beef entrails stew, which she serves in a store she rents in her local municipal market. She began to sell these dishes on the sidewalk of a main street. Then, she was given the chance to rent this space and that is how she was able to improve her business.

Uso of Loan

She needs the credit to purchase a showcase where she can exhibit her products in a better way; people will be able to see the delicious dishes María prepares. She is convinced that by preparing traditional meals of the area, she will have more clients and, therefore, a greater need for supplies in order to meet the production demands.

Personal Information

María is 51 years old, has two children who study and help her in the food sales. Her house is made of cane and she also counts on her brother’s support who lives with her.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

L Sra. Maria tiene a la venta platos típicos como sopa de pescado, estofado de pollo y estofado de vísceras de vaca que expende en un local que arrienda en un mercado municipal de su sector. Ella comenzó a vender dichos platos en una acera de una calle principal luego tuvo la oportunidad de alquilar un puesto el mercado y fue así que pudo mejorar su negocio

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar un vitrina donde podrá exhibir de mejor manera sus producto y así las personas puedan observar mejor los deliciosos platos que Maria prepara. Además ella esta convencida que preparando otras delicias típicas de la zona tendrá mas clientela y por ello también necesita comprar mas mercadería para aumentar su producción

Información Personal

Maria tiene 51 años de edad y dos hijos quienes estudia y además le ayudan en la venta de la comida, su casa es de caña y cuenta también con el apoyo del hermano que vive con ella

loans.use: Purchase a showcase to exhibit her products.

loans.name: Albino

texts.es:
In my business I sell secondhand clothes and tennis shoes, but I would like to invest in buying more things to sell; like this I will be able to have more clients and a bigger income. The location of my business is very good since it is in front a very big commercial center; therefore there are a lot of people who walk by. I’m asking for a loan of $ 1,200 to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

En mi negocio vendo ropa y tenis usados, pero me gustaría invertir en la compra de más cosas para vender y así poder tener más clientes y más ingresos, el lugar en donde estoy instalado es muy bueno ya que es una calle por donde pasa mucha gente debido a que enfrente esta un centro comercial muy grande. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Nohemi Trinidad

texts.es:
Nohemi is a married mother of three, two of them who are still live with her. Her husband works as a security guard at a local hospital. She began her business because she needed to help to her husband with family expenses, selling shoes by catalogue. She has a small piece of land in which she cultivated walnuts and lemons initially, selling these to her neighbors. She began to sow more plants and currently she combines her shoe sales with selling produce. Her business helped give her children an education, and she wishes to continue the businesses so she can take care of her children while they live with her.

Nohemi is requesting a loan of $925 to purchase shoes and also put a down payment on a truck so she could transport her plants. She plans to repay this loan within 6 months. She and her family thank you so much for your support in helping with her business.

Translated from the original Spanish text

Nohemi esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, dos de los cuales están solteros aún, su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad en un hospital de su localidad. Ella empezó con su negocio por que tenia que ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, y empezó vendiendo zapatos por catálogo y en su terrenito sembró nogales y limones, los cuales los ofrecía entre sus vecinas y así comenzó a sembrar distinta variedad de plantas y actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y zapatos. Esto le ha ayudado para poder darles educación a sus hijos y desea continuar mientras ellos estén viviendo con sus padres.

Nohemi esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para comprar mercadería de zapatos y dar un enganche para una camioneta y poder transportar las cosas de su vivero, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase shoes and put a down payment on a truck to transport goods

loans.name: Lourdes Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lourdes is very hardworking woman. Her husband is retired, but his income is not enough to cover their family expenses. For this reason, she had to help to her husband. She was working in a company before she was laid off. With her severance pay, she bought a sewing machine and began to make some little items her neighbors, who then and then recommended her to others, and she picked up clients. Along with this, she started making uniforms for kids and masqueraD. costumes for kids for dances and special school events.

Lourdes is requesting for a loan of $650 to purchase cloth, needles and zippers to make her products. She plans to repay this loan within 6 months. She and her family are very grateful for your support.

Translated from the original Spanish text

Lourdes es una mujer muy trabajadora, su esposo esta pensionada y con estos ingresos no les era suficiente para poder cubrir sus gastos familiares, por lo que ella necesitaba ayudar a su esposo. Ella trabajaba antes y fue despedida, con su liquidación compró una máquina D. coser y empezó haciendo arreglos D. ropa entre sus vecinas, quienes la fueron recomendando y ahora ya tiene varios clientes, además D. eso ella comenzó a hacer uniformes para niños y también disfraces para eventos especiales en los colegios donD. tenía acceso por la elaboración D. dichos uniformes y por lo general son en épocas D. eventos especiales como la primavera o cuando hay bailes típicos.

Lourdes esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad D. US $ 650 para compra materia prima que consta D. telas, hilos y cierres para la elaboración D. sus productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindas para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase cloth, needles and zippers

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando is a married father of four, and only the youngest, 17, lives at home. His spouse is a housewife. To make ends meet, Fernando has provided carpentry service for the past 17 years. Fortunately, after working at a shop for a number of years, he was able to come up with enough to open his own business. His experience working with wood and his joy for his work have helped make high-quality products.

To keep growing his business, Fernando is requesting a loan of $375 to purchase needed supplies for his shop. He plans to repay the loan within three months. With your help, you can improve this family's quality of life. They are very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Fernando es casado y tiene 4 hijos, solo el más pequeño, de 17 años de edad, vive con él. Su esposa se dedica al hogar, para conseguir lo necesario para su familia Fernando ofrece sus servicios de carpintería desde hace 17 años, afortunadamente después de trabajar en un taller durante varios años, logró reunir lo suficiente para abrir su propio negocio, la experiencia que tiene en el manejo de la madera y el gusto que tiene por esta labor lo han llevado a realizar productos de muy buena calidad.

Para hacer crecer su negocio, ahora necesita de un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los materiales que requiere en su taller, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás mejorar la vida de esta familia, decídete a cooperar, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia is married and has a young son. Ever since she was little she has enjoyed making clothes. She helped her mother, who also practiced the trade. After going to school and perfecting her craft, she entered this line of work, and her dedication has helped her come up with high-quality designs. She started her business five years ago, and fortunately has been well-received by customers.

To keep her business growing, Claudia is requesting a loan of $375 to purchase fabrics, needles and sowing accessories to increase her production. She plans to repay the loan within four months. She is grateful for your support in growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Claudia es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo, desde pequeña ella ha tenido gusto por la confección de ropa, le ayudaba a su madre que se dedicaba a este oficio, después estudió y fue perfeccionando sus diseños, el gusto que siente hacia esta labor y su dedicación la han ayudado a realizar diseños de muy buena calidad, ella inició su negocio hace cinco años, afortunadamente ha tenido muy buena respuesta de sus clientes.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio, Claudia necesita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de telas, hilos y accesorios para incrementar sus diseños, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses, contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, needles and accessories

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.es:
Sandra is a widow and has four kids. Her husband died five years ago, and to keeper her family moving forward and educate her children, one of her uncles loaned her a business site, where she now makes clothing. One of her daughters helps her, and together they have been able to make the business grown. The family bond and quality of service has played a fundamental role in developing the success of this sowing shop.

Sandra is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase supplies and sowing equipment. She plans to repay the loan within five months. You can contribute to the growth of this business and the well being of Sandra and her family. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Sandra es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos. Hace cinco años falleció su esposo y para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles estudio, unos tíos de Sandra le prestaron un local en el que ahora tiene su negocio, donde confecciona y elabora ropa, en este negocio recibe la ayuda de una de sus hijas y juntas han logrado hacerlo crecer. La unión familiar y la calidad del servicio que ofrecen ha sido una pieza fundamental en el desarrollo exitoso de este taller de costura.

En estos momentos requiere de un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que utiliza en la elaboración de la ropa, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Con tu ayuda contribuyes al crecimiento de este negocio y al bienestar de Sandra y su familia, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and equipment

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a hard-working and responsible single mother of three kids, ages 18, 20 and 21. She didn't have anyone's support in raising her kids, and she had to work very hard for their well being. To cover the costs of their education, Rosa has been selling food for the past six years, and has been able to move the family forward. To meet the growing demand for her products, one of her sisters and her oldest son help out.

Rosa wants her business to keep growing, and is requesting a loan to remodel her shop so she can have larger store that is more customer-friendly. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can play a part in the growth for this business and help Rosa. She and her family are thankful for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, es madre soltera de tres jóvenes, de 18, 20 y 21 años de edad. Rosa nunca ha tenido el apoyo de nadie para sacar adelante a sus hijos, y ha tenido que esforzarse mucho pero lo hace por el bienestar de ellos. Para poder cubrir los costos de sus estudios Rosa inició con la venta de comidas desde hace seis años, de esta manera ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, para poder cubrir su creciente demanda ahora cuenta con la ayuda de una de sus hermanas y su hijo menor.

Rosa desea que su negocio continúe creciendo, para lo que solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la remodelación del local, de esta manera podrá ofrecer un lugar más amplio y agradable para sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a Rosa, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Petra

texts.es:
Petra is married and she has two children, only the youngest who is 25 years old still lives with her. Before the need to obtain an additional income, she and her husband decided to start their own business of selling groceries 11 years ago because the salary of her husband was very low and insufficient to cover all the family’s expenses and education of their children. Now, her husband has retired from his job and he helps to serve the shop. Together they have managed to keep the business going. Today, this is their only source of income. In order to improve the sales, Petra needs a loan of $650 that she will use to buy merchandise to be able to have a larger variety in their shop and offer a good service to their clients. Be part in the development of this business! This family is very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Petra es casada y tiene dos hijos, solo el más pequeño, de 25 años de edad, aún vive con ella. Hace 11 años, entre ella y su esposo decidieron iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra ya que el salario de su esposo era muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos del hogar y de la educación de sus hijos. Ahora su esposo se ha retirado de su trabajo y ayuda en la atención de la tienda. Juntos han logrado sacar adelante su negocio, éste es su única fuente de ingresos y para darle un nuevo impulso ahora Petra necesita de un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para tener n mejor surtido en su tienda y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. Se parte en el desarrollo de este negocio, esta familia agradece mucho tu colaboración.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Ana Maria Sandra

texts.es:
Ana Maria is married and she has two children, her husband works as teacher in a small school in the city Monclova in the state of Coahuila. Before the need of an additional income, Ana Maria decided to start her own business of selling groceries, in order to help her husband with the family’s expenses and the education of their small children. She first started with very few products but she has managed to increase the variety and make this business work. The desire to offer the best to her family motivates her to work hard every day. Now, Ana Maria needs a loan of $200 that she will use to buy merchandise. She is hoping to be able to cover the demand of her clients and to keep her business growing like up until now. You can help with the growth of this business. Help improve the quality of life of this family! They are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana Maria es casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo se desempeña como maestro en una pequeña escuela de la localidad de Monclova en el estado de Coahuila. Ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra Ana María decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de la educación de sus pequeños, inició con muy pocos productos pero ha logrado incrementar su variedad y sacar adelante su negocio. Los deseos de ofrecerle lo mejor a su familia la motivan a esforzarse más cada día, ahora necesita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que espera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora. En tus manos esta el crecimiento de este negocio, ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use:
Buy 
Merchandise

loans.name: Daniela Macrina

texts.es:
Daniela is from Monclova, Coahuila, she is married and she has a small son. Her husband is employed as worker at a factory, since his salary is very low they began having many economic problems. In order to help his husband with the family’s expenses, Daniela started selling footwear a year ago . She was first selling to her neighbors and relatives and little by little she has increased the number of clients. Daniela is asking for a loan of $150 to cover the demand of her growing clientele; she will use the money to buy merchandise. She will repay over a period of 3 months. You can help with the growth of this business, and the well-being this family, they are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Daniela es originaria de la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila, ella es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica, su salario es muy bajo y comenzaron a tener muchos problemas económicos, para poder ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar Daniela comenzó a vender calzado hace un año, inició entre sus vecinos y familiares y poco a poco fue ampliando su número de clientes. Para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Daniela solicita un préstamo de $ 150 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, y al bienestar esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Mrs. Lay L. and her husband (pictured here because she was busy farming when we visited) live in Phnom Penh with their newborn baby.  Lay L. is 22 years old and works part time in a garment factory, earning $2.60/day, and farming part-time on their small plot of land.  Her husband is a mototaxi driver and can earn $2.50/day.  This loan will be used to purchase a new motorbike for her husband, and to build a fence around their farmland to protect it from animals.  She hopes to have success in her farming business so that she can send her child to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and to build a fence around their farmland.

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en: Mr. Hoy S. is a clothes seller at a small market in Phnom Penh City.  He is 45 years old, and lives with his wife (pictured here at her CD stand) and their 4 children.  Hoy S.'s wife sells CDs, VCDs, and small grocery items out of their home, while 2 of their children work at private companies.  Mr. Hoy S. will use this loan to purchase more clothes and a motorcycle for transporting his goods to the market.  He is working very hard to build up enough savings to purchase a stall at the market so he doesn't have to continue making monthly rent payments.  He is confident that this loan will help him on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and a motorcycle to transport his product

payments.comment: Congratulations to Hoy Sina for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: El

texts.en: Mr. El S. O. is 63 years old and works weaving clothes near a market in Phnom Penh.  He earns $4/day in this job, and his wife operates a small grocery store out of their home which helps with the family income.  El S. O. and his wife have 6 children, 2 of whom work in a garment factory and 4 of whom are still students.  The couple spends a lot of money supporting their 4 children in schoO., and they would like to take a loan out to purchase 10 weaving machines.  The machines will be used to increase Mr. El S. O.'s business as he will be able to hire workers for each machine.  In the future, the family plans on building homes to rent to garment factory workers.

loans.use: To purchase 10 weaving machines

payments.comment: Congratulations! El Sam Ol paid back the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Mrs. Chey R. P. is a 35 year old widow living in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia.  Her business is in renting out small rooms to garment factory workers.  This gives her about $5/day of income, which is just enough to support her 1 child in school, and also her mother that lives with her.  She would like to have this loan so that she can build more rooms for renting.  This will increase her income, and she has enough free time to manage the building of the rooms, as well as managing basic landlord responsibilities.  In the future, she hopes to open a grocery shop with a large variety of products.

loans.use: To build more rooms for rental

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Chey Reaksa Phalkun has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Mrs. Say N. is 38 years old and runs a small restaurant in Phnom Penh selling mostly pork rice, porridge, and some soft drinks.  She can earn about $3/day in this business, and her husband earns $3/day working as a soldier.  Together, the couple has 2 children, 1 of whom is a student and the other an infant still.  She will use this loan to repair her kitchen and also to purchase some utensils for her restaurant.  In the future, she hopes to save enough money from her restaurant business so that she can open a grocery store.

loans.use: To repair kitchen and to purchase utensils

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 36 years old and has a small shop to sell spare parts in the industrial city of Kirkuk. He supports a big family including his father and mother. This is his first loan from AL-Aman. He wants to borrow $1200 to purchase more goods to sell in Kirkuk. He wants to develop himself and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok S. H. is 26 years old and works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh.  She lives with her husband (pictured here), a tuk tuk driver, and their 2 children.  Mrs. Sok S. H. earns $3/day and her husband earns $6/day.  This is enough income to support themselves, their children, and her two sisters.  This loan will be used to purchase a new tuk tuk for her husband so that he can continue to earn a good daily wage.  The old tuk tuk will then be rented out daily so that the family can earn additional income.  In the future, Mrs. Sok S. H. hopes to be successful enough to continue supporting her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a tuk tuk for the family business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Sok Seng Horn has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Young

texts.en: Mr. Young K. is 52 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife (pictured here) and their 2 children who are students at a local school.  Mr. Young K. works part time as a military doctor, and also with his wife at their small grocery shop.  Their combined family income is around $8/day.  This loan will be used to purchase more groceries for their shop so they can increase their inventory.  In the future, they hope that their larger grocery store will give them enough income to start a small restaurant in their home, where they can sell beef soup.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products for inventory

loans.name: Tran

texts.en: Mrs. K. is 44 yrs. old and together with her husband she lives in Ngoc Thanh commune, a rural area in Hung Yen province, approx. 50 miles south of Hanoi. They have 2 children, 24 and 18 yrs. old, who are both at school (college and university). A long time ago they realized that education is expensive in Vietnam, so they started saving. Their income is $62.50 per month and education is $80.00 per month. They have rice paddies, raise pigs, and make clothes, but their main business is making rice wine. The loan will be used to buy rice, so they can make more wine and increase their income.

loans.use: To buy more rice to make rice wine

loans.name: Abdugafur

texts.en: A. Abdugafur is a teacher with a lot of experience in his profession. He worked at a university for over 20 years. He is a very talented and clever man. He has a big family: his wife, 6 children, and 11 grandchildren. Today, Abdugafur has his own business. He has a wide assortment of books such as science, mystery, romance, educational books and dictionaries. He bought books from suppliers in Russia, Chehoslavakiya, and Kirgizistan. He has constant clients, and often they order books from Abdugafur and he is always ready meet their needs. Abdugafur loves his business and is satisfied doing it. In the future he would like to buy a new assortment of books from Russia and that’s why he is requesting $700.

loans.use: Purchase of books

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: Matluba has over 6 years of experience in the retail trade. She is married and has 3 children. She is a beautiful and cheerful person, and she loves children very much. This is why she started her business of selling interesting children’s books. The turnover of her business is fast, because her trade place is located near two schools and her little clients can buy books any time. By the developing her business she has been able to expand her assortment by adding office and school supplies. In the future Matluba would like to buy some science books for children. She is requesting $600 to buy these books.

loans.use: Purchase of children books

loans.name: Muhaio

texts.en:
Muhaio is a master of sewing in her workshop, which is located in the center of town. She was a talented girl from childhood, but her parents could not provide her with the opportunity to get a higher education. She was an assistant for an experienced designer and learned all her skills. She was able to open her own workshop in 2000. She has also taught 20 girls and helped them to find jobs.

She presently has 6 seamstresses and 4 assistants in her workshop. There are 10 sewing machines for them. Muhaio has many clients and always tries to meet their needs. Muhaio helps them to choose a modern design for their dresses. Her beautiful smile and creative nature attracts more and more new clients.

In the future, Muhaio would like to employ one more seamstress and buy a sewing machine for her.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en: When Mrs. Benedict O. heard about what LAPO is doing for the poor, she asked for their help. She needs a loan of US$750 for buying more provisions and foodstuffs to sell in her store. Mrs. Benedict is from Asaba of Delta State in Nigeria.

loans.use: Purchase of more provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Mrs. Theresa O. sells wholesale goods and has already benefited a lot from LAPO.  She is 54 years old, married, with seven children. She lives in Asaba of Delta State in Nigeria. She is asking for a loan of US$750 to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase of more wholesale provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Mrs. T. sells foodstuffs and cold drinks to the public. She needs a loan of US$250  to improve her business. That way, she hopes to be able to take better care of her family's needs, especially her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase of more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Stockfish is the people’s fish in Asaba, Nigeria. Mrs. O. Rose makes her living selling stockfish that she buys in nearby villages. She dreams of seeing her business grow, and therefore needs a loan of US$400.

loans.use: Purchase of more stockfish for sale

loans.name: Muattarhon

texts.en:
Muattarhon has a small sewing workshop in Khujand. She is married and has one pretty girl. She has a high level of education as a designer of leather clothes. She has been in this business for over 9 years. She became a client of Micro Invest in 2005. She has been able to expand her business with loans provided by Micro Invest.

As leather goods are in demand only in wintertime, Muattarhon decided to add other services to her business. These services include sewing cloaks and jackets for the spring and autumn seasons from fabrics other than leather. In the summer season she sews traditional dresses from summer fabrics, so she always has a good turnover in her business. She has many assistants who help her in her business. Muattarhon would like to use her next loan to purchase beautiful summer fabrics from China.

P.S. In the photo you can see Muattarhon, in the center, with her assistants.

loans.use: Purchase of summer fabric

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Mrs. A. Anthonia hopes to receive a loan of US$400 from LAPO to expand her restaurant business. She is proud to be associated with LAPO. She is from Asaba of Delta State in Nigeria.

loans.use: Purchase of more restaurant items

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience L. is 47 years old, married, with six (6) children. She comes from an urban area of Delta State. She has a dream of increasing the stock of goods in her store. She is therefore asking for a loan of US$750.

loans.use: Purchase of more plastics for sale

loans.name: Bui

texts.en: Mrs. T. H. is 54 years old, one year younger than her husband. They have 4 children aged from 23 to 30, the youngest of whom is going to college. She has a field with soya bean, corn, and groundnut. However, her amount of soya bean is not enough for her tofu processing business. Hence, she wants to borrow $500 to buy soya bean to make tofu every day. Additionally, she wants to buy more goods such as fish sauce, sugar, and dry noodles for her grocery. She also wants to buy 2 more pigs to raise. Despite the fact that she has to work hard, she is very happy as she can earn $62.50/month, which she never dared to dream of 5 years ago.

loans.use: To buy soya bean for her tofu processing business, more goods for her grocery, and 2 pigs

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema Mwaka K. is 25 years old. She is married and has two children.  Apart from her children, she also takes care of her aged mother and three of her sister’s children, since her sister is ailing. Rehema lives in Mlolongo town near the Mombasa-Nairobi highway. 
Rehema’s story is that of a woman with pure determination to succeed. After getting married she did not like idling around waiting for her husband to put food on her table. Therefore Rehema started off by saving Ksh 20 (about US$0.3) from every coin that her husband gave her to buy food for the day. She did it for 2 years until she managed to save Ksh 10,000 (US$150). With this money, Rehema rented a stall at Mlolongo for Ksh 1,000 a month. She then began to travel to rural areas where cereals are sold cheaply. She bought her first stock of cereals and started her sales business in year 2000. The business has been doing well, and now Rehema wants to expand it. She sees that the town is growing at a rapid rate, and therefore her supply may no longer be enough.          
Rehema is asking for a loan of US$350, so that she can purchase a weighing machine and a variety of cereals. These additions will help Rehema earn more income and enable her to better support her dependants as well as the community at large. She intends to repay the loan within a period of 8 months.

loans.use: Purchase of a weighing machine and a variety of cereals

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en: Mrs. Anekwze Amaka sells provisions and drinks to people in her community. She is 42 years, married, with children. She is from Asaba, Delta State in Nigeria. She hopes to get a loan of US$750 to expand her sales business by purchasing more provisions and drinks.

loans.use: Purchase of more provision and drinks for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Wamaitha is 29 years old. She is married and has two children aged 10 and 6. Mary has a hair salon business. She started braiding her sisters' hair when she was young and believes that she was born with this talent.  
In 2005, Mary started her business by braiding her customers' hair in their own homes, while others would come over to her house for the service. With time, her customer base grew, and Mary needed to settle in one place from where she would provide the service to the customers. 
When she started out, she only had one small mirror and one chair, both of which she bought with proceeds from her hair-braiding work. These cost her Ksh. 650 (US$10). In December 2006, Mary joined a small co-operative that was giving small loans to the youth in her area. She was able to obtain a loan of Ksh. 6,500 (US$100) which she used to buy four plastic chairs, one large mirror, some towels, and an assortment of combs. She has managed to repay the loan. However, the co-operative is unable to give Mary more funds -the maximum amount she could access was Ksh. 10,000 (US$155). Mary still needs financial help, since, with the equipment that she has, she is not able to wash and straighten hair. She wishes to provide a complete service to her customers, also in order to help them save the time that they use by going to another salon that is far away. 
Mary is asking for a loan Of US$550 which will be repayable within a period of 12 – 18 months. With this loan Mary will be able to acquire some equipment for her salon, including a hair drier, a steamer, a blow drier, and hair chemicals.

loans.use: Purchase of a hair drier, hair steamer, blow drier and hair chemicals

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 57 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in Ruai town, in the outskirts of Nairobi, Kenya. Leonard started his hardware shop in 2003 when he retired. He had previously worked as a salesman with three of the top food and other manufacturing companies in Kenya, namely East African Industries, Warner Company, and Proctar and Allan. 
While in employment, Leonard was saving money with one of the Sacco Societies in Kenya called Jitegemee Saving and Credit. After retiring, he pulled together his resources and started a hardware shop with a capital of Ksh 200,000 (US$2,860). His wife who works with Kenya Polytechnic, a technical institute in Kenya, lent him a part of this capital. Leonard started out by renting a small stall by the roadside of the main Ruai – Kangundo road. Unfortunately, the Ministry of Works demolished his shop along with other structures located near the road. This significantly affected his business, but he did not lose hope. Within three months, Leonard was able to rent another shop that has been operating ever since.  
In the recent past, Leonard has been having difficulties in fulfilling his customers’ demands that are increasing day by day because of his fair pricing of goods. By making purchases from his shop, his customers save a lot of time, since, otherwise, they would have to go all the way to Nairobi in order to purchase the same goods. Leornard is therefore asking for a loan of US$350 which he will use to purchase more stock for his hardware shop, including items like jikos (traditional cooking stoves), plastic basins, sufurias (cooking pots), spades, etc. These are items that are in very high demand; therefore, their acquisition will make a big difference for the community that Leonard is supplying. The loan will also help improve the condition for Leonard's children, his aging mother and mother in law who depend on him. He plans to employ two helpers from the community to assist in day-to-day running of the shop. The repayment period for his loan will be 8 -14 months.

loans.use: Purchase of stock for a hardware shop

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence W. is a 41-year-old man; he is married and has 3 children. He is also taking care of his niece whose mother passed away and of his brother who was crippled by polio. He helps the Saidia Furaha Children’s home and teaches them tailoring skills.          
After finishing secondary school, Lawrence enrolled at Kiti Nakuru training center in the Rift Valley Province of Kenya where he took a Diploma course in clothing and textiles for 4 years. After completion of this course, he went back to his rural home to do farming due to lack of money and other employment opportunities. He worked very hard at his parents’ farm, but later decided to move back to Nairobi in search of other work. He managed to land a job in a tailoring shop at Kitengela, a town in the outskirts of Nairobi, where he worked for one year. He was later employed at the Saidia Furaha Children’s home as an instructor of tailoring. From the salary he was getting he managed to save Ksh 20,000.00 (US$330) and to start his own textile shop while still working at the children’s home. Lawrence has a loving heart and decided to voluntarily work for the children’s home, which he still does today. 
Lawrence needs a loan of US$700 to expand his business. The loan will enable him to purchase a stock of cloth materials, lining and binding materials, zips, buttons, etc. for his textiles shop. He will also employ people from his community, thus creating employment. Lawrence will also be able to help fund the children’s home and serve his customers more efficiently. The repayment period for this loan will be 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of stock for a textiles shop - cloth, lining materials, zips, buttons, etc.

payments.comment: Funds have been returned. See Journal for details

loans.name: Tran

texts.en: Mrs. Tran T. L. is 39 years old, her husband is 40, and they have two children aged 13 and 10. Both of them are going to school, so each school year they have to spend about $188 on education expenses. That is why they try to do everything farmers can, including working in the field and raising livestock (pigs, chickens, swans and ducks). Besides the farming, her husband manages a rice-milling machine, and she makes rattan and bamboo products. She always has to get up at 5:00 am and only goes to bed at 11:00 pm. Nevertheless, their profit is just $50/month. Thinking that their income can hardly support their life in the future, she has decided to borrow $325 to buy and raise 5 breeding pigs and mash for them. Hopefully, their efforts will produce more income in the future.

loans.use: To buy 5 breeding pigs and food for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of medical items, including blood pressure machine, glucometer, trays and drugs

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Mr. Patrick E. has a chemist shop where he sells drugs for the treatment of patients. He hopes to get $450 to expand his business by buying more inventory.

loans.use: To buy more medicine

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Mrs. Gloria E. is 38 years and is married with three children. She has a chemist store where she sells drugs and treatment to people. She worth N150, 000 good and needs $450 to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more drugs

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia E. is a business woman who owns a store where she sell baby clothes and other items. She hopes to get an additional loan of $750 for business growth.

loans.use: To buy more baby things

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice K. is married with four children and hails from a suburban area of the Edo State in Nigeria. She is a fashion designer who designs clothes for people and is eager to borrow $25 to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence T. sells palm oil, bags of rice and food ingredients. She is from Benin City, in the Edo state of Nigeria. She is interested borrowing $725 to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil, rice and other food ingredients

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice O. is a woman of great dignity who is 38 years and married with 2 children.  She has a business worth of N200,000 and lives in an urban area of Edo State in Nigeria.  She hopes to increase her inventory with a loan of $750.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and baby items for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy J. is 43 years woman who is happily married with four children.  She is a businesswoman who travels to different states in Nigeria to buy clothes for sale and is eager to get a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and baby things for sale

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Mrs. Rosemary Uhumawgie sells baby items and shoes in the market. She is eager to borrow $450 for business expansion. The worth of her business is N150, 000.

loans.use: To buy more baby items & shoes for sale

loans.name: Osawe

texts.en: Mrs. Osawe J. is 37 years old with five children.  She specializes in sales of tailoring materials in the market, a business she started in 1993. She is from Benin City, in the Edo state of Nigeria. She said her business will improved tremendously if she can get a loan of $450 to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: David

texts.en: Mr. David O. is married with three children. He is 38 years old and a LAPO client. He is delighted to have a chemist shop and sell drugs and medicine. He is looking to borrow $450 to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Osaretin

texts.en: Mr. Osaretin M. is an LAPO member who has a small shop and hopes to expand the shop and his inventory of goods as well. He needs additional funds to increase his inventory, he says. He is 40 years old.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. is computer literate and owns a computer center that provides typesetting and photocopying services. She currently has a small shop but hopes to enlarge it with funds from the loan.

loans.use:
to buy additional computers and a
photocopying machine

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience E. is 36 years old and is a mother of two children.  She is a dedicated LAPO client.  She sells ice cream to support her husband in caring for the family.  The loan is intended to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and more ice cream flavours

loans.name: Geogina

texts.en: Mrs. Geogina I. is 46 years old.  She lives in Benin City in Nigeria,  where she sells her goods to people in her community. She is married and has five children. She is a dedicated client of LAPO.  According to her, if provided with a loan of $450, her business will improve.

loans.use: to buy provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Agenla

texts.en: Mrs. A. is from Edo in Nigeria.  She says, "A & A Boutique is the name of my boutique because people like calling me Mrs. A."  She sell ladies' clothing.  She is requesting the loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy ladies wears provisions and drinks

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Business Description

Angela sells water bottles and soda to residences. She started this business with the help of her brother who lent her start-up money. Right now she not only delivers water to residences but she also delivers to local shops and restaurants.

Loan Use

Angela intends to use the loan to purchase soda and water bottles at wholesale. With the profits she expects to attain, she will achieve one of her life’s goals: the improvement of her home.

Personal Information

She is 50 years old and lives with a daughter who is a single mother. Her principal goal is to build her house with quality materials and secure a great education for her grandchild.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Ángela se dedica a la venta de botellones de agua y gaseosas a domicilio. Este negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su hermano quien le presto el capital para emprender el negocio. Actualmente no solo entrega el agua a domicilio sino que además entrega a tiendas y restaurantes de la zona.

Uso del Préstamo

Ángela usara el préstamo para comprar las gaseosas y botellones de agua al por mayor pues con las ganancias que esta segura obtendrá va a mejorar su vivienda que es uno de los objetivos que se ha planteado.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 50 años, su vivienda es mixta vive con una hija que es madre soltera. Su principal meta es construir su casa de mejores materiales que los de ahora y asegurar una buena educación para su nieto.

loans.use: Purchase beverages at wholesale

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Business Description

Don Lorenzo has a grocery store where he also sells other basic necessities, in a business area and on a main street. He began his business with some money that his wife sent him from abroad, where she has been for three years now.

Loan Use

Don Lorenzo will use this loan to purchase more merchandise on wholesale and continue to invest in his store so that he can improve it and attract more customers.

Personal Information

Don Lorenzo is 45 and has three children who all go to school. He lives in a cement-built home. He has the firm conviction that with the improvements he will make in his store, he will bring in more customers. With the increase in customers, he will be able to better assure the future of his family and he will be able to bring his wife home to live with them again.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Descripción del Negocio

Don Lorenzo tiene una tienda donde vende víveres y artículos de primera necesidad en un sector muy comercia y en calle principal. Este negocio lo empezó con un dinero que le envío su esposa que está en el exterior hace tres años. /p>

Uso del Préstamo

Don Lorenzo usará el préstamo para comprar más mercadería al por mayor y así poder seguir realizando inversiones en el negocio y pronto incrementarlo de tal manera que pueda tener más clientes

Información Personal

Él tiene 45 años y tres hijos que estudian su casa es de cemento. Lorenzo tiene la firme convicción que con las mejorar que haga en su negocio su clientela aumentara y así podrá asegurar el futuro de su familia y en un momento dado su esposa pueda regresar para estar juntos nuevamente

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and other products.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Business Description

Mauro sells fresh fruits from a stand in front of his home. He began his business with some money that his son loaned him. Today, Mauro sells fruits from the coast and the sierra and also those that are in season and occassionally those requested by his customers as well.

Loan use

Mauro needs to purchase more fruits and is considering purchasing them on wholesale because this would allow him to make more money. Furthermore, Mauro has an opportunity to construct a store within his home, which means he could keep more fruits fresh and clean while he displays them.

Personal Information

Mauro is 40 years old and has one son who lives with him. His home is made of reed. His main goal is to be able to build a house made of cement and to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

Mauro se dedica a al venta de frutas frescas en un sitio adecuado frente a su casa. Mauro empezó el negocio con un dinero que le prestó su hijo. Actualmente Mauro vende frutas de costa y sierra y las que están de temporada y que además son solicitadas pro sus clientes /p>

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita comprar mas frutas y ahora tiene pensado comprarlas al por mayor pues así va a tener mas ganancias. Además Mauro tiene la oportunidad de construir un local en su casa y así poder exponer la fruta y tenerla mas limpia y fresca

Información Personal

El tiene 40 años y un hijos que vive con el, su casa es de caña. Su principal meta es construir su casa de cemento y progresar en el negocio

loans.use: To purchase fruits on wholesale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
CARMEN A. C.

Doña Carmen is a member of the group "Fountain of Running Water" or "Fuente de Agua Viva." She was born in 1970 and is 37 years old. She had wanted to go to school as a child, but her parents believed that women are not meant to study. The only thing she was allowed to do was to cook, because the only thing her parents believed a woman should do is marry, have children and take care of her family.

However, thanks to the help of her older sister, she was able to graduate with a degree in Secretary and Office work when she was 19. She then met her husband, Roman Diaz who was 38. She has 3 children with him, the oldest who is 12, the second 9 and the youngest 7. They live with her in the neighborhood "Colonia El Rosario." She and her husband bought some land and built a small home there, where they run their own business. Currently, she needs a small loan in order to support her business of selling chicken and drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

CARMEN A. C. Doña Carmen pertenece al grupo fuente de agua viva, nació en el año 1970 actualmente cuenta con 37 años de edad, quiso estudiar en su infancia pero los papás le decían que las mujeres no son para estudiar, sino que solo para la cocina, porque se casan y tienen que mantener a sus hijos y su esposo. Pero gracias a una hermana mayor que ella la ayudó y le apoyó con sus estudios hasta graduarse de Secretaria y Oficinista a los 19 años. Luego conoció a su esposo Román Díaz de 38 años, con él tuvieron 3 hijos el primero de 12 años, el segundo de 9 años y el tercero de 7 años, vivían en la Colonia El Rosario con la mamá. y luego compraron un terrenito y construyeron una casita donde tienen su pequeño negocio, Ahora cuenta con un pequeño negocio adicional a la venta de pollo y refresquería.

loans.use: Sales of Chicken (meat).

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores is an enterprising woman, she is married and has four children. Her husband is retired and the pension he receives is not enough to cover all of their bills. To make some extra money, Dolores began helping a neighbor with her cosmetic sales. When she noticed that her own sales were good and that her customers kept growing, she decided to go into business for herself. In this way, she is able to help pay for the household expenses.

In order to satisfy her customers' requests, Dolores is applying for a loan of $250 that she will use to purchase more merchandise. She is ready to re-pay this amount in 3 months. With your contribution, you can help this family and help improve this growing business. Dolores and her family thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Dolores es una mujer muy trabajadora, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo está jubilado y con el ingreso que reciben de la pensión no podían cubrir todas sus necesidades, para obtener un ingreso extra, Dolores inició ayudándole a una vecina con la venta de cosméticos, al ver que obtenía buenas ganancias y que sus clientes se incrementaban, decidió vender por su cuenta y de esta manera ayudar a su familia con los gastos.

Para poder cubrir todos los pedidos de sus clientes, Dolores solicita un préstamo de $250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda mejoraras la vida de esta familia, contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Dolores y su familia te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela is married and has two small children. Her husband is a labourer, nevertheless, his salary is not enough to cover all of their household expenses. Because of this lack of funds, Gabriela began to sell cosmetics by catalog 6 years ago. At first, one of her neighbors helped her, but afterwards, Gabriela decided to work alone. Little by little, the number of her customers has grown and she has seen her earnings increase as well.

Today, Gabriela is applying for a loan of $200 which she will re-pay in 3 months. With this loan, she will be able to purchase more merchandise and be able to offer a better service to her customers and continue to see her business grow. You can be a part of the success of this business and the dreams of Gabriela, do not hesitate and decide to loan today.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Gabriela es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, su esposo es obrero, sin embargo, el salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar, ante esta necesidad Dolores inició con la venta de cosméticos por catálogo desde hace seis años, primero le ayudaba a vender a una de sus vecinas, depuse decidió independizarse y vender por su cuenta poco a poco ha estado ganando más clientes y ha incrementado de manera significativa sus ventas.

En estos momentos, Gabriela solicita un préstamo de $200 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 3 meses, con esto planea comprar mercancía para poder ofrecer sus clientes un buen servicio y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora. Tú puedes ser parte de este negocio, y de los sueños de Gabriela, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio is originally from the area of Monclova, in the state of Coahuila. He is married and lost his job one year ago because of downsizing. It was very difficult to find another job and facing the need to make money to support his family, Gregorio began to sell shoes by catalog. Thanks to his good business sense and his own personality, he is easily able to establish relationships with others and has seen the number of his customers rise.

To meet his customers' demand for his products, Gregorio is applying for a loan of $150 which he will use to purchase merchandise. He is ready to re-pay this loan in 3 months. With your contribution, you can help the lives of Gregorio and his family and help improve the growth of this business, thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Gregorio es originario de la localidad de Monclova, en el estado de Coahuila, él es casado y hace un año perdió su empleo por recorte de personal, le fue muy difícil encontrar otro trabajo y ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso que le permitiera salir adelante con su familia Gregorio inició con la venta de calzado por catálogo, desde hace un año. Gracias a su gusto por las ventas y su carácter que le facilitan relacionarse con los demás, ha logrado incrementar su número de clientes.

Para poder cubrir la demanda por sus productos, Gregorio solicita un préstamo por $ 150 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, él está dispuesto a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes mejorar la vida de Gregorio y su familia, contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin O. is 59 years old and runs a small grocery stand out of her home in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia.  She lives with her husband, who helps with her business, and their one child who is a student.  This loan will be used to purchase more grocery products to invest in her store.  In the future, she hopes to continue building the inventory of her store, and also build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for her store

payments.comment: Congratulations to Chin Oeu for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She wants to buy goods for her grocery such as draught beer, bottled beer and sweets.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Mr. Khim V. is 54 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and their 5 children.  He works producing and selling palm sugar, earning about $2/day.
