Four of his children work in a garment factory, and use their wages to help contribute to the family income.  This loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle so Mr. Khim V. can easily transport a large amount of his product to the market.  In the future, he would like to continue storing more and more sugar that he can sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport their sugar to and from the market

loans.name: Meng

texts.en: Mrs. Meng E. is 45 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 3 children.  Mrs. Meng E. sells vegetables at the market and earns $3.50/day, while her husband earns $3/day working as a construction foreman.  Mrs. Meng E. would like to use this loan to purchase a trailer for her husband to transport people around the city.  She knows there is a large demand for this service, and it will be a good business for her husband when he is not busy with a construction contract.  In the future, she hopes to save money from the family's business so that she can send her children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for their motorbike in order to transport passengers

payments.comment: Congratulations to Meng Eang for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng H. is 35 years old and lives in Pray Veng Province with her husband and their 5 children.  Mrs. Seng H. and her husband work together farming their small plot of land, and together they earn $5/day.  Three of their children repair bicycles, and the other two are students.  This loan will be used to purchase seeds for the family's small plantation, and also to purchase some wood to repair their house so it doesn't leak during heavy rains.

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair house and to purchase seeds for their plantation

payments.comment: Congratulations to Seng Hoeung for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs. Vann L. H. is 21 years old and lives in Pray Veng with her husband (pictured here with a pig cage on the back of his moto) and their infant child.  They work together purchasing and raising pigs.  When the time comes and the pigs are mature, they sell them to the market.  This business gives them about $3/day of income on average, although it depends on the size of the pigs and the market rate when they come to maturity.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Vann L. H. to purchase more pigs.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Mrs. Ung V. is a 43 year old widow living in Prey Veng, and working as a farmer.  She mostly raises pigs, but also grows a small number of crops.  She earns only $1/day from her farming activities, but knows she can do better if she has enough capital to purchase more pigs for raising.  She has 4 children, all of whom work.  Two work in a garment factory and two work as security guards.  They all help to support their family by pooling their wages together.  Mrs. Ung V. will use this loan to purchase more pigs for raising and eventually selling to the market.  In the future, she hopes to continue with this business because she is confident it will increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Phil

texts.en: Mrs. Phil P. is 29 years old and operates a small grocery stand out of her house in Phnom Penh.  She can earna bout $3/day from this business, while her husband earns $2/day working at a factory.  Together, they have 3 small children that they support.  Mrs. Phil P. wil use this loan to purchase grocery products to invest in her store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products

loans.name: Mout

texts.en: Mrs. Mout P. is 46 years old and lives in Kampong Chnang, Cambodia with her husband and their 5 children.  She works selling beef and chicken on the roadside, and can earn $3/day from this business.  Her husband sells fish in a nearby market and can earn $2-3/day.  Two of their five children still attend school, while the other three have been fortunate enough to get jobs.  One works in construction and the other two at a local garment factory.  Mrs. Mout P. will use this loan to buy more beef and chicken for her restaurant, and also to buy a plot of land where she can grow some vegetables.  In the future, she hopes to purchase more land so that she can expand her crop production.

loans.use: To purchase more beef, chicken, and a plot of land to grow crops

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Mout Phut has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Siv

texts.en: Mrs. Siv A. is a 31 year old widow living in Kampong Chnang with her mother and her child.  She runs a small grocery stand that is incredibly busy, bringing in $38/day in revenue.  It is hard to calculate her daily profits, but it is around $5/day which is enough to support herself, her child, and her mother.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Siv to purchase more grocery products.  In the future, she hopes to continue accessing loans so that she can grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Siv Ankeary has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mrs. Yun S. Y. is 37 years old and operates a small grocery stand with her husband in Kampong Chnang, Cambodia.  Together, they have 1 child who goes to school every day.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Yun to purchase more grocery products for their store.  In the future, she hopes to continue growing her business and eventually dreams of becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Yun Sok Yeng has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Keit

texts.en: Mr. Keit S. is 20 years old and works as a farmer in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia.  He tends to a large plot of land, and has had considerable success with his harvest so far--earning about $3/day on average.  He will use this loan to purchase a tractor for harvesting his crops.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor for harvesting his crops

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Keit Sochea has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S. is 27 years old and lives with her husband (pictured here) and their 2 children in Kampong Chnang.  Mrs. Chea S. works part time selling rice and other basic Khmer dishes at a small roadside stand, and part time with her husband selling the products that he carves.  The couple also supports Mrs. Chea's mother and sister who sometimes stay with them.  This loan will be used to purchase more stone and stone carving tools for their business. In the future, Mrs. Chea S. hopes to stop her food selling business so she can focus entirely on the stone carving business with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more stone and carving tools to operate their business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S. P. is 48 years old and lives in Kampong Chnang with her husband who is 67 years old. They have no children.  Mrs. Chea sews pillow cases and sells them to the market. Her husband uses similar material as his wife to produce hammocks.  They will use this loan to purchase some thread for their products, and also to buy a plot of land to start growing some crops.  In the future, Mrs. Chea S. P. hopes to expand her business and eventually hire a few workers to help in production.

loans.use: To purchase thread and a plot of land to grow crops

loans.name: Roth

texts.en: Mrs. Roth K. S. is 47 years old. She is a commune officer. Her husband is a construction  worker. Their revenue is about $4.00 per day. They have 5 children, three of whom are still students and two of whom work at a garment factory. The father travels by public transportation to his job every day. But this is expensive for him and it takes a long time. This is why he needs a motor-bike, as he will be able to go to work easily, and save money as a result of this investment.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike for her husband to travel to his work without taking public transportation.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Roth Kim Sean start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Phov

texts.en: Mrs. Phov K. is 25 years old.  She sells pigs at the market with her husband, who is 27 years old.  They have one child.  Their revenue reaches 5 dollars per day.  They want to expand their business by operating another stand.  To attain this goal, she needs to buy more pigs. This investment will allow them to increase their everyday income.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to increase her business revenue

payments.comment: Phov Kunna has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. Khun Y. is 35 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and five children in Prey veng province, Cambodia. She makes her living by working at a nearby garment factory and typically makes around $3/day.  Her husband is employed as a teacher.  Two of her children also work at the garment factory and the rest of them attend school. Currently, Khun Y. is requesting a loan of $700 to repair her house to prrevent leaking during the rainy season.

loans.use: to repair her house to prevent leaking during the rainy season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She wants to purchase a car for her husband, who is a taxi driver.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch P. is 28 years old.  She sells souvenir products near a temple. Her husband is 33 years old and is a construction foreman. They have two children. Their combined income is 10 dollars per day.  Mrs. Touch P. wants to purchase a motorbike for her husband, who needs to travel far everyday for work.  In the future, she wants to expand her souvenir business.

loans.use: She wants to purchase a motorbike to allow her husband to commute more easily to work.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Touch Phea start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Mrs. Phin K. is a 38 year old woman who makes khmer noodles to sell to retailers. Her husband is a gardener at a hotel. Their combined income reaches 15 dollars a day.  They have one child, who is a student.  Mrs Phin K. needs a loan to repair her house.  In the future, she would like to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to repair her house

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Phin Kung start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Chab

texts.en: Chab K. is a 50 year old widow and lives with her two children in the Siem Reap province in Cambodia.  Chab K. sells porridge, pork and beef rice to the people in her area and makes about $5/day in revenue. Meanwhile, one of her children helps to support the household by selling a variety of souvenir products near a temple.  Her other child is a carpenter. Currently, Chab K. is asking for a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a stand so that her daughter can properly sell her souvenir products to tourists.  In the future, if she saves enough money, she would like to expand her daughter's business by adding more attractive products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.use: to purchase a stand for her daughter to sell a variety of souvenir products

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Scorn S. is a widow who is 29 years old. Shelives in Siem Reap. She makes baskets and sells them near a temple. Her income reaches 5 USD a day. She has two children and has to take care of them alone. She wants to increase her revenue by expanding her business, which is why she is requesting a loan to purchase tools.

loans.use: to purchase tools to make baskets

payments.comment: Congratulations to Sorn Sek for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
A. Anvar began his business selling goods that were useful for the local ecomony: building studs, paint enamel, building mixture, lacquer, and so on. One of his most popular goods was polyethylene tape. When MicroInvest began working in his region, he approached them for a loan $5000 to build his business. But MicroInvest did not loan such amounts, as there was no individual crediting at that time. 
He took out a loan of $400 from MicroInvest, which he put into building his shop. But he did not forget about his idea and borrowed money from relatives to start producing polyethylene tape. 
Today, he would like to increase production of polyethylene tape to meet the demands of repeat clients. The loan will enable him to purchase raw materials required. The loan sum is $1200.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs Som S. is 31 years old. She works as a laundress. Her husband is a construction foreman. They have 5 children and their combined revenue is around 6 dollars per day. She has applied for a loan to purchase tools to repair their home.

loans.use: To purchase tools to repair her home

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Som Sameit start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: A trader who sells wholesale bags of rice and beans at the market, Mrs. Itohan I. has been in business for five years now. She hopes to expand her shop with this loan. She is 45 years old and married with three children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and beans

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: "LAPO has rained on me," says Mrs. Philomina E., who is happily married with a child and lives in an urban area of Edo State. She sells provisions in her shop and hopes to expand her shop and her business as well. In her store, she has goods worth N250,000 (Naira). She needs additional funds to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Moy

texts.en: Mrs. Moy Y. is the mother of 3 children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is 32 years old and makes her living selling fish at a nearby market where she earns around $4 per day. Her husband is a fisherman and makes on average about $4 per day. One of her children is enrolled primary school, while the rest are too young to attend school at the moment. Moy Y. needs a motorbike to help transport her fish from and to the market. In the future, she would like to save enough money to purchase fishing nets, and other tools to help her husband's fishery.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle to take her to the fish market

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs Seng R. is a 45 year old housewife. Her husband is a carpenter and earns around 1 dollar per day. They have 6 children. Three of them work in a big groceR. store. Mrs Seng R. needs a motorcycle to take her children to their workplace or to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: A LAPO group leader, Mrs. Eunice O. is 38 years old.  She started her business in1993. She is a popular seller in her quarters in Nigeria. She plans to improve her business with the loan amount.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Amen

texts.en: A mother of six  (6) children, Mrs. Amen I. is a distributor of provisions and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in the business for four (4) years. She is looking forward to getting this loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two electric razors, two chairs, and three mirrors

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Suy R. is 47, married and the mother of 5 children. She lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia and stays at home cooking meals and looking after her children. Her husband works as a construction foreman and makes around $5 per day.  Three of her children work at a garment factory, and two are students. Suy R. wants a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband, so that he can reduce the amount he spends on public transportation every month.

loans.use: To purcase a motorcycle for her husband, to decrease the amount spent on public transport every month.

payments.comment:
Thanks to the successful of her business that is why she can pay off the loan a head of time.
She would like to say thank deeply from her heart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wool and two weaving combs

loans.name: Chab

texts.en: Mrs Chab P. is a widow of 35 years old. She is a grocer and her income reaches 6 dollars per day. She has 3 children and she has to take care of them alone. She needs a motorcycle to ensure her family transportation. In the future, she wants to expand her grocery by increasing her range of products.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family transportation

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Chab Pheap start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Mrs Lim L. is 33 years old. She does not work but takes care of her five children who are still at school. Her husband is a taxidriver. Their income from this is around 10 dollars a day. She and her husband want to buy a car to expand the taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a car for her husband who is a taxidriver.

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Lim Lin and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Emeka

texts.en: Mrs. Emeka A. is 53 years old and married with eight children. She lives in a semi-urban area of Edo State, Nigeria, and sells wrappers and baby things.  She is requesting the sum of $450.

loans.use:
To buy more women's wrappers and baby
things

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: "I am delighted to be selling provisions and drinks," says Mrs. Grace E. about a business she started three years ago. She is 55 years old and married with six children. She is optimistic that her business will improve if given the sum  of $450.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is a talented and experienced designer. She is famous in Khujand town. She has her own workshop and has a lot of assistants. Her products are very beautiful and are of a high quality. Her business consists of buying variety types of fabrics and creating modern dresses for the market. The turnover of her business is fast and she is satisfied with the way her business is running. She became a client of Micro Invest in 2004 and has always repaid her loans on time. 
Matluba is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a teacher. Her elder daughter is a student. After lessons she comes to workshop to help her mother.  Modern embroidery is very popular this summer season in Khujand and she wants to take advantage of this and to purchase one embroidery machine for her daughter.

loans.use: Purchase of machines

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Mrs. Itohan U. is 40 years old and married with four children. She started benefiting from a LAPO loan in 2000. She plans to increase her stock (provisions) if granted the loan.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sales

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
M. Gulbahor is married and has 3 children. She is a very talented and creative person. She  has over 17 years experience in embroidery/fancywork.
She became known in Khujand when she exhibited her first collection of embroidered national dresses at a national   exhibition in 2000 and took first place; after that she received many proposals from theatres, dressmaking and tailoring establishments who were interested in long term partnerships.
Today she has her own sewing workshop with 3 modern embroidery machines, 4 sewing and 2 looping machines.
Gulbahor plans to spend her next loan to purchase modern summer fabrics for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of modern fabrics

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Mrs. Juliet I. is 40 years old and married with two children. She started benefiting from a LAPO loan in 2004. She plans to increase her stock (provisions) if granted the loan.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sales

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: "I like the timber business because it fetches me money and I hope to expand the business if I have additional funds," says Mrs. Janet I.. She hails from Edo State in Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more timber woods for sales

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Mrs. Kemi S. is a 30 year-old woman, married with three (3) children, and living in the semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She learnt her trade business for one year before she started her business in the year 2000. She is eager to access the loan amount to acquire more goods for sales.

loans.use: To buy more plastics and provisions

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: A 32 year-old woman, Mrs. Maria I. learnt the trade of selling provisions and drinks for one year before she started her own business in the year 2002. She is married with a child and living in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She says if she gets the amount of $400, she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, provisions, and food items

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: "Oil milling is my job. I learnt it from my mother and am happy doing this work for the community. Because of my job, people in my community are happy," says Mrs. Mabel A.. She is 41 years old, married with five children, and hopes to get additional money for the business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts for oil production

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith E. is 32 years old, married with three children, and sells foodstuffs for the public. She is eager to expand her business with an additional loan amount.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Sawing and selling wood is a good business for Mrs. Queen E. and she needs much funds for the business. She has zeal for expanding her business and that is why she needs funds. She hails from a semi-urban area of Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy additional machinery and wood to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia E. hails from Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells food items to the public in her shop, which she hopes to expand. She is 30 years old and married with five children. She is looking forward to receiving funds for business growth.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Osaro

texts.en: A mother of seven (7) children, Mrs. Osaro A. is a distributor of provisions and she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in the business for five years. She is looking forward to getting this loan to improve her business

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. is 37 years old, married with five children and lives in a  semi-urban area of Benin City. She spent six months learning her trade and how to run a business at other companies before opening her own shop in 1998. She is seeking a loan to acquire more goods to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane E. is a beautiful 43-year-old woman who lives with her husband and six children. She has been a LAPO client for the last six years, and during that time has proved to be a skilled and effective businesswoman.  She runs a store that sells building materials, and has come to us for a loan of $750 to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more building materials

loans.name: Oyakhire

texts.en: Oyakhire A. is a trained electrician who runs a small business repairing freezers. He is married and lives in Benin City with his wife and one child. He is seeking a loan of $750 to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Azet

texts.en: Azet G. lives in Ashigli village of the Beylagan region. She is 50 years old, and works at the secondary school in Ashigli village. But she is also engaged in cattle breeding. She is a client of Normicro Beylagan Branch. She has borrowed four loans totaling $1900. She bought three cows with these loans, and sells the milk of her cows at the Beylagan bazaar. She wants to increase the number of cows, and so she now needs $900 to buy two cows.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Tutu

texts.en: Tutu P. lives in Ashigli village of the Beylagan region. She is engaged in cattle breeding. At first, she had a one cow, and then she borrowed four loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch totaling $2000. This allowed her to buy cows and she increased the number of her cows to 5 from 2003 to 2006. These loans help her to increase her family income. Her brother helps her in her job. Now she wants to buy one cow and needs a loan in the amount of $900.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Ramziyya

texts.en: Ramziyya I. lives in Ashigli village in the Beylagan region. She is 40 years old. Ramziyya is engaged in cattle breeding, and her brother helps her. She has been a client of Normicro since 2003. She has received four loans totaling $2000 from 2003-2006. She bought two cows with these loans. Now she needs $900 to buy 2 cows.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Mehriban

texts.en: Mehriban K. lives in Beylagan. She is married and has 3 children. She is engaged in selling women's, men's, and children's clothing. She established her business five years ago, and owns a small market in the middle of Beylagan.  She buys the clothes she sells from Baku city, where she goes two times a week. But she can’t buy more kinds of goods, because she hasn't got much money. Therefore, she would like to receive a loan from Normicro Beylagan Branch to expand her business. She needs $500 to buy more kinds of goods.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.en: Hikmat E. is single, and lives in Beylagan. Hikmat owns a butcher shop in Beylagan, which he established two years ago. He sells beef and sheep meat. He buys sheep and cows at the animal market in Beylagan and sells the meat in his butcher shop. His brother helps him in this business. Hikmat borrowed a loan in the amount of $300 from Normicro Beylagan Branch in 2006 and bought some sheep, and made a lot of profit selling them. Now he wants to borrow a loan in the amount of $500 to buy more sheep and to sell the meat at his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila G. lives in Beylagan. She is married and she has 3 children. She is engaged in trading, and has a market near her home. Jamila sells fruits and vegetables, and her husband helps her in her job. He buys fruits and vegetables and Jamila sells them at her market. But they haven't got much money to buy more kinds of goods. Jamila is a client of Normicro Beylagan Branch. She borrowed a loan in the amount of $300 in 2005 and 2006 and expanded her business. Now she needs a loan in the amount $500 to increase her daily selling.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en: For Sanobar, who has secondary education, there is no permanent source of income, as she does not work anywhere. She is 31, is married and has 2 children. Her husband went to Russia for work. She has been engaged in small business for several years already. It enables her to feed her family. Her assortment of wares includes footwear for children and teenagers. She came to MicroInvest 2 years ago and having received the first loan, has spent it on increasing the quantity of the goods she sells. At present she wishes to receive the loan for future expansion of her business. Sanobar would now like to sell more expensive and high quality summer footwear.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en: Marcel  Chuckwu spent five years learning the basics of business from others before opening his own company in 1996.  He is 42 years old, married and lives with his wife and four children in Benin City.  He is confident that he can expand his business, and has come to us for a loan of $750 to make that expansion possible.

loans.use: To buy more materials to sell

loans.name: Lemuel

texts.en: Jeffery Lemuel has built a very successful business selling and repairing air conditioners and refrigerators. Eager to continue expanding his company, this thirty-two-year-old entrepreneur has come to us for a loan to make his dream possible.

loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. runs a very successful shop from which she sells groundnut oil, palm oil and bags of rice. She is 37 years old, married and lives with her husband and seven children in Benin City. She is seeking a loan to expand her business and buy more oil and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.use:
To buy more groundnut oil, palm oil &
 wholesale rice

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. runs a small shop from which she sells provisions and bags of clean drinking water. She is 37 years old, married and has three children. She would like to buy more merchandise and drinks to sell to her customers, and has come to LAPO for a loan to make that possible.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand charcoal business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her milk bar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his fruit selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand timber and fruit businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase stock of fruit

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie O. sells beverages and bags of pure drinking water to her customers. She is 37 years old, married and has three children. She has applied for a loan which she would like to use to buy additional drinks and water to sell from her shop.

loans.use:
To buy more drinks and bags of pure water
 for sale

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
I have few things in my home. My husband and I are in charge of covering the expenses. We have two children whom my mother-in-law takes care of at home. We work almost the entire day and are saddled with the children's bills. I'm requesting a loan of $1,200 for new front door, so we're safer and the children can't run out as easily.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo poco que adquirí me casa, entre mi esposo y yo somos los que nos encargamos de los gastos, tenemos 2 hijo los cuales los cuida mi suegra en la casa. Casi todo el día trabajamos y estamos con el pendiente de los niños. Estoy solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 DLLS para el portón de enfrente y así estar más seguros los niños que no se salgan.

loans.use: Put up an iron door

loans.name: Dubersa

texts.es:
We bought land more than two years ago, but with family expenses we have not been able to build. I'm requesting a loan of $1,000 to begin construction on the land, so we can have our own house and don't have to pay rent. Our family is growing and they need to be secure in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Tenemos más de 2 años que adquirimos el terreno pero por gastos familiares no hemos podido construir. Estoy solicitando un préstamo de 1,000.00 dlls. Para empezar a construcción, en el terreno para tener nuestra propia casa, y dejar de pagar renta. Ya que tenemos más familia y necesitan estar seguros para un futuro.

loans.use: Build a room

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: building ready-made furniture

loans.name: Gerardo Ignacio

texts.es:
I have lived in my home for more than five years. I would like to build a room in the back, since we only have two rooms and my mother lives with me and my two children. Space is very tight. I'm requesting a loan of $1,000 to build another room for my kids and so we're not uncomfortable at home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo ya más de 5 años viviendo en esta casa. "Me gustaría construir un cuartos en la parte de atrás de mi vivienda ya que solo tiene 2 recamaras y tengo dos hijos y vive con migo mi mama así que el espacio es muy reducido. Estoy solicitando un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls para construir un cuarto más para los niños y así no estar incómodos en la casa.

loans.use: Add a room to my home

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
With a lot of effort and hard work, I have been able to get a house. Thanks to God, my family has a solid roof of its head. The problem is that the house only has two rooms, and there are five people in my family, which is why I'm building another room at the front of the house. But I lack the funds to finish the job. I'm requesting a loan of $1,000 to do it.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo he podido sacar casa gracias a dios y mi familia tiene un techo seguro tengo un problema la vivienda es de solo 2 recamaras y somos 5 de familia por el cual estoy construyendo un cuarto en frente de la casa, me ase falta la loza para ya tenerlo terminado. Solicito $1,000.00 DLLS. Para la colocación de la loza.

loans.use: Add a room to my home

loans.name: Lucina

texts.es:
I would like nothing more than to see my house finished, but I have not been able to do it. I'm lacking bars for the windows and doors. I'm requesting a loan of $1,000 to finish the doors and windows before the cold and rainy season comes, since I have three children and I don't want them to get sick.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Me gustaria mucho ver termi nada ya mi casa pero no he podido, me falta los rejas en las ventans y puestas. Estoy solicitando un prestamo de $ 1,000.00 Dlls para la terminacion de ventanas y puertas antes de que se venga el frio y las lluvias ya que tengo 3 hijos y no quiero que se me enfermen.

loans.use: Put bars on my doors and windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his furniture stock

loans.name: Brigith Antonia

texts.es:
Brigith Antonia, 33, lives in a rented apartment with a signed lease and deposit. She lives with her husband and children in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz. Her husband is an artisan, making rag dolls and earrings. His income is very small, which is why she, with the help of a loan from Kiva partner IMPRO last December, started a business selling plastic goods, such as containers, etc. Currently the business is going very well, and she has repaid the first loan in full in a span of only six months. The loan she is now requesting will be used to increase her stock and give her clients a wider product selection. IMPRO describes her as an excellent client with a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Brigith Antonia vive en anticretico(una forma especial de alquilar o rentar una casa o departamento por un periodo de dos años; al principio del contrato anticretico se define el monto a cancelar y el mismo se cancela por anticipado, y al fin de los dos años, el dueño de casa, o sea el landlord, debe devolver la totalidad del monto menos gastos para arreglar la casa o departamento para un siguiente contrato). Ella vive con su esposo e hijos en la calle Caupolican de la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Brigith Antonia tiene 33 años de edad, el esposo es artesano y elabora muñecas de trapo, aretes de fantasía y su ingreso es muy pequeño, por lo cual ella con el apoyo de Impro, que le desembolso el primer crédito en Diciembre del año pasado para capital de arranque, pudo comenzar un negocio dedicado a la venta de plásticos, como ser bañadores, containers, etc. Actualmente el negocio va muy bien, así que el primer crédito ha sido cancelado en su totalidad, pues era solamente a seis meses plazo. El crédito que ahora solicita es para aumentar mercadería y poder seguir sirviendo a sus clientes con mejor variedad de productos. IMPRO califica a este cliente como excelente y con buen record de pagos.

loans.use: Increase stock and provide customers with a wider selection of plastic goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her food sales business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 58 years old, has one child, and has been a widow for five years. To maintain our households, she works selling pieces of chicken. With the loan, she wants to start a business selling vegetables from her home in order to attract customers. She belongs to the group “Chiflon 1”.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

MARGARITA TIENE 58 AÑOS, UN HIJO, HACE CINCO AÑOS QUE ES VIUDA Y PARA MANTENER SU CASA TRABAJA VENDIENDO POLLOS TROZADOS, CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE PONER UN NEGOCIO DE VERDURAS EN SU CASA PARA ATRAER A LOS COMPRADORES. PERTENECE AL GRUPO CHIFLON 1.

loans.use: Sales of chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband works in the fields, he drives a tractor. Maria travels to border with Guatemala and buys clothing in wholesale stores which he afterwards sells from her home to people in our community. She belongs to the group “Chiflon 1”, together with Mrs. Veronica Palacios Santiz (sales of perfumes and creams) and Mrs. Candelaria V. Ruiz (production and sales of cement blocks). With the loan, Maria will be able to buying more merchandise per trip, and so reduced in number of trips to border. Veronica will invest it in cosmetics and Candelaria will acquire a machine that speeds up the manufacturing process of cement blocks.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA TIENE 43 AÑOS, CASADA, UN HIJO, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO MANEJANDO UN TRACTOR. MARIA VIAJA A LA FRONTERA CON GUATEMALA Y COMPRA ROPA EN LAS TIENDAS DE MAYOREO Y POSTERIORMENTE LAS VENDE EN SU CASA A LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD, PERTENECE AL GRUPO CHIFLON 1 JUNTO CON DOÑA VERONICA PALACIOS SANTIZ (VENTA DE PERFUMES Y CREMAS) Y DOÑA CANDELARIA V. RUIZ (PRODUCCION Y VENTA DE BLOCKS DE CEMENTO). CON EL PRESTAMO MARIA VIAJARA Y COMPRARA MAS MERCADERIA PARA DISMINUIR LA CANTIDAD DE VIAJES A LA FRONTERA, VERONICA INVERTIRA EN COSMETICOS Y CANDELARIA ADQUIRIRA MAQUINARIA PARA ACELERAR EL PROCESO DE ELABORACION DE TABIQUES.

loans.use: Sales of clothing

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 31 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband works in the fields harvesting corn. She produces and sells tostadas in the market of the city of San Cristobal as an ambulant salesperson. She belongs to the group “Dulce 3” together with: Ortencia Alejandra Sanchez (who makes handcrafted shirts), Petra Maria Hernandez de la Cruz (who sells handcrafted clothing). Estela will invest her part of the loan to buy a more corn and firewood to increase her production. Ortencia and Petra will put their parts to get a to invest in thread, blankets, and doomed to lower their sourcing costs and therefore increase their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

ESTELA TIENE 31 AÑOS, CASADA, 1 HIJO, SU ESPOSOS TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZ. ELLA VENDE Y HACE TOSTADAS EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL COMO VENDEDORA AMBULANTE, PERTENECE AL GRUPO DULCE 3 JUNTO CON: ORTENCIA ALEJANDRA SANCHEZ (HACE BLUSAS Y CAMISAS ARTESANALES), PETRA MARIA HERNANDEZ DE LA CRUZ ( VENTA DE ROPA ARTESANAL). CON EL PRESTAMO ESTELA INVERTIRA SU PARTE COMPRANDO MAIZ Y LEÑA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION, ORTENCIA Y PETRA UNIRAN LA PARTE DE SUS PRESTAMOS PARA INVERTIR EN HILOS, MANTA Y TELARES PARA REBAJAR COSTOS DE COMPRA Y ASI AUMENTAR SUS GANANCIAS

loans.use: to sell tostadas

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu is a 41 year old resident of Sumgayit town. She is married with three children. She sells fruit of different kinds near the place where she lives. Her husband has a car and he buys fruit from wholesalers and sometimes he brings fruit from other regions. She has been in this business since 2003, together with her husband. They have little of their own funds and they need more funds to buy more fruit when her husband goes to other regions. Therefore, she is applying to Normicro Sumgayit branch for a loan for the first time. She needs $400.

loans.use: To increase the trading area

loans.name: Petra

texts.es:
Petra is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. She makes corn tostadas which she sells in the streets of the city of San Cristobal. With the loan she wants to buy firewood and corn to stock up and this way obtained better profits selling our products. She belongs to the group “Dulce 3” together with Mrs.Teresa Sanchez who cross-stitches blouses made of cloth which she sells in the city of San Cristobal de las Casas. With the loan, Mrs. Teresa will buy cloth and thread for cross-stitching.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

PETRA TIENE 48 AÑOS, CASADA, TRES HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES CAMPESINO. ELLA SE DEDICA HACER TOSTADAS DE MAIZ LAS CUALES LAS VENDE POR LAS CALLES DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL, CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE COMPRAR LEÑA Y MAIZ PARA ALMACENAR Y ASI OBTENER MAS GANANCIAS CON LA VENTA DE SUS PRODUCTOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO DULCE 3 JUNTO CON DOÑA TERESA SANCHEZ SANCHEZ LA CUAL TRABAJA BORDANDO BLUSAS DE MANTA LAS CUALES VENDE EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS. CON EL PRESTAMO DOÑA TERESA COMPRARA TELAS E HILOS PARA BORDAR.

loans.use: To sell tostadas

loans.name: Porfidia

texts.en:
Porfidia is 57 years old, married, and has eight children. Her husband works in the fields. She makes corn tostadas which she sells near the marketplace of the city San Cristobal de las Casas. She belongs to the group “Bambu 8” together with Mrs. Maria Luisa González Garcia (produces and sells bread). With the loan, Porfidia will buy more corn and firewood in large quantities, to reduce costs and increase her production. Maria Luisa will buy firewood, flour, Angus, artificial coloring, and aluminum pans to increase the production of bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

PORFIDIA TIENE 57 AÑOS, CASADA, OCHO HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO. ELLA SE DEDICA A HACER TOSTADAS DE MAIZ Y LAS VENDE EN LAS CERCANIAS DEL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS, PERTECECE AL GRUPO BAMBU 8 JUNTO CON DOÑA MARIA LUISA GONZALEZ GARCIA (HACE Y VENDE PAN). CON EL PRESTAMO PORFIDIA COMPRARA MAIZ, LEÑA EN CANTIDADES GRANDES PARA REBAJAR COSTOS Y AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION Y MARIA LUISA COMPRARA LEÑA, HARINA, HUEVOS, COLORANTES ARTIFICIALES, CHAROLAS DE ALUMINIO PARA ELABORAR Y AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION DEL PAN.

loans.use: To sell tostadas

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Gulnaz lives in Sumgayit town together with her husband and four children. She rents a booth where she sells mainly women's clothing. She has been engaged in this business since 1997. As she pays for the rented booth and has little of her own funds, her business needs investment. The variety of inventory to be sold in the booth is not high. She has applied to Normicro Sumgayit branch to get a loan in the amount of $500 to buy more inventory, develop the business, and in the future have her own booth or shop.

loans.use: To increase the variety of inventory

loans.name: Merida

texts.es:
Merida is married, 36 years old, and has five children. Her husband works in the fields harvesting corn. She makes shopping bags called “Morraletas: which she sells near the marketplace of the city of San Cristobal. She belongs to the group “Chijilte 7”. The other group members are: Maria del Socorro Gonzales (who sells Morraletas), Cecilia Ines Hernandez G. (who makes and sells Morraletas), and Carolina Elizabeth Hernandez (who sells candies from her home). Merida, Maria and Cecelia will buy plastics (the material the use to manufacture the Morraletas) and would to change the basis where they weave the bags. Carolina will buy a larger assortment of sweets to sell with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

MERIDA ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 5 HIJOS Y 36 AÑOS DE EDAD , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZELLA SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR BOLSAS DE COMPRAS (MORRALETAS ) Y LAS VENDE EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL EN LAS CERCANIAS DEL MERCADO. PERTENECE AL GRUPO CHIJILTE 7 . LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON : MARIA DEL SOCORRO GONZALEZ ( VENDE MORRALETAS ), CECILIA INES HERNANDEZ G. ( HACE Y VENDE MORRALETAS )Y CAROLINA ELIZABETH HERNANDEZ ( VENDE DULCES EN SU CASA ) MERIDA ,MARIA Y CECILIA VAN A COMPRAR PLASTICOS (QUE ES EL MATERIAL CON EL QUE CONFECCIONAN LAS MORRALETAS ) Y MADERAS PARA CAMBIAR LAS BASES DONDE TEJEN LAS BOLSAS . Y CAROLINA CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARA MAS VARIEDAD DE DULCES PARA VENDER.

loans.use: To sell bags

loans.name: Mabud

texts.en: Mabud is a young, 25 year old resident of Sumgayit town. He is already married and has one child. He rents a small place where he sells clothing of various kinds. He has been engaged in this business since 2003. He wants to develop his business and increase inventory to serve the needs of more people. He needs to invest in his business, and therefore he seeks a loan. He has applied to Normicro Sumgayit branch for a loan in the amount of $800.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo is 31 years old, married and has one child. Her husband works as a farmer. She has a grocery store at her home where her neighbors come to buy. She is part of the group “Chiflon 4”, together with: Magdalena Diaz Aguilar (who sells food and breakfast from home), Maricruz Gordillo Lopez (who sells shoes), and Petrona Hernandez Velasquez (who sells vegetables door-to-door). With the loan, they all want to invest in the purchase of merchandise for their businesses, and this way increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

CONSUELO TIENE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD , CASADA TIENE UN HIJO SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO CAMPESINO ELLA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA EN LA QUE COMPRAN SUS VECINOS DE LA COMUNIDAD . ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO CHIFLON 4 JUNTO CON : MAGDALENA DIAZ AGUILAR ( VENDE COMIDAS Y DESAYUNOS EN SU CASA ) MARICRUZ GORDILLO LOPEZ ( VENDE ZAPATOS )Y PETRONA HERNANDEZ VELASQUEZ (VENTA DE VERDURAS DE PUERTA EN PUERTA).CON EL PRESTAMO TODAS ESPERAN INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MERCADERIAS PARA SUS NEGOCIOS Y AUMENTAR ASI SUS INGRESOS

loans.use: Grocery Store
